A. is an active member of the Morlaquitas Communal Bank. She lives in the area of the city of Cuenca in the Sector de la Feria Libre. She is 45, and she has been divorced for 13 years. Her marital life was not what she hoped for. Her ex-husband attacked her physically and psychologically. Understanding never existed in her home. She has two children, 23 and 13. Her oldest son works in ETAPA (Municipal Business of Telecommunications, Potable Water, Sewage and Sanitation of Cuenca) and studies in the Professional Drivers Syndicate of Azuay. Her youngest son goes to the local school. They do not have they own house, so they live in a rented house. Luisa has been a stylist for several years. She has been in her place in the city of Cuenca for four years. She has been in the Quingeo parish for 20 years. She also has been selling women’s Yanbal beauty products for six years. She has her own customers, and it is going well for her in both activities. Luisa is one of the happiest members of her communal bank. She has worked with the foundation for five cycles. She says that the loans she got have helped her in the times of economic hardships she has encountered. They suggested, and she achieved making her business grow by increasing the Yanbal line of cosmetics. With the loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy more Yanbal products to increase the number of women’s, men’s, and children’s cosmetics in her business. Luisa’s big dream is that her son completes his post high school education. Soraya de Lourde Arízaga A. is another member of the Morlaquitas Communal Bank. She lives in San Pedro on the way to Racar in the city of Cuenca. She is 33, happily married, and has a daughter who is two years and seven months. Her husband works in the Cristal bottling plant, which allows him to provide for his household, while looking for the economic stability that they need. They do not have their own house, so they live in a rented house. Soraya sells Columbian clothing by catalog. She has been in this business for three years. Two months ago she opened a small store in her house. She says that it is going very well for her. She has a fixed customer base. She does this activity door to door in her neighborhood, providing her customers with the convenience of delivering and collecting payment in their home. She does this to give good service and get more customers. Two months ago she opened a small store in her house. Soraya is an enterprising and charismatic woman. She has a good relationship with her colleagues in the communal bank. She has been working with the bank for three cycles, and she affirms that the loans she has received have helped her maintain her clothing business and start her store. With the loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy products for her store, stock it with various lines, and give good service to her customers. Her biggest dream is to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like perfume, cosmetics, clothing for the entire family to increase their businesses

loans.name: Emeliza

texts.en:
Emeliza is 35 years old and a resident of Larion Bajo, Tuguegarao City. She works as a hog raiser and also helps her husband, a blacksmith, in making knives. She usually sells their products in Tuguegarao City and, sometimes, in other towns. The couple help one another in generating a larger income for their family, especially to support their children's education.

Emeliza is hardworking and she patiently maintains their small enterprises in order to improve their currently poor standard of living. For this reason, she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP to be used as additional business capital. Emeliza is grateful that she can help her parents with their basic needs through her income. She is hoping that their business will become successful someday so that she can give her family a comfortable standard of living.

loans.use: As additional capital for her manufacturing business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia Z. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tembladerani, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y sus tres hijos.
La señora Virginia es comerciante de productos como licuadoras, edredones, chompas, sabanas, que ofrece principalmente en oficinas de la ciudad y su esposo es empleado de una oficina pública de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar los productos que la señora Virginia ofrece e incrementar sus ingresos por el fin de año.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia Z. lives in her own house in the Tembladerani zone, west of the City of La Paz, with her husband and her 3 children. Virginia is a merchant of products such as blenders, eiderdowns, sweaters, and sheets, offered principally in city offices. Her husband is employed in a public office of this city. Their family is maintained by their incomes.

The solicited loan is to augment the products that Virginia offers and to increase their incomes for the end of the year.

This is the sixth time they have solicited a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies them favorably, granting access to the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY PRODUCTS SUCH AS BLENDERS, EIDERDOWNS, SWEATERS, AND SHEETS TO SELL

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 37 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos, en su casa propia. 
En su juventud se dedicaba sólo a la siembra y cuidado de sus plantaciones de café y plátanos, pero ahora con el apoyo de su esposo, desde hace 10 años, implementó una tienda de comestibles en un espacio pequeño de su casa, donde vende abarrotes de primera necesidad, enlatados y bebidas
Luz atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, de ese modo ha ganado clientes, quienes le piden más productos, pero por falta de dinero no puede comprarlos, es por ello que recurre  a este crédito para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega, y así seguir siendo un apoyo económico para sus hijos y esposo. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde ha ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente cada uno sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz, 37, lives with her partner, the father of her 4 children, in her own home. When she was younger all she did was farm and tend to her coffee and baN. crops. But now, with her husband's help, for the past 10 years she has run a small grocery store from a small area of her house. She sells basic needs items, canned goods and beverages. She waits on customers from 6am until 9pm. She has acquired customers who ask for more products but, because of lack of funds, she has been unable to get them. This is why she now has requested financing to increase the available stock in her shop in order to continue to be an economic support for her children and husband. This is her second loan with MFP and she promisses to make her repayments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a Sewing Machine

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Mitchel S. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Mitchel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mitchel makes and sells snacks and other delicacies. She used to buy and selling bananas. Mitchel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mitchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mitchel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase the ingredients to make the food that she sells. This will be Mitchel's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophon S., age 34, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Phoung (pictured with his wife), age 36, have been married since 1996 and have one son and two daughters. They live approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophon has been selling fish for seven years. She buys fish from market near her house and transports them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Mr. Sophal Phoung assists his wife in the business.

Sophon is applying for a loan of $1,000 in order to build a concrete and brick room under her wooden house.

loans.use: To build a concrete and brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 32 years old. Married with five children, Agnes works to support her husband economically. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a mining community. Agnes trades in pasties (meat pies). She prepares the pasties and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for nine years and wants to give her business a facelift. Agnes requests a loan to procure bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Kiddawalime Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Joyce is 52 years old and a widow with 7 children, who also takes care of 5 orphans. Joyce has had businesses managing a bar as well as having rentals in Bulindo for 4 years, and she is happy that she is able to make 50,000/= as profits a week.

Joyce says that although she has inadequate capital, she ensures that she takes care of her customers, hence prospering. Her goal is to ensure that she accesses school fees for her children and with the loan, she hopes to expand her businesses by buying more crates of beers, wine, and sodas for sale.

loans.use: Buying more beers, wine, and sodas for resale

loans.name: El Exito Group

texts.es: Son un grupo de personas que viven a las orillas del pueblo de Momostenango, Las personas integrantes del grupo se dedican mayormente  al comercio a la venta  de ropa, venta de cosmeticos y las otras integrantes se dedican a la venta de comida otras personas se dedican a la elaboracion de hilos para pañuelos, y se determino que tienen capacidad para solventar dicho compromiso con la Asociación,  ya  que el préstamo les permitirá mejorar el negocio que cada uno tiene, con el financiamiento en ASDIR ayudará a incrementar el capital que manejan, esto permite que pueden crecer de una buena manera con el negocio con la que cuentan, en el lugar donde residen estas personas no cuentan con accesos para los prestamos por tal razón han acudido a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un prestamo con el fin de poder ayudar a mejorar la economia de cada una de sus familias, y tener mejores conodiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This is a group of people who live on the outskirts of the village of Momostenango. Most of the members of the group sell clothing and cosmetics. Others sell food, and still others manufacture threads for handkerchiefs. The association has determined that they have the means to enter into this commitment, since this loan will help them better their businesses. The financing through ASDIR will help them increase their working capital and allow them to grow. They don't have access to any other loans and for this reason they have approached ASDIR to help them grow their business, which will give their families better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Thérése Bousso

texts.en:
Thérése Bousso G. is a 68-year-old widow who lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for thirteen years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Thérése raises sheep which she sells in the market, an activity very common in her village since there is a grand agricultural market in nearby Bambey. This loan allows her to buy eleven lambs.

loans.use: To purchase eleven lambs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 33 years old and is married, with two children who go to school. She runs a retail shop where she sells general merchandise such as maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She has been in this business since 2004. She also sells foodstuff, such as chips, next to her retail shop. Together with her husband’s salary, they are able to meet their family's basic needs and pay school fees for their children. She is a very hardworking and focused lady. She previously took out a loan of 60,000 KES, which she used to expand her business and repaid successfully. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to stock maize flour, bags of sugar, potatoes, and firewood.

loans.use: To stock sugar, maize flour, potatoes, and firewood for cooking

loans.name: Verónica Agustina

texts.es: Verónica Agustina D. D.
texts.en: 41-year old Verónica Agustina D. D.

loans.use: to buy meat and basic necessities

loans.name: Business People Group

texts.en:
Paul D. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Business People. He is 44 years old, married with 4 children who range from 10 to 18 years old. He also cares for a sibling. Paul is a high school graduate but could not continue education through college due to lack of support.

For 2 years he has been selling mobile phone rechargeable cards and exchanging local currency to United States Dollars at the Jacob Town Chicken Farm in Paynesville, Liberia. Paul started business with help from his father who gave him some money to do business.

He faces a problem because of other competitors who do business close to his business site. Paul keeps his business environment clean in order to keep customers returning. His goal and dream is to expand his business into other communities. Paul needs this loan to purchase more rechargeable cards and increase the size of his business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Paul is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cards and increase his business.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a farmer from Western Kenya in the town of Kitale. He is 34 years old and married, with six children aged 2 to 12 years old. Four of the children are currently in school. He has been farming for 13 years and selling his milk, maize, and poultry to the local market. He also earns income from selling timber to the local market.

Harrison recently completed his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES, which he used to start a poultry project. He has requested this second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES to expand the project. He says the income from this loan will help him improve the living standards of his family. His main challenge has been poultry diseases, which, if not treated, can cause mass death of chickens. In the future, Harrison intends to buy more dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. is 16 and married. She has a 1 year-old child.  She is starting a business selling fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam. Mary needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Mary joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan from SPBD. SPBD's loans are Mary's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Destiny Women Group

texts.en:
Kemah Togba, who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Destiny Women. She is 60 years old, widowed and has nine children, who range from 22 to 41 years old.  She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty. 

For more than 10 years, she has been selling used clothes and shoes at Red Light Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more used clothes and shoes. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

Her goal is to improve and expand her business and open many shops.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes and shoes

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor Divino y durante el tiempo que es socia aprendió a ahorrar.
Herlinda es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella y están estudiando, Herlinda vende pescado en el mercado Covadonga, vende pescado fresco y congelado, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, sus productos los compra de los mayoristas, Herlinda los demás días trabaja en una casa de cuidados de menores.
Herlinda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Herlinda sueña con construir el segundo piso de su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Herlinda belongs to the Divine Love Communal Bank and during the time that she has been an associate she has learned to save. Herlinda is married and has 4 children of which 2 live with her and are students. Herlinda sells fish in the Covadonga market. She sells frozen and fresh fish, an activity that she performs on Saturdays and Sundays. She buys her products from wholesalers. Herlinda works on weekdays in a child daycare center. Herlinda needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of fish. Herlinda dreams of building the second story of her house and offering a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Porfirio Israel

texts.es: El señor Porfirio es un hombre muy trabajador, el y su esposa se dedican a la elaboración y venta de quesos. Son una familia muy unida y tienen muchas ganas de hacer que el negocio familiar crezca y vender en mas lugares, para incrementar sus ganancias. El señor Porfirio tiene dos niños pequeños y se preocupa por su educación, el quiere formar el patrimonio de sus hijos y requiere de este crédito para la compra de mas material para elaborar los quesos, el agradece su ayuda de antemano.
texts.en:
Sr. Porfirio is a hardworking gentleman. He and his wife make and sell cheese. They are a very close family. To generate more income, Porfirio wants to grow his business and sell in more places. He has two small children and is concerned about their education and providing them with an inheritance.

Porfirio is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for making cheeses and expresses his appreciation in advance for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making cheese

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Antonio C. C., tiene la edad de 47 años vive en el barrio La Borgoña y su esposa se dedica a realzar los trabajos del hogar y le apoya en las labores del campo, él es agricultor desde hace 21 años y su actividad ha sido el sustento económico de toda su familia, ellos tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y dos adolecentes que así mismo le ayudan en las tareas de la finca.

La afectación de las plagas no ha permitido en este año una buena cosecha, esto ha afectado su economía doméstica, y es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para dar un mejor mantenimiento a los sembradillos y que la producción aumenté presentándole a futuro un mejor volúmenes en las ventas con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida y ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Roberto Antonio C. C. is 47 and lives in the La Borgoña neighbourhood. His wife does the housework and helps him with work in the field. He has been a farmer for 21 years, and this has been the source of income for his whole family. They have 4 children, of whom 2 are grown and two are adolescents who also help with the farm work. Plagues prevented a good harvest this year, and this has affected the family's finances. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to provide better maintenance to his plants, so that production will increase, providing him with greater sales volume in the future. His goal is to improve their quality of life and offer his family better economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: better crop maintenance

loans.name: Sisters United Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the members of the “Sisters United” group. They are women with small-scale businesses in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 5,700,000 in order to further develop their businesses.

The leader of this group is thirty-three-year-old Bondu M. who was born in Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a police officer and the couple has four children – three in primary school and the last not yet of school-going age.

Bondu, who has been a businesswoman for ten years now, is the owner of a small grocery shop where she sells provisions: sardines, milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, bread, etc. She also sells market food such as rice (the country’s staple food), salt, onions, Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), etc.

With the help of this loan, Bondu will buy more of the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more sardines, milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, bread, rice, salt, onions, Margi, etc.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong T. T. N. is 30 years old. She has a shop that sells construction materials such as steel, cement, bricks, etc. She makes 4,000,000 dong (VND) profit from it. She has been attending a credit program since 2007, and she has used loans effectively and repaid well. Currently, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more products to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane A. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 58 years old. Maryjane is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maryjane owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Maryjane has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maryjane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryjane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maryjane is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Maryjane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 50 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija mejor, quien es motivo de todo su esfuerzo. Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado apoyando a su madre en la venta de pollos, con el tiempo su madre viajó al extranjero, haciéndose cargo entonces del negocio. Su trabajo inicia muy temprano por la mañana, con la recepción de pollos de su proveedor y a las 8:00 de la mañana arranca su día laborar atendiendo amablemente a su clientela, que en su mayoría son amas de casa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la comunicación amena que tiene con los clientes. Lleva más de 36 años en esta actividad; por lo que espera comprarse una camioneta para iniciar en el negocio de distribución de pollos a varios puntos de ventas.  Es su 25avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro y mayor cantidad. Es una persona muy responsable de su grupo comunal, por lo que es muy querida y respetada por el resto de las socias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para abastecerse de cantidad de pollos para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María, age 50, is a very jovial mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her youngest daughter.  Her daughter is the motivation for all of her efforts.

From a very early age María worked helping her mother sell chickens.  In time, her mother traveled abroad leaving María in charge of the business.  Her work starts very early in the morning when she gets the chickens from her provider.  At 8:00 in the morning she starts her work day of kindly waiting on her customers.  Most of her customers are housewives.  What she likes most about her work is the pleasant conversations she has with her customers.  She has been doing this for over 36 years.

She hopes to buy a truck for her business to start distributing chickens to various sales locations.  This is her 25th loan with MFP.  She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to access another loan for a larger amount.

She is a very responsible person with her communal bank.  She is admired and respected by the other members.  She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise.  She will stock more chickens in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To stock up on chickens

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin Q. is married and has one son. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Elchin has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of food items. With a starting capital of $200 USD, he began this enterprise a year ago. Over time he has expanded his business and today this business has become a family operation, as his wife is also engaged in it.

Today Elchin needs to buy additional food items to increase the range of goods he has for sale. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push every once in a while to achieve his goals and to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Buwenge Kisa Kya Mukama Womens Development-Jinja Group

texts.en:
Buwenge Kisa Kya mukama is the group that 45-year-old K. Aisha is affiliated with. She has been relentless in the smooth overseeing of her five-year-old fish selling business. This has meant that she has summoned up of a lot of determination. She says all bets are off as to whether she will achieve long term success. 

The Buwenge neighborhood where she operates is a melting pot of fish-buying traders.  It goes without saying that this is a highly lucrative business from which she says she has benefited quite a lot. Aisha is happily married with eight kids. To set forth in this business she had to bank on profits from her agro-produce business. Prior to that she was more inclined toward a timber-selling business. At present, she has a side poultry business. 

$66 is what she says she makes in a week. With this loan, Aisha says she is going to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more fish for resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of spare parts (shocks, wheel springs, bearings, etc.) for taxi

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
If we want more in life, we need to expect more. Vilma M., one of CCT's community partners, not only sets high expectations but also takes concrete steps to achieve them. Vilma, 48, graduated from college and is married to Diomedes, a Philippine National Police (PNP) officer. Together they have four children, one of whom does not yet attend school. The three others are already studying.  The family lives in Pasay City, Philippines.

Vilma runs both a carinderia (street-side food stall) and a sari-sari (variety) store. She caters to the physical needs of her neighbors with cooked meals and retail items like soap, shampoo, and seasonings, among others. Every day, Vilma earns around PHP350 with these two small-scale enterprises.

To help her continue operating her businesses, Vilma would like to apply for a PHP17,000 loan. She will use the money to keep her carinderia in good shape and to replenish the stocks in her sari-sari store. Vilma envisions transforming the small store into a big grocery. Vilma also wants to raise chickens and pigs for additional income.

Vilma does not highlight her trials but keep focusing on her expected outcomes. Ultimately, she wants to see her family's home renovated and her children graduating from college.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Replenishment of product stocks

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica C. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Veronica is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a business venture in the food sector butchering and selling meat in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the market. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to buy pigs for butchering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Veronica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy pigs to butcher into pork & sell

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina A. is from the town of Sikatuna. She is 47 years old. Agripina is married and has three children. To make a living, Agripina runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Agripina also plants and harvests vegetables in her backyard. 

Agripina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agripina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Agripina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to buy fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. María se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en un pasaje centrico de la ciudad de Quillacollo, atiende todos los días desde muy temprano, le colabora en la venta de abarrotes su hija durante sus vacaciones su familia esta compuesta por su esposo quien trabaja como empleado en la fabrica de refrescos, sus hijos de diez y seis años y su hija de doce años, la señora a demostrado puntualidad en el pago de su anterior crédito, solicita el crédito como capital de trabajo para compra de mercadería por las fiestas de fin de año ya que  desea comprar abarrotes, como fideos, azúcar, aceite, etc. Es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sra. Maria operates a grocery business in a centrally-located area of the city of Quillacollo.  She works at the store every day, from very early in the morning.  Her daughter helps her with the business during her vacations.  Maria's husband works for a soft drinks manufacturer and they have two boys, ten- and six-years old, and a daughter, twelve-years old.  Maria has a history of repaying past loans on time.  She is applying for a loan to collect working capital for her business.  She wants to buy grocery products such as pasta, sugar, cooking oil, etc.  Maria is a hard-working person and grateful for the help that she's received from the institution.

loans.use: Working capital for grocery business.

loans.name: George William

texts.en: K. George William is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 38 years old and married with 5 children ranging in age from 1 to 15. He is involved in the sale of matooke from Rutabo / Bwizi. George says that his customers are mostly daily home customers and transporters from Kampala. He has been in the business for over 4 years and he is able to make 30,000 UGX as weekly profits. He also owns a motorcycle that he rides and hires out sometimes to contribute to his daily income. He hopes for a stable family and a financially growing business in the future.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Chhi's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income people who live in Siem Reap province. Chhi T., age 41, has been chosen as leader of the group. She is divorced, has three children and makes a living by selling fish. She earns a profit of about $2 a day and will use her portion of this loan to buy more fish to sell. 

There are three other people in this loan group: 
Mrs. T. makes a living fishing and will use her portion of this loan to buy more equipment.
Mrs. K. will use this loan to buy a used motorbike in order to replace a one.
Mrs. R. is applying for a loan to buy equipment which will allow her to catch more fish.

loans.use: To help expand four small businesses.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana Martínez es una gran comerciante de muchos productos,  usted la puede encontrarla vendiendo desde cosméticos, pasando por carnes fría hasta  refrescos y útiles de higiene y de aseo personal. Su inspiración emprendedora fue porque sintió la necesidad de generar ingresos al hogar  y cuando no conseguía trabajo como empleada  formal, decidió vender mercancías  y le ha ido tan bien, que todas sus expectativas están asociadas al crecimiento de su negocio, para conseguir en compañía de su esposo  sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos,  que están en las edades de 5 a 22 años de edad. Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprará colonias, champús desodorante y talcos, con ello planea lograr incrementar su capital de trabajo responder a perdidos realizados por sus clientes y seguir cosechando compradores que se conviertan en sus fieles clientes. Su gran desafío es tener algún día un local propio y terminar el condicionamiento de su vivienda, para lograr una mejor imagen y exhibición de sus productos.
texts.en:
Viviana Martínez is a great merchant of many products.  She can be found selling from cosmetics, through cold cuts, to beverages and personal hygiene and personal cleaning supplies.  Her enterprising inspiration came when she needed to generate family income and couldn’t find formal employment.  She decided to sell merchandise and has done well.  All of her expectations are associated with the growth of her business so that together with her husband she can support her five children whose ages range from 5 to 22 years.

She will use her Kiva loan, which is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy colognes, shampoos, deodorants and talc.  She plans thereby to increase working capital to meet pending customer orders and continue acquiring buyers who will become regular customers.  Her great challenge is to someday have a locale of her own and to finish furnishing her home to attain a better image and exposure of her products.

loans.use: To buy colognes, shampoos, deodorants and talcs.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 35 years old and lives with her retired mother in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in an apartment that they bought in 2005. She graduated from the National University of Mongolia as a lawyer and established her legal advice and advocacy center in 2001. She has been operating her business for 12 years while earning her Master's degree in 2005. 

Oyunchimeg currently rents the place where she operates her business. She has gained a lot of experience in this field. She is a hard-working and polite person who says, "I like to help others. By operating my legal advice center, I assist many people to deal with every kind of problem while supporting my family." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy furniture and office equipment for her workplace.

loans.use: To buy furniture and office equipment for her legal advice center.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Jackline has a restaurant. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Jackline sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. 

Jackline has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, beans and maize flour. She also generates additional income through selling milk. 

The main business challenges for Jackline include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only. 

Jackline lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beef, beans and maize flour

loans.name: Gregoire

texts.en:
Gregoire H. is 45 years old, married, and has two children between 9 and 14 years old. He also takes care of one child who is 12 years old. Gregoire earns a living by selling second hand items, such as sheets and men`s, women's, and children's clothing.  He has been in this business for 20 years. His business is well-organized.  Gregoire works from 7 am to 7 pm every day except Saturday and he employs one person to help him. 

Gregoire is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more second hand items to sell. By expanding his business, Gregoire hopes to earn more profits.  With the profits, he will save for the future and reinvest in the business. Thus, he will create another job for the people in his community.

loans.use: To purchase second hand items to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Evelyn is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap & firewood in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & firewood. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & firewood

location.town: Palao, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Siyazama Group

texts.en:
Sizakele (pictured on the far right in a white shirt) is a 53-year-old woman. She and her husband have two children who are 17 and 22. They currently attend school.

She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Emandini in South Africa and sells live chickens and cold drinks at her home. She explains that she has been in this business for three years. Her main business challenge is dealing with customers who do not want to pay on time after they purchase on credit, and facing the death of chickens when it's very hot or cold. 

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) and Kiva to buy live chickens and cold drinks. She will use the extra income to send her children to tertiary. In the future, she sees her business growing and having a farm. 

She commented that it would be good if WDB could give them money on an individual basis because groups give problems of delaying payment while she has finished her last repayment and wants to borrow money again.

loans.use: To buy live chickens and cold drinks.

loans.name: Muhammadi

texts.ru: Мухаммад проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 22 года. Холост. Живет вместе с матерью и сестрами. Его мама инвалид, а отец умер три года назад. Он один работает в семье. Он занимается животноводством. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности  занимается  уже год. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Muhammadi lives in Hamadoni. He is 22 years old and single. He lives with his mother and sisters. His mother is an invalid, and his father died three years ago. He is the only one working in the family. He works in animal husbandry. He earns money by raising cattle. Basically he breeds cattle for sale. He has been doing this work for a year.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Parsitau Ole

texts.en:
Parsitau is 38 years old. He is married and has two children, aged four and six. Parsitau has been working in the livestock trading business for seven years. He sells livestock to butchers to the KMC, Kajiado, and Kitengela markets. Parsitau describes himself as hardworking.

Parsitau has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more livestock for his business. This will include two cows, five goats, and five sheep. This will be Parsitau’s second loan with KADET. He has been a good client who repays his loan well. 

Parsitau plans to use the proceeds from his loan to buy a truck to transport livestock to the market. In the future, he hopes to start supplying more livestock to surrounding markets.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos, todos trabajan en el hogar y él inicio el negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposa, no tiene un horario fijo, y tiene un buen record como comerciante, ha trabajado con créditos que son los que le han permitido alcanzar crecimiento.
Él Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa tanto para hombres y mujeres, como camisetas, blusas, pantalones, esta inversión le ayudara a mantenerse en el negocio contando con todo lo necesario para los clientes.
Para él, crecer y ser un empresario exitoso es su mayor deseo, aumentando  la clientela y alcanzando una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Tomas is a clothes salesman.  He lives with his wife and they have two children.  All the members of his household work.  Tomas started this business with the support of his wife.  He does not work fixed hours and he has a good record as a salesman.  He has worked with loans which have allowed him to grow his business.

Tomas is currently requesting a loan to buy men's and women's clothes such as t-shirts, blouses and pants.  This investment will help him to stay in business as he will have everything he needs for his customers.

Tomas' biggest wish is to grow and be successful as a businessman, increasing his number of customers and achieving better financial solvency.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (t-shirts, blouses and pants)

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Teresita has a shop that sells breads, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. Teresita has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more products for her store.  For the future, she hopes to improve her business.

Teresita became a member of HSPFI this year.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: María Leidy

texts.es:
Generar ingresos propios después de separarse de su esposo con el fin de cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de sus dos hijos impulsaron a María Leidy a crear su propio negocio, venta de mercancía especialmente de máquinas de afeitar para hombre, las cuales distribuye en diferentes municipios de Antioquia. 

Para María Leidy este negocio es su única fuente de empleo y aunque se siente bendecida por trabajar desde su casa, se ve enfrentada a dificultades que en ocasiones no le permite generar las ganancias necesarias pues algunos clientes no le pagan. 

En el futuro, esta emprendedora espera convertirse en una gran distribuidora de todo tipo de mercancía para cacharrerías; por ahora necesita de un préstamo para usarlo como capital de trabajo, pues a sus clientes les da plazo de 30 días para pagar y actualmente necesita comprar más surtido para cumplir con los pedidos.
texts.en:
The need to earn her own income in order to meet her and her two children's basic needs after separating from her husband inspired María Leidy to create her own business. She sells razors for men, which she distributes throughout various municipalities in Antioquia.

Her business is María Leidy's only source of employment and even though she feels blessed to work from home, she faces difficulties in that there are occassions in which she doesn't earn enough income because some customers do not pay her.

In the future, this enterprising woman hopes to sell all types of pots and cookware, but now she needs a loan for working capital, as customers are given 30 days to pay and right now she needs to increase her supplies to meet demand.

loans.use: to buy men's razors

loans.name: G.s. El Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: La señora Yanilda Del Carmen tiene 31 años. Ella se dedica al comercio de prendas de oro y plata. Algo que la ha afectado es la situación económica que atraviesa nuestro país debido a la falta de empleo. Aduce que su condición de vida en la familia ha mejorado ya que ha podido incrementar un poco los ingresos del hogar ya que ahora no solo su esposa trabaja. Yessica tiene 28 años. Su actividad es la venta de ropa usada y nueva. Ella desea establecer su propio negocio en su casa con vitrinas y más estabilidad, por lo que ese es su sueño. Candida Rosa tiene 27 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Su negocio que es la venta de verduras y frutas  y además de ello posee una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Josefina tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y aun no tiene hijos. El crédito es para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, leche, sopas. Sus éxitos recientes es que ha podido levantar su negocio con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Yanilda Del Carmen, 31, sells gold and silver items.  Something that has affected her is the economic situation the country is going through due to the lack of employment.  She feels that her family situation has improved a bit because she’s been able to increase household income somewhat since now it’s not just her husband who works.

Yessica is 28 years old.  She sells used and new clothes.  She wants to set up her own home-based business with display cases and more stability; this is her dream.

Cándida Rosa es 27 years old.  She has four minor children.  Her business is fruit and vegetable sales and she also has a small home-based grocery store.

Josefina is 27 years old, married and has no children yet.  The loan is to buy snacks, basic grains, milk, and soups.  Her recent successes are due to her being able to launch the business thanks to the loans.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 38 years old and married with three children. For the past two years, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income selling food. Fe works hard to support her family and has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF.

Fe is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy merchandise to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other items in her sari-sari store. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz  is 40 years old and married with three children. She started her poultry business 8 years ago. The reason why she started her business was her husband`s small salary as a school teacher. The business brought her family additional income. Her monthly profit is 300 USD. Her uncle helps her with her business.  Gulnaz usually sells chickens and turkeys to the local vendors, and her uncle takes poultry once per three months to the central bazaar. 
Gulnaz would like to expand her business to improve the living conditions of her family. For this purpose she applied for 1500 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Las Nicaragüenses Group

texts.es:
El grupo las nicaragüenses lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras, originarias de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Nemesia quien se dedica al destace de cerdo y la producción de sus derivados frito, chicharrón, moronga, nacatamal…etc. 

Con el crédito ella comprará cerdo para su negocio y materia prima maíz, chiltoma, cebolla, leña…etc.

Las otras integrantes son Ana Rosa tiene una pulpería en su casa y Ana del Socorro tiene una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
The "Las Nicaragüenses" group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women, who are originally from Masaya.

The group coordinator is Señora Nemesia, who works in pork butchering and making pork products: scratchings, blood sausage, nacatamal (corn, meat and rice in a banana leaf), etc.

With the loan, she will buy pigs for her business and raw ingredients such as corn, sweet peppers, onions, firewood, etc.

The other members are Ana Rosa, who has a small general store in her home, and Ana del Socorro, who has a small general store.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra. Trinidad es una persona muy trabajadora la  cual  labora   en una maquiladora  de  la  ciudad , esto  le  permitió  adquirir  su  vivienda   pero  debido  a  el descuento  realizado  para  el  pago de  su casa   se  vio en la necesidad  de autoemplearse  dedicándose  a la   venta de  productos  naturista en  el   cual  le   a   ido  favorablemente   y le   a permitido  seguir adelante   día  con día,  es  por  ello  que  en este  momento   ella  requiere  realizar  la  compra  de  mercancía para  tener  los productos  disponibles  para  sus  clientes   ya  que  ella se  preocupa  por  brindarles  el  excelente  servicio  que  la  a caracterizado.
texts.en:
Sra. Trinidad is a hardworking individual who is employed at a factory in the city. This allowed her to acquire a home because her house payments can be deducted from her paycheck. She also saw the need to become self-employed, so she decided to sell natural products and has achieved favorable results. This has enabled her to move forward each day.

For this reason, Trinidad needs to buy merchandise so that she can have products at her disposal to sell to her customers. She is concerned with providing the excellent service for which she is known.

loans.use: to buy natural products to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She helps to pay utility bills as a way of assisting her husband. 
Aba sells gari and charcoal at Elmina. In the picture, she is standing close to the gari she sells. Her loan will be used to buy bags of gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Aibek

texts.en:
Aibek is 26 years old and lives with his mother and sister in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His mother is a nurse in a local hospital and his sister is a college student. 

Aibek started his local transport business in 2008 by using his pick-up truck.  He also buys old salvaged cars and sells their parts.  He is highly skilled in his businesses. He is a talented young man who says "I am good what I am doing and I need some support to expand my business."   He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy a salvaged SUV.

loans.use: buy a salvaged SUV

loans.name: Maida Veronica

texts.es:
Maida es de Ciudad del Este, está casada con el señor Reinaldo, tienen un hijo pequeño de 1 año, son personas muy  jóvenes, con muchas ansias de progreso.            
Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropas varias en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, se inicio en la actividad con un dinero que junto de otros trabajos anteriores y un poco de dinero con lo que la ayudo marido. Comenta que además de ese trabajo que hace, busca el tiempo para poder estudiar.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, bermudas y otros, los cuales son muy solicitados en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Maida is from Ciudad del Este.  She’s married to Reinaldo and they have a little one-year old son.  They are young people with a strong desire to make progress.    

She has a small clothing sales business in the city’s municipal market.  She started this activity with some money she’d saved up from previous jobs and with a bit of money her husband helped her with.  She comments that besides the work she does she also looks for time to be able to study.

She is a very responsible person who very much wants to self-improve.  She has a jovial, entrepreneurial spirit.  No doubt she will reach all the goals she’s set for herself.

She’s asking for the loan to buy articles of clothing like pants, shirts, t-shirts, Bermuda shorts and others which are very sought after in this season.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en: Khasan is a successful businessman with a good history as a client. He was able to grow his business from small to large. Now, he is selling detergents and other home washing items. He is married and has four children. Khasan has six years of experience in trading. This business brings him a stable income and his monthly profit is 300 AZN. He would like to expand his business. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. This will be his fourth loan from AqroInvest and he promises to pay back on time.

loans.use: to purchase more items in order to increase profits

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 55 year old man. He is married with two sons and three daughters, and is a school employee with a decent salary. 

Ahmad wants to finish paying the university fees for his two sons who are studying French language and social studies. For this reason, Ahmad needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ahmad gets the loan, he will pay the university fees for his two sons. This will enable them to complete their studies and get their first degree. 

By getting this loan, Ahmad will be able to change his family life positively. He will offer his sons the opportunity to work and live in better conditions in the future. Ahmad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his two sons.

loans.name: Tagavuma

texts.en:
Tagavuma is applying for another loan to renovate her house that got demolished during the rainy season. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase building blocks and renovate her house which got demolished during the rains. In the future, Tagavuma aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Tagavuma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase building blocks and renovate her house which got demolished during the rains.

loans.name: Alba Nidia

texts.es: La señora Alba Nidia a sus 48 años de edad es madre de una hija de 20 años de edad. La señora Alba Nidia es una emprendedora quien desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos. Por varios años, la señora Alba Nidia trabajo como empleada en varios almacenes por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el sector. La señora Alba Nidia requiere de la compra de lociones, cosméticos y accesorios femeninos con el fin de tener surtido para la temporada de fin de año. Con lo anterior, la señora Alba Nidia podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Alba Nidia es tener su propio almacén de venta de ropa y accesorios para toda la familia.
texts.en: Alba Nidia is 48 years old and is the mother of a 20-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneur who would like to start her own business selling merchandise to her family members, friends and neighbors. For many years, she worked as an employee at a number of stores, so she has experience in the sector. Alba Nidia needs to buy lotions, cosmetics and accessories for women, so that she can stock a variety of merchandise for the holiday season. With this purchase, Alba Nidia will be able to earn more and improve her family's quality of life. Alba Nidia's dream is to own her own store to sell clothing and accessories for the whole family.

loans.use: buy various products such as body lotion, cosmetics and women's accessories

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Martine est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Martine est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Martine vend depuis onze ans, divers produits (condiments et conserves) à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Martine  vend de la nourriture (haricot préparé). Martine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Martine contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Martine sollicite un dixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les neuf premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Martine is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a cook, Joseph. The couple has four children to support, who are all in school. They also look after another child. The children are all living at home with their parents and the couple both contribute to household costs. 

For 11 years, Martine has been selling various products (condiments and tinned goods) to help meet the family's needs. In addition to this business, Martine sells food (prepared beans). She buys her supplies in a market in Benin. 

Martine is able to contribute to her family's various expenses thanks to the income from her business. In order to respond to her customers' growing needs, Martine has requested a tenth loan from Alidé. Her previous nine loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy various products (tinned goods, sauce, condiments, oil, trays of eggs, etc.).

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa, tiene 45 años, se dedica a la venta de frutas, es madre de 6 hijos,  desde que esta en Finca Perú ha progresado mucho esta muy feliz porque aprendió como llevar un buen negocio, aprendió a ahorrar y se encuentra muy satisfecha con el apoyo que le brindaron. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de frutas.
texts.en: Teresa is a member of the Smile Communal Bank; she is 45 years old and sells fruits. She is a mother to 6 children and since she has been a member of Finca Perú she has progressed a great deal and is very happy as she learned how to have a good business, save and is very happy with the support that she has received. The loan will be used to buy fruits.

loans.use: buy fruits.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Kuña Pyapy Mbarete es el grupo formado en ciudad del este, por 22 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que ven el la fundación paraguaya un lugar de ayuda a ellas, ya que no cualquiera las quisieron ayudar. Actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo del programa de la fundación y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel y de esa forma poder salir adelante.
Edilda es una mujer, cuyo ejemplo de trabajo motiva a las demás. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, y por sobre todo muy amable. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace ya un tiempo, y gracias a esto ha podido formarse ya una clientela bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella al igual que sus compañeras se encuentran muy felices dentro del programa de la fundación.
texts.en:
“Kuña Pyapy Mbarete” is the group formed in Ciudad del Este by 22 women who are friends and neighbors in this city.  They are all heads of household who see Fundación Paraguaya as a help for them since no one else wanted to help them.  They are currently in the sixth cycle in the Fundación’s program and they want to reach the maximum level in order to get ahead this way.

Edilda is a woman whose work is an example for the rest of them.  She is a very responsible, hardworking woman but, above all, very nice.  She comments that she’s been selling cosmetics for quite some time now and thanks to this has been able to secure a well-defined, regular clientele.

She’s asking for the loan to buy cosmetics to fill customer orders.  She and her fellow members are very happy in the Fundación’s program.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 40 years old, single, and has two children. She has been selling cereals for six years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

Violet is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize and beans.

loans.name: Milva

texts.en:
Milva is 34 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

Milva has a motorcycle and earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan to purchase motorcycle parts.

Milva has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Milva hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
Edith, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of  farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 48 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Edith likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Edith plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Edith’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate  acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Victoria Viatriz

texts.en:
My name is Victoria T., and I make and sell tortillas. I’ve had my business for five years. My son helps me with the packing and distributing. I have several clients since my store is near a bus station. With my income, I can support my family. My goal is to increase inventory so I can produce more. That way, I can remodel my store (located in my home), and provide a decent education for my kid.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, lime, salt, water, wood, matches, charcoal.

Mi nombre es Victoria T. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años cuento con la ayuda de mi hijo para empacar y repartir mi producto, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo cerca de una estacion de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa de habitacion) y darle un estudio digno a mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, sal, agua, leña, fosforos, carbon.

loans.name: Mooui

texts.en: Mooui A. is a 53 year old married woman who has nine children. She joined SPBD in 2000 and has been a faithful and pleasant member to the program. She received her first loan from SPBD to start her sewing business back in 2000 and the business is very successful. She then received a second loan to start a grocery shop which is also now very successful. Her third, fourth and fifth loans were to re-stock her grocery shop to help maintain her customer base. She still needs more help from the program to expand her grocery shop so she can cater to the increased demand.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Laura Aide

texts.en:
Laura is a very enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She is married and has three daughters ages 11, 13 and 15. Although her husband works as a hospital orderly she decided to work to help him with the household expenses, so two years ago she opened her own business selling clothing. She is very driven and her business is going well. She has many new customers and her income is rising. She travels to other states to buy at factory prices. At this time, she needs to expand her product line so she is asking for a loan of $200 that she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan within 3-6 months. Please help Laura's business and her family. They would be very grateful.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Laura es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijas, de 11, 13 y 15 años de edad, aunque su esposo trabaja como camillero en un hospital, ella decidió trabajar para apoyarlo con los gastos de su hogar, para lo que inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa hace dos años, a Juana siempre la ha gustado salir adelante y se esfuerza mucho para lograrlo, afortunadamente su negocio ha prosperado y ha logrado tener mas cliente y mejores beneficios.

Para obtener mayores beneficios, Juana viaja a otros estados donde obtiene precios de fábrica, ahora necesita incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece, para esto requiere de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte fundamental en la vida de esta familia y en el crecimiento del negocio de Laura, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Хайдаров Анварчон, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 4 лет. Он женат. Свою деятельность начал с продажи аксессуарами на рынке Панчшанбе. Он считает что его бизнес очень прибыльным. За товаром он ездит сам в соседнюю страну, но на этот раз хочет поехать в Китай, за имеющим спрос товаром. Для этого ему необходимо 1000$, для увеличения товарооборота.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Anvarchon [Anvar] H. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for more than 2 years. He has been in business for 4 years. Anvar H. is married. He started his business by selling accessories on a marketplace in Panchshanbe. Anvar H. believes that his business is very profitable. Usually he delivers his goods from a neighboring country, but now Anvar H. wants to go to China to buy the goods that are in demand. He asks for $1000 loan to help pay for the trip and increase the volume of the goods sold.

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mens and ladies undergarments

loans.name: Nancy Soledad

texts.es:
Nancy is a young woman with many hopes of succeeding, and the great strength that she possesses has allowed her to overcome each and every one of the economic difficulties that her family has had to face. She is the youngest of 7 siblings, and her already elderly parents couldn't continue supporting her. This is why she has become the main source of support in her house, and she had to postpone her dream of becoming a great professional for awhile. Her wish is to have a career after finishing her secondary studies, and this is what drove her to work in a shop that manufactures sweaters, where she offers her sewing services. She works every day from very early to very late and is one of the most outstanding workers in the shop. Nancy is very happy because this work that she does lets her save to be able to start studying at the university in her beautiful city. Nancy hopes to continue supporting her parents and to support her studies, and this is why she is requesting a loan of $200 to invest in a small sewing shop in her parents' home. This is how she will have extra income and will be able to increase the quality of life of her beloved parents. Let's support this young talent with a promising future. She is thankful for your anticipated attention and will.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy es una joven con muchos deseos de superación y la gran fortaleza que posee le ha permitido sobrepasar todas y cada una de las dificultades de escasez económica que ha tenido que afrontar con su familia, ella es la menor de 7 hermanos y sus padres ya ancianos no pudieron seguir apoyándola y en la actualidad debido a esta razón se ha convertido en el principal sostén de su casa, por lo que tuvo que postergar por un tiempo su sueño de convertirse en una gran profesional.Su deseo de ocuparse en alguna actividad tras terminar sus estudios secundarios la condujeron a trabajar en un taller de fabricación de chompas ofreciendo sus servicios de costura, diariamente trabaja desde muy temprano y ahora es una de las trabajadoras que más destaca en el taller, Nancy está muy contenta por La labor que realiza y esto le permite ahorrar para poder empezar a estudiar una carrera profesional en la universidad de su bella ciudad.Nancy desea seguir apoyando a sus padres y sostener sus estudios es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares para invertirlos en la implementación de un pequeño taller de costura en casa de sus padres, de esta manera podrá tener un ingreso extra y podrá elevar el nivel de vida de sus queridos progenitores.Apoyemos a este joven talento con un futuro prometedor, ella agradece por anticipado tu atención y disposición.

loans.use: Implementation of a small sewing shop in her home

loans.name: Susana Gabriela

texts.es:
Susana divorced recently and is going through a sad stage in her life. However, she has two children for whom she needs to move forward and work hard so that they may have a better future than she did. Two years before getting divorced, Susana started a small business selling tacos and menudos (tripe soup), and little by little, with a lot of effort, she got customers who came to buy menudos. However, her business has started to decrease, and she doesn't want it to close for lack of attention.

This is why Susana is requesting a loan for US$1125 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money Susana will be able to adapt her locale so that it draw the attention of potential customers and so little by little she can grow her small locale. With your help, Susana and her children will be able to have a nice Christmas, and will be able to make it through this trying time life has thrown at them.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Susana acaba D. divorciarse y pasa por una etapa triste D. su vida. Sin embargo tiene dos hijos por quienes salir adelante y luchar para que ellos tengan un mejor futuro que elL.. Hace dos años antes D. divorciarse, Susana comenzó con un pequeño negocio D. ventas D. tacos y menudos, y poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo fue haciéndose D. clientes que le iban a comprar menudos. Sin embargo a raíz D. su negocio comenzó a decaer y elL. no quiere que este negocio se cierre por falta D. atención.

Es por es oque Susana está solicitando un crédito D. US $1125 para pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero Susana podrá acondicionar su local, para que llame L. atención a más clientes Y así pueda crecer poco a poco su pequeño local. Con tu ayuda Susana y sus hijos podrán tener una bonita navidad, y podrán salir delante D. esta prueba que L. vida les dio.

loans.use: Recomedling her small food locale (Remodelar su pequeño local de comida)

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mrs. Mabel O. is married with 2 children, lives in Benin City; she has a store where she sells provisions & Foodstuff. She solicits for the loan of $275 to buy more provision and foodstuff for sale. She has been in this business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more Provisions & Foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Gulkhanim

texts.en: Gulkhanim (her husband is pictured), born in 1957,  has sold hazels for 10 years. She and her husband have 3 children and live in Khachmaz town.  Now they need a loan of $725 to buy hazels in order to increase their income.

loans.use: to buy hazels

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Since the first day the TYM Fund expands to her area, Mrs. Hồ Thị Tám, 34 years old, has joined the Fund, borrowed money to invest more into her tailor shop. Her husband helps her to run the shop to. They have steady monthly income of 200USD. The family are happy with plenty of laughing from their two young children. This time she is applying for a loan of 400USD to buy material for the shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ngay từ những ngày đầu tiên Quỹ triển khai, chị Hồ Thị Tám, 34 tuổi, đã mạnh dạn tham gia để có vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng may. Mặc dù là người khéo tay nhưng khi chưa có vốn để mua vải thì việc kinh doanh cũng có nhiều trở ngại. Sau khi vay vốn, cửa hàng đã phần nào đáp ứng được nhu cầu của khách hàng, từ đó cửa hàng may của chị ngày càng đông khách. Những lúc bận việc anh cũng hộ trợ chị trong công việc để kịp tiến độ cho khách và giữ uy tín. Công việc làm ăn ngày càng phát triển, đời sống sinh hoạt được cải thiên, gia đình đầy ắp tiếng cười của 2 con trẻ. Vòng vốn này chị Tám tiếp tục vay 400USD để mua vải may. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Yolanda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yolanda M. works selling cosmetics. Her husband works as a laborer and she started this activity to help her husband in supporting their household. Four years ago she mainly sold to her relatives but she now has customers from diverse circles and is doing very well.

She requests a loan for US $250, which she will pay back in 4 months, to buy merchandise. With your help Yolanda will be able to keep improving.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Yolanda M. se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos, su esposo es obrero empezó con esta actividad para apoyar a su marido en la manutención de su casa, hace 4 años principalmente le vendía a su familiares ahora ya a conseguido clientes de diversos círculos y le va muy bien.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Yolanda seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
My house had been built mainly from wood and the walls have been added in different stages. I would like to build the house in cement and to lay a floor because living like this can be risky due to bad weather. This is important because I would not like to risk loosing it. Therefore, I request a loan of 850 USD. 

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.
