Así que el se fue a Managua a tomar un curso de panificación para capacitarse en técnicas de elaboración de pan y sus derivados,  además de la experiencia que adquirió en la panadería de su padre. De esta manera el logro poner su pizzería, con los ingresos que la generado este negocio también puso una pulpería en su casa  la cual es atendida por su esposa, este es otra fuente de ingresos que el tiene. A el le gustaría expandirse en toda la ciudad de León incluyendo sus municipios porque hay mercado para vender su producto, pero le falta transporte, no tiene en que movilizarse por tal motivo no ha podido expandirse. Debido a eso es que solicito el préstamo para comprar una moto y poder distribuir sus productos. Con esta inversión el espera incrementar sus ventas por medio de las entregas a domicilio , mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan ahorrar para realizar  una de sus metas que es poner su propia panadería, construir su casa y poder expandir su negocio fuera de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
Erickson, 26, lives in the city of León.  He’s married and the father of two children who are 5 and 2 years of age respectively.  He’s a merchant that manufactures and sells pizzas.  

He started his business five years ago.  His father owns a bakery and he pushed him to open his own business.  This is how he went to Managua to take a baking course to learn techniques for baking bread and bread derivatives to add to the experience he’d gained from his father.  This is how he managed to set up his pizzeria.  With income generated from this business he was also able to set up a grocery store at home that his wife tends to which is an additional source of income for him.  

He’d like to expand throughout the city of León including its surrounding towns because there’s a market for his product.  However, due to lack of transportation he’s been unable to expand.  Because of this, he’s asked for a loan to buy a motorcycle to be able to distribute his products.  With this investment he hopes to increase his sales through home deliveries, to increase income so that he can save up because one of his goals is to open a bakery of his own, to build his house and to extend his business beyond the city of León.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: St Theresa Girls Ss Credit Scheme Group

texts.en: Julius is a 29-year-old married man with two children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has operated a retail shop for two years which he started with 400,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings. His hardship is debtors and his low capital base and his vision is a wholesale business plus educating his children. Julius needs the loan to buy soap, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, soap and sugar to sell

loans.name: Mara Cecilia

texts.es: Mara de 43 años va a recibir su segundo credikiva y está muy satisfecha porque con el primero compró en mayor volumen carnes, y víveres en genera y aumentó su venta de alimentos especialmente a la hora del desayuno y la cena. Ahora con su nueva financiación comprara mesas y sillas plásticas, para reemplazar las que tiene en muy mal estado y esto brindará una mejor imagen de su negocio y sus clientes estarán mucho más confortables. Así mismo comprará más víveres en mayor volumen y de contado con lo cual ahorrará en su compra y esto le representa más ingresos.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “con la ayuda de los créditos recibidos puedo aumentar las ventas y mejorar la oferta de menús;  esto me ayuda a continuar con los proyectos que tengo  para el otro año en el  negocio. Gracias por la ayuda.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Mara por favor ingre4se al siguiente enlace: http:// kiva.org/lend/261326
texts.en:
Mara, 43, is going to receive her 2nd Kiva loan and is very satisfied because with the first loan she bought meat and general provisions in greater volume and increased her sales of food, especially at breakfast and dinner time. Now with her new loan she will buy plastic tables and chairs to replace the ones that she has that are in very bad shape. This will give her business a better image and her customers will be much more comfortable. She will also buy more provisions in bulk and in cash which will save her money on her purchases and therefore give her more income. 

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "With the help of the loans received, I am able to increase sales and improve the menu offerings. This helps me to continue with the projects that I have for the business next year. Thanks for the help." If you want to know the story of Mara, please follow the link: http:// kiva.org/lend/261326

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs and supplies in greater volume and quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 42 years old, is a security guard’s wife. Her husband's income every month is not enough to maintain their daily needs, so she ventures in the rice business. She has been doing this for five years. She is happy that now, the business is gradually improving. 

She was blessed with five children and is doing her best to continue to send them to school with help of her rice business activity. She wants her children to finish college for their future welfare. 

To further grow her venture, she is requesting a loan amount of 25,000 pesos to buy rice and materials such as hollow blocks and cement for the renovation of her business stall, where she stores sacks of rice for future sale. 

Jocelyn hopes to earn bigger income from her business to extend financial help to her nephews, who are out of school at the moment. She hopes that ASKI, Kiva's partner, will always be generous and helpful in reaching her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy rice and materials such as hollow blocks and cement for the renovation of her business stall.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro Isabel de 65 años es un hombre trabajador y esforzado quien tiene una panadería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años con esfuerzo propio con 6 quintales diarios de harina ahora realiza entre 10 a 12 quintales de harina de acuerdo a la venta. 
El realiza desde pan de molde, pico, bolillos y galletas su venta mensual es de 20,800 córdobas y su inversión es de 10,000 córdobas. El con el crédito comprara una moto lo que le permitirá regar su producto de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Alejandro Isabel 65, is an energetic, hard-working man who owns a bakery.  

He started his business 15 years ago, through his own efforts. At the beginning, he used 600 lbs. of flour a day, and now he uses between 1000 to 1200 lbs. a day, depending on sales.  He makes loaves, picos (triangular sweet breads), rolls and cookies. His monthly sales are 20,800 cordobas and his investment is 10,000 cordobas. 

With the loan he will buy a motorcycle that will allow him to better distribute his products.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for use in his business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 44 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, es madre de tres hijos ya mayores de 26, 22, y 20 años quienes son independientes, aunque viven en su casa que compró junto a su esposo, quien falleció hace algunos meses. El trabajo de Hilda consiste en la compra y venta de ropa, se va a la ciudad de Lima en busca de los últimos modelos. De esa manera cumple con el pedido de sus clientes y al cabo de 15 días realiza la cobranza, entre sus compradores están los amigos, vecinos, familiares. Lleva ya cuatro años en este trabajo, y sola ha logrado cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y para ella misma. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de mucho tiempo para poder realizar diferentes actividades, le va bien, ya que tiene muchos clientes que le son muy fieles por que les da un buen producto y a un precio muy cómodo. Espera poder mantener ese ritmo de ventas y mas adelante crecer. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo porque se siente que son responsables. Con el monto solicitado, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para comprar ropa exclusiva y de temporada para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda is 44 years old and is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She is a mother of three children who are 26, 22, and 20 and are now independent adults.  She lives in the house she bought with her husband who died several months ago.  Hilda buys and sells clothing for a living and goes to Lima in search of the latest fashions.  This is how she fills her customer's orders and charges them, her friends, neighbors, and family, bimonthly.  She has been doing this for four years and alone she has been able to cover her household and personal expenses.  What she likes about his job is that she has time to undertake different activities.  Things are going well for her as she has a lot of customers that are very loyal because she gives them a good product at an affordable price.  She hopes to be able to maintain this sales rate and in the future, to grow.  

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She likes her group a lot because she feels that they are responsible.  With the amount requested, she will travel to Lima to buy exclusive and seasonal clothing to stock her business.

loans.use: purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: María Erlinda se dedica a una pulpería desde hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Ella comenzó vendiendo golosinas y refrescos con el tiempo de las utilidades que le generaba el negocio siguió invirtiendo para tener un mayor volumen en su inventario. Es por eso solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, fósforos, cigarrillos entre otros. Ella sueña con ampliar más su negocio y brindar los productos que necesitan.
texts.en: Maria Erlinda has operated a corner shop for more than 10 years.  She sold snacks and soft drinks at first, then used profits from the business to expand her inventory.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise for the business: everyday food staples, detergents, matches, cigarettes, etc.  She wants to continue expanding the store and provide the products that her customers need.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Las Naranjas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Las Naranjas y se integra D.  seis señora quien  cada una  se dedica a diferente actividad, L. señora  quien se le tomo L. entrevista se llama Tereza es viuda y a su responsabilidad tiene  a dos hijos que L. apoyan con los ingresos D. L. casa.

     ElL. solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en  L. compra y venta D. ropas para luego venderlo fuera D. L. localidad, en esta actividad lleva  un año y once meses en L. que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso además antes también compraba productos agrícolas D. L. región.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que es una mujer soL. y no quiere  que le haga falta lo mas necesario y  también  apoyar a sus  hijos que un están a su responsabilidad.

  Lo que más desea es que con este apoyo que le están brindando y  su actividad pueda  salir delante.

  Las personas que integran en el grupo  son las señoras: Rosalinda quien  invierte al préstamo  en L. compra D. ropas para damas, caballeros, niñas y niños, L. señora  María Vitalina invierte en L. compra y venta D. cosméticos, así también L. señora  Silvina quien  invierte en L. compra  D. frutas D. L. región, CarmeL. invierte en L. compra D. productos para surtir su papelería, y por último L. señora Hilda quien invertirá en L. compra D. mercancía para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
The Las Naranjas (Oranges) group is maD. up of six women who each has her own business.  Tereza is the one who gave the interview.  She is a widow and has two children who help her with the money for the house.

She is requesting a loan to buy, and then sell, clothing at a distance from where she lives.  She has been doing this work for a year and eleven months and she tells us that it is going very well.  She has had a good income while previously she also bought farm products from the area.

She was inspired to do this work when she, as a single woman, didn’t want to miss out on what she needed, and also to help her children who are her responsibility.

What she most wants from this financing is that it will help her get ahead.

The other members of the group are: Rosalinda, who will use the loan to buy women’s, men’s and children’s clothing, María Vitalina who will buy cosmetics, Silvina, who wants to buy fruit from their area, CarmeL., who will purchase products to supply her stationery store, and lastly, Hilda, who will buy merchandise to supply her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Guljamal's Group

texts.en:
Guljamal is a member of this group. She is 52 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised four children. All of her children except the youngest son live independently from Guljamal. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 2,000 soms, Guljamal started a wholesale fish business. She supplies fish to the stores and in this way, she earns about 12,000 soms per month. This profit made it possible to save money to purchase a vehicle for her son. At the moment, she needs money to purchase clothes for herself. Thus, she applied for the loan from “Kiva”. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish sales business and plans to invest money in cattle breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Sector 3 Esquinas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sector 3 Esquinas está formado por siete socias quienes trabajan en actividades del campo, trabajos que heredaron de sus padres y ahora les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares, también mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus ancestros y se caracterizan por ser personas amables y de un corazón muy cálido. Viven por comunidades aledañas al cantón de Nabon (Cuenca), este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales, su gente joven laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferente plazas de trabajo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosita Mercedes, tiene 36 años, es casada y fruto de su unión  conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosita Mercedes se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa en casa cría y vende animales como gallinas, borregos y cuyes. También trabaja labrando sus terrenos en donde siembra hortalizas y verduras a las que las vende en su comunidad o en el mercado.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y pollos.
 
Su meta es tener un criadero de pollos grande para vender en las pollerías de la ciudad
texts.en:
The communal bank Sector 3 Esquinas is made up of seven female members who work in the field. They inherited this work from their parents and it now allows them to contribute to the finances of their home. They also maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors and are characterized by being kind people with a warm heart. They live in the neighboring communities of the canton of Nabon (Cuenca). This area has a cold climate and its people make a living farming, raising animals, and its young people work in the city of Cuena doing different kinds of work.

One of the members of this group is Rosita Mercedes. She is 36 years old and married, and as a fruit of her married life, she has conceived 4 children of the ages 13, 11, 9, and 5. Her first two children study in secondary school and her last two children in primary school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and the home in which they live is their own.

Mrs. Rosita Mercedes makes a living taking care of her children and as she is home she raises and sells animals like chicken, sheep, and guinea pigs. She also works her land where she plants vegetables and greens which she sells in her community or in the market.

This is her first loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of guinea pigs and chicken.

Her goal is to have a large chicken farm to sell in the poultry stores of the city.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chicken.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 50-year-old man who sells milk and breeds cattle. He has 6 years of experience in this field. Iman`s profit from milk sales is about 200 AZN and 100 AZN from cattle sales. Iman applied for 1,500 AZN in order to purchase more cattle and a milk cow. As milk and meat products are most popular, the demand on them is high, and Iman is not able to cover it anymore.  Thus he needs additional finances to purchase more cattle, produce more milk and meat and increase his profit. This will be his 5th loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase one milk cow and two cattle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane sells corn dough, maize, and cassava at Dompoase. She has been selling corn dough for five years.  Jane uses her income to provide for her family. She has six dependents.

She will use her loan to purchase bulk maize and cassava. Jane plans to expand her business with the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize and cassava.

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo se forma gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros, quien se informo acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, luego logró juntar a 15 amigas y vecinas de su ciudad, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, quienes diariamente se esfuerzan por darle a sus familias las mínimas comodidades.
una de ellas es la señoras es Venancia, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, ella comenta que le va muy bien con las ventas, por lo que ya ha logrado hacerse de una clientela bien definida. Ella todo lo que hace es por darle a su familia un futuro mejor sin privaciones.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano para la posterior venta, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members who approached Fundación Paraguaya to find out about their Entrepreneurial Women's Program.  She then got together 15 friends and neighbors from her city and they are working very happily together.  They are all heads of household who work hard every day to provide their families with minimal comforts.  

One of the members of this group is Venancia who sells all kinds of clothing.  She says that her sales are doing well and she has managed to gain a well-defined customer base.  Everything she does is done in order to provide her family with a better future, without hardships.  She is requesting this loan to buy summer clothing to re-sell.  This will enable her to stock up and meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Victorina, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, de 18 y 16 años de edad, ambos estudian, ella es propietaria de transporte de carga pesada, todos los días su actividad principal es despachar a los motoristas para que inicien su trabajo, ella solamente administra y controla el uso del transporte, para el manejo tiene empleados.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos y pago de mano de obra, este préstamo solventara la necesidad de darle mantenimiento a un camión, ya que esto le permitirá alargar la vida de sus vehículos y seguir prestando los servicios y generando ganancias.
Doña Victorina sueña con comprar un vehículo más para trabajar, además de gozar de salud junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Victorina lives with her husband and two children, who are 18 and 16 years old. They are both in school. Victorina is the owner of a heavy-cargo transport business. Her main activity every day is to dispatch the drivers to their jobs. She only administers and controls the use of the vehicles. She has employees to do the driving.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of spare parts and to pay for labor. This loan will take care of some needed maintenance on a truck. It will help her to extend the life of her vehicles and to continue offering her services and generating income. Doña Victorina dreams of purchasing another vehicle for her business and of enjoying good health, along with her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for labor to repair her truck

loans.name: Namnam Awaou's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE est composé de quatre personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Namnam Awaou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Namnam Awaou est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Namnam Awaou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Namnam Awaou est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Razack. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Namnam Awaou vend depuis vingt cinq ans environs, des ustensiles de cuisine dans un marché du Bénin. Namnam Awaou s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Namnam Awaou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Ayidote group is made up of four people who all live in the same neighbourhood. This is the second time that the group have requested financial aid from Alidé in order to improve their business.

The head of the group, Namnam Awaou, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 47 years old and lives in Benin. Namnam Awaou did not go to school. She is married to a driver, Razack. The couple has four children to support who are all at school. They look after another child in addition to their own children. 

For 25 years, Namnam Awaou has been selling kitchen utensils at a market in Benin to support all the children in her care. She buys her supplies in Nigeria. In order to satisfy her customers and improve her turnover and revenue, Namnam Awaou is requesting a second loan from Alidé together with the members of the Ayidote group. The first loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Bankito Municipal (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los dos socios y las diez socias  del Grupo De  Crédito Bankito Municipal. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. Ellos hace poco y al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  para  poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir recibiendo los créditos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Odalia, tiene 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta  relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro mayores de edad y el menor de 15 años, tres de ellos viven con ella  y  dos  estudian. Su marido es chofer.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que le gusta valerse por sui misma y para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Con este crédito quiere comprar ropa del todo tipo para empezar con este nuevo negocio. Ella está muy contenta con el crédito y espera seguir por mucho tiempo recibiendo este apoyo de la institución.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones blusas, camisas y otras prendas de vestir para iniciar su negocio aprovechando esta temporada que es muy buena para las ventas.
 
Su sueño es salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Municipal in the city of Portoviejo, two men and ten women who make up the Communal Bank “Bankito Municipal” meet every fifteen days. They engage in a variety of business activities such as general retail, providing services, and other trades. A short time ago they learned about the benefits offered by Fundación ESPOIR, so they decided to join together in order to access the loans provided by the organization. This is their first loan as a Communal Bank and they hope to do very well so that they can continue receiving loans.

It is in this place where one can meet Sra. Odalia. She is 46 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children. Four of her children are grown and the youngest is 15 years of age. Three of her children live with her and two of them are studying. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Odalia is wonderful homemaker who likes taking care of things herself. To generate her own income, she sells Avon products (including beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Her sales are made by going door-to-door. With this loan, she wants to buy all types of clothing so that she can start a new business. She is very pleased with the loan and hopes to continue receiving support from the organization for a long time.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, and other garments for starting her business. Odalia will take advantage of this season since sales should be very good. Her dream is to move forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, shirts, and other garments.

loans.name: Anyier

texts.en:
Anyier lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 32 year, marriage, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Anyier heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.en:
My name is Gloria and I run a business that makes and sells sliced plantains. It is located in my home and I distribute my product by manner of a traveling salesman. With the income I contribute to the family expenses and, most importantly, I am able to spend time with my family, as my children help me in their free time. My wish is to install a stand where I can sell my product without the need to walk through the streets.

Mi nombre es Gloria, cuento con un negocio de produccion y venta de tajaditas de platano, ubicado en mi casa de habitación las que distribuyo de manera ambulante, con los ingresos de este negocio puedo contribuir en los gastos familiares y lo mas importante es que me permite atender a mi familia, en esta actividad me colaboran mis hijos en su tiempo libre. Mi mayor deseo es instalar una caseta donde pueda vender mi producto sin necesidad de andar en la calle.

loans.use:
To purchase firewood, oil, plantains, oil, plastic bags and other items

Compra de leña, aceite, latanos, bolsas plasticas y otros.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: I am a married man, father of 3. I sell maize for a living. This loan will greatly improve my life because I’ll be able to pay my children's school fees with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sara Fabiao

texts.pt:
Sara is unmarried but lives with the father of her 4 children. She lives in Chicumbane, in the Xai-Xai district. She began the loan program in 2003. Her children study. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing and kitchenware to sell. Sara helps her husband with household expenses. Together they are gathering building materials to construct a home.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 4 filhos. Sara vive em Chicumbane, sede do Distrito de Xai-Xai.Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2003. Os filhos de Sara estao a estudar. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para comprar mais roupa e loica para a venda.Sara ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa. Ela e o marido estao juntando material de construcao para construirem uma casa .

loans.use: To buy more clothing and kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Helena Felipe

texts.pt:
Helena is married and lives with her husband at Praia do Bilene. She has 2 sons that are in elementary school. She was a part of a group that used this program and when the group dissolved she decided to continue to use the program as a individual client. Since she joined the loan program in 2005 she always sold commodity products, but now she would like to start selling attire as well. Her husband works with her in the sale of products. They began building a new residence made of more durable material than their previous house and their business is progressing well. Helena is crossing a difficult moment in her social life where her husband has been sick and she has had to take care of their business, children and husband all by herself, but she is confident that she is can do it.

Translated from Portuguese by Camila, Kiva volunteer.

Helena e casada e vive com o marido na praia do Bilene. Helena tem 2 filhos que estao a estudar no ensino primario basico. Ela entrou para o programa em 2005. Ela era membro de um grupo. Quandop o grupo se desfez ela preferiu continuar como cliente individual. desde que entrou para o programa em 2005 sempre vendeu produtos de primeira necessidade. Mas agora ela quer introduzir tambem a venda de roupa.O marido de Helena trabalha junto com ela na venda. Eles iniciaram a construccao de uma residencia nova feita com material convenciaonal. A antiga foi feita com material local. O negocio de Helena esta a correr bem. Helena esta a atravessar um momento dificilna sua vida social. O seu marido tem andado doente assim ela tem de se desdobrar para cuidar do negocio, dos filhos e do marido. Mas ela diz que consegue gerir tudo isso.

loans.use: Helena wants to use the money for the purchase of additional supplies and clothing for sale at her shop.

loans.name: Samuel K A

texts.en:
Samuel K.A. O. is a trader who deals in selling building materials. He is married and has 2 children ages 4 and 1 year 6 months old. His wife is a caterer and she is working very hard to help her husband with the family’s finances.

Demand for his goods has increased but he does not have enough capital to buy more goods for his shop to satisfy all his costumers. Samuel is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to purchase more iron sheets, wire mesh, nails, cellulose thinners, paints and so on, which are highly demanded from his shop.

loans.use: As additional capital to purchase more iron sheets, wire mesh, nails, cellulose thinners, paints and so on

loans.name: Wakimese C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Kevin K.. She operates a school and is requesting a loan to paint the school buildings and buy more furniture. Kevin is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 2 children (twins) aged 20 who attend school.

Kevin is joined in her small group by Jane B., Virgo N., Annet M., and Annet N.. Jane B. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand her business. Virgo N. operates a business in tailoring and wants a loan to buy more sewing machines. Annet M. also operates a tailoring business and wants to buy more materials. Annet N. operates a clinic and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To paint school buildings and expand businesses

loans.name: Ndeeba North B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Asiati N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Asiati is 41 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 4 children ranging from age 5 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Asiati makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Asiati has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Asiati is joined in her small group by Shamim N., Sarah N., Hasifa N., and Jamawa N.. Shamim N. has a business running a hardware shop and wants to add capital. Sarah N. is currently operating a business in chicken rearing and selling and wants a loan to buy broiler mash (feed). Hasifa N. operates a business selling rice and wants to add capital. Jamawa N. is currently in the business of running a butcher's shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shop commodities

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 48 years old. He has 4 children. Two of them are studying in university and the others are studying in school. He has a welding shop. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new welding machine and some iron. He also wants to renovate the shop and make some advertising in order to increase his income and develop his project. He wants to save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new welding machine and some iron

loans.name: Justo Manuel

texts.es:
Mr. U. has obtained eight loans with Fundación Leon over the past four years. You can already see the growth of his business compared to when he first started.

Mr. U. lives in an area of Nicaragua that is known for cattle raising. He is married to the woman in the photo and has two sons who attend school. He and his wife both run the business.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor U. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos cuatro años obteniendo ocho creditos con los que ha logrado incrementar su negocio ya que se puede observar el crecimiento del negocio con respecto a cuando empezo a trabajar, cabe destacar que el vive en zona del pais propicia para el sector ganadero lo que ha colaborado a la mejoria de su negocio, es casado con la señora que esta en la foto tiene dos hijos menores los que estudian, el negocio lo adminisrtra en conjunto con u esposa.

loans.use: Invest in veterinary products for his store

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan A. is a 34-year-old man who has raised sheep for meat production since 1990. He breeds sheep for local bazaar traders. Once a week he goes to the livestock bazaar in Imishli region to sell his sheep and purchase lambs. Rovshan lives with his family in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. Because of hyper inflation, Rovshan's earnings are enough to feed his family but not enough to expand his business and increase the number of his sheep herd. To improve the life conditions of his family and expand his business, he has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase 10 sheep (for an estimated cost of $60 USD for each sheep and fodder for $200 USD).

loans.use: To purchase ten sheep.

loans.name: Naotala

texts.en:
Naotala T., age 45, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the farming business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week.

Naotala has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Naotala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Naotala runs a taro farming business. Her business has become very succesful with the support of her husband and family. She has found a good market for exporting her taro to our neighbouring island, American Samoa.

loans.use: For maintenance of her house.

loans.name: Rosalía Merce

texts.en:
Rosalía is separated, is 50 and has 3 children. She has a multiservice store and a fruit juice store called Mechita, in a rented place located in the 2 de Mayo street. She sells groceries, alcohol, toys, ice creams and sweets. She also prepares food she sells at the same place and offers at a boarding house. Nights, she sells french fries with sausages from a cart. Her children help her to take care of the store.

Rosalía belongs to the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. She needs a 1000 soles loan to buy milk, juices, fizzy drinks, and yogurts.

Rosalía dreams about having a less arduous job like an Internet booth or a phone booth. She would also like to build her house and help her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy milk, juices, fizzy drinks and yogurts

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. is married and has 4 children. She has never received any schooling. Martha has been selling maize, groundnuts, beans and other food items in Cape Coast since 2008. Martha uses her income to help her husband pay for their children's education. 

Martha will use the loan to increase her stock for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Martha plans to help her husband acquire a piece of land for a family house.

loans.use: To increase her stock for sale.

loans.name: Elita

texts.es: Elita de 40 años, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (gaseosas, hielos y chupetes), por su buena atención y sobre todo por su amabilidad tiene una gran clientela. Aparte de esto, trabaja en una tienda de golosinas, sin embargo eso no le impide que siga adelante con su negocio de venta de bebidas heladas, por lo que  posteriormente quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para brindar una mejor acogida a sus consumidores.Tiene 5 hijos, 3 de ellos ya independientes, quedando a su cargo los dos menores, por los que ella se siente orgullosa.Elita cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo Carlos quien es operador de maquinaria pesada. Para seguir creciendo es que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Elita is 40 years old and she sells cold refreshments (soda pop, ices, and popsicles). Because of her good customer service and above all friendliness, she has a large clientele. In addition, she works in a snack store. This doesn’t interfere with her business selling refreshments, and she would like to build a kiosk to provide greater comfort to her customers. She has 5 children, 3 of whom are now grown and independent, leaving the two younger children and she is very proud of them. Elita counts on the support of her husband Carlos, who is a heavy equipment operator. In order to continue growing her business she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beverages and frozen treats

loans.name: Khe

texts.en:
Mrs. Khe O. is a villager in Trapeang Krasang Village in Takeo Province. She has a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Tom Narin, is a transporter who transports wood for an income. Aside from this business, he is a construction worker.

Although Mrs. Khe O. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well. Thus, Mrs. Khe O. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise and she hopes to increase her income after she sells that cow. Mrs. Khe O. is 33 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school while the others, ages nine months and four years old, are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mrs. Phally T. owns a small grocery store in Doun Pen Village in Kampong Cham Province. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it.  Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery goods to increase her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeurng Sithuon, is a recyclable materials collector who buys empty bottles, cans, plastic etc. and sells them to a recycling factory to earn his income. Mrs. Phally T. is 28 years old and the mother of two children. One child attends the local school and the youngest is four months old. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame L. Kayi est née le 28 Mai 1972 à Aného où elle réside actuellement. Son mari est électricien mais n’a plus de travail ce qui fait que toutes les charges se reposent sur Madame L.. Déterminée à garantir un avenir meilleur à ses progénitures, elle se bat jour et nuit en vendant des jus de fruits et de l’eau glacée. N’ayant pas les moyens suffisants, elle sollicite un financement pour s’acheter un congélateur, des glacières nécessaires pour accroître sa production.
texts.en:
A married mother of 3, Mrs. Kayi L. was born May 28, 1972, in Aného, where she currently lives. Her husband is an electrician but no longer has a job, which makes all the responsibility fall on Mrs. L.. Determined to guarantee a better life for her offspring, she struggles day and night selling fruit juice and iced water. Not having enough means, she seeks a loan to buy a freezer and ice boxes needed to increase her production.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a freezer and ice boxes to make and sell ice and fruit juice

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 44 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. 

Ahmad has been working in painting cars for several years. He has requested a loan of 1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tool kits for his garage. This is the first time that Ahmad has applied for a loan.

When he first started his business, he had difficulties in building a client network. Now, however, his clients are friends and neighbors. He decided on doing this business because he has a lot of experience.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase tool kits for his garage.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
El negocio de pulpería requiere en todo momento de inversión inmediata al agotarse el inventario con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Juana A. labora en su propio negocio de pulpería ofreciendo todo tipo de productos ofrecidos a sus clientes.

Por ser una dama muy trabajadora y con el deseo de que su negocio crezca y se desarrolle, ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos y de esta forma continuar buscando la manera de prosperar su pulpería.
texts.en:
A general store requires constant and immediate investment when inventory is depleted in order meet its customer demands. Mrs. Juana A. works in her own general store in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega offering up all types of products for her customers. As she is a hardworking woman with the desire to grow and develop her business, she has applied for a loan from Ceprodel to buy products and thereby continue to find ways to grow her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Swastiningsih

texts.id:
Ni nyoman Swastiningsih  istri dari I yang berprofesi sebagai seorang Bengkel.  Sebagai seorang Bengkel Belumlah cukup penghasilanya untuk mencukupi penghidupan keluarganya. Selanjutnya Ni Nyoman Swastiningsih berusaha beternak babi. Akan tetapi jumlah yang sedikit serta masih menerapkan pola tradisional berakibat pada hasil yang masih kurang maksimal.
Untuk mengatasi hasil yang kurang maksimal, Ni Nyoman wasiantini memilih DINARI menjadi  pendamping usahanya. Dari DINARI, Ni Putu Artini memperoleh pelatihan dan tunjangan modal usaha. Dengan pinjaman modal yang diperoleh dari DINARI sebesar  Rp. 4.500.000.- ia manfaatkan untuk pembelian bibit serta biaya pakan ternaknya. Ni Nyoman Wasiantini optimis dari usaha ternak babi yang ia lakukan akan memperoleh keuntungan yang nantinya kan dipergunakan untuk menunjang perekonomian keluarganya.
texts.en:
Swastiningsih started to rear pigs. But she learn her techniques in rearing them the old way, therefore is unable to get maximum yield. To overcome this, she sought Dinari for help. Dinari provided her with training and as well as a loan of Rp. 4.500.000, which will be used to buy piglets and pig feedings. Ni Nyoman is optimistic that this venture will increase her household income and lessen their burden.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence buys and sells kerosene in wholesale and retail form. She is also a party planner and supplies food and drinks for various occasions. She has been a LAPO client for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N150,000 to enable her to purchase more drums of kerosene.

Florence is 45 years old and married with four children. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more drums of kerosene to sell

loans.name: Paula Concepción

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León la señora Paula S. G. posee su propia pulpería que desde hace nueve años fundó con el propósito de brindarle mejores condiciones a sus pequeños hijos que tanto requieren de su apoyo.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito porque requiere la compra de la mercadería para ofertarla y para esto espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente para su propio beneficio.
texts.en:
Paula S. G. has her own small grocery store in the Telica district of the city of León. She started her shop nine years ago with the purpose of providing better living conditions to her young children, who really depend on her support.

Today she is looking for the support of a loan from CEPRODEL to purchase merchandise to sell. She is very confident that her request will be granted and she will benefit greatly from it.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 47-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Imad has been working in agriculture for fifteen years. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan. 
Imad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Imad decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Greetings from U. Clarisse, a 33-year-old woman married to one husband. They live together in Gasabo district, Remera sector, in Kigali city capital of Rwanda. Clarisse has four children: 11, 10, 7 and 2 years old. Her husband doesn’t produce an income.

Clarisse operates her business of selling clothes. She is now seeking a loan of 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company. She does not have an employee in her business and she has been running the same business for five years.

Every day, Clarisse starts work at 8:00 a.m. and finishes at  8:00 p.m.. Before she obtained a loan, she used to get a monthly profit of $180. With this loan, she intends to expand her business and, from the extra profits, she will have enough savings to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Enrriqueta

texts.en:
Mrs. Enrriqueta A. is 61 years old and married to Mr. Natividad Velazco, with whom she has a younger son. She is a teacher and lives in the city of Pilar, in the San Vicente neighborhood. They own their own home, which has all of the necessities of a home, such as electricity.
 
She operates a general store that has been open for eight years and has all of the necessities to develop her business.

She is applying for credit to buy agricultural products in general, as well as cheese, which is her principal source of income. She is very thankful for the support she receives from the Paraguay Foundation, and is very excited to take advantage of the opportunity to make her business grow. This is her second loan with the institution.

loans.use: To purchase of materials for her store

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et est père de 02 enfants, l’activité génératrice qu’il exerce pour pouvoir subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de farine de blé et de sucre. Il exerce son activité dans sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « ETS IN GOD WE  TRUST ». Son commerce marche  bien, il voudrait l’agrandir et demande pour cela à WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de sucres, 10sacs de farine de blé.
texts.en:
This is a man who is married and the father of two. His income-earning business, which allows him to provide for his family, involves commerce in wheat flour and sugar. He operates his business in his own shop, which he called “ETS IN GOD WE TRUST”. His business is doing well. He would like to expand, and to do so, he’s asking WAGES for his first loan to buy ten sacks of sugar and ten sacks of flour.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Las Rosas Group 2

texts.en:
Kenia S., pictured on the far right, is the coordinator of her 5-member group. She lives in a rented home in the sector of Guaricanos, in Santo Domingo Norte, along with her husband and two daughters, ages 10 and 3. Their eldest daughter attends school and the youngest plans to begin school next year.

Kenia just graduated from beauty school. She plans to use this first loan from Esperanza to set up her own hair salon. She plans to invest in a hair drier, a styling chair, and general beauty equipment, such as brushes and clips, to complete what she needs to start. She is very excited to finally begin reaping the results of her studying.

Her goals for this loan are to solidify her hair styling abilities, establish a stable business, and sharpen her business skills. Her long term goals are to own her own home, and to become an extremely good stylist, so that she can become a styling teacher.

loans.use: A hair drier, a styling chair, and general beauty equipment

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi T. is married and has four children. His wife is a fish monger. He has received schooling through primary school.

Kofi sells fresh fish at Elmina, which he has done since 1995. He uses his income for paying his children’s school fees. He will use the loan to repair his machine and also to increase his capital to buy more fish for sale.

With the new profits from his expanded business, Kofi plans to further his children’s education.

loans.use: To repair his machine and also to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Padagnassou

texts.fr: Depuis 2001, cette dame mariée sans enfants exerce le commerce de bois de chauffage à Agoè Démakpoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins financiers de son foyer. Pour renouveler son stock et pour augmenter sa marchandise, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour l’achat de 32 tas des bois de chauffage et pour la couverture d’autres frais.
texts.en:
This woman is married and without children. Since 2001, she has been in the business of selling heating wood in Agoè Démakpoè, a neighborhood in Lomé. This business enables her to provide for the financial needs of her home. To renew her stock and increase her merchandise, she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES to purchase 32 piles of heating wood and to pay for other costs.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase heating wood

loans.name: N.p. En Accion Group

texts.en:
Miledys A. is an Esperanza associate who has successfully completed one loan cycle and is greatly looking forward to receiving a second loan. Miledys, her husband, and her four grandchildren live in a wooden house with a tin roof in Boca Chica, a city in the Southeast of the Dominican Republic where running water and electricity are unreliable.
She owns a bakery, run from a small shop a few blocks from her house, and hopes to use the funds from this loan to buy sugar and flour in larger quantities to receive a better price and to be able to bake more items. From the increased earnings she will receive from this loan, she hopes to gain enough money to add cement to her house as well as ensure prosperous education and health for herself and her grandchildren. Miledys would like to thank Esperanza and all the donors for helping this dream become a reality.

loans.use: Flour, sugar

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people.

Mrs. Sok S., 47, is the leader and operates a handicraft trade out of her home. Sok S. sells items of furniture that are made from water hyacinth. She is married to Om Navy, 50, who is a district consultant adviser. The couple has five teenage children; one of whom is working as internal staff for an organization. Sok S. would like to decorate her house in order to use her attractive house to begin selling desserts but she lacks the capital to do so. Therefore, Sok S. would like to ask for a loan in order to decorate her existing house.

The other borrowers who are jointly taking this loan are fishers. P. would like to buy more fishing tools. P. will purchase a net and trap for fishing. R. will buy more tools to fish.

loans.use: To decorate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Jesucrifina

texts.en:
Jesucrifina is 55 years old and married to Tannie, a farmer. They have two children: Jerome, 29 years old, working in an Electronics Shop and Lilibeth, 28 years old and married.

Jesucrifina is engaged in retailing DXN products. She is working double-time hoping that they can improve their way of living and cover their family's needs.

She wants to venture into another business, fruit retailing. This made her decided to take out a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 7,000. She believes that by having this second business, her income will increase. She hopes that her loan will be approved in order to maintain and further expand her retail business.

loans.use: To engage in fruit retailing

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva P. lives in the village of Brgy. Buenavista, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She is 51 years old and married to Francisco P., a farmer. They are blessed with three children, one of whom has a family already while the other two are still attending school. One of Nieva's dreams is for her two children to finish their education so that they are able to earn a good income and help her in the future.

While her children were growing up, Nieva realized that she could not rely totally on the income her husband earned from farming. This is because it could sometimes be very volatile and dependent on so many external factors, including the weather, that may affect the volume of production. Added to this was also the increasing expense of educating her children. This is why Nieva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 so that she could access capital to start a general store. Using her loans over the next few years, Nieva continued to expand her operations, and began to include frozen products. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP – a very respectable income that has been a great help in improving her family's quality of life.

In her last loan, Nieva borrowed 11,000 PHP, which she used as additional capital for her general store and frozen products. She paid off that loan on time each week until it was fully paid. This time, she is borrowing another 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use to restock her general store and purchase more products to sell.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams, and earning the respect of people in their community. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" – to be called "Honorable" is a mark of respect that everyone hopes to attain in their lifetime.

loans.use: To restock her general store and purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: La Sra. Delfina, es cliente antigua, trabajo varias secuencias en gupo solidario Estrella, ella tiene hijos mayores, todos casados, su esposo trabaja de  chofer de quien se separo hace muchos años,  su actividad es vender edredones y frazadas al crédito entre los trabajadores de la empresa constructora donde trabaja más de 5 años como pintor albañil, la señora es una perosona muy trabajadora por lo que se le da este trato prefeencial.Ella tiene buen historial y cumle con sus pagos de acuerdo a lo planificado.
texts.en:
Delfina is a long time member. She has been with the communal bank “Estrella” for several loan cycles. She has grown children, all of whom are married. Her husband works as a driver and she separated from him many years ago. She sells comforters and blankets on credit to workers at the construction company where she has worked for more than five years as a bricklayer and painter. She is a very hardworking person, which is why she is given preferential treatment. She has a good payment history and makes her payments as planned.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy comforters and blankets.

loans.name: Asociacion Unidas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
ASOCIACION UNIDAS
Carolina fue profesora hace muchos años, es una mujer muy empeñosa en lo que hace; se embarazó de su segunda hija y ya no pudo ejercer su profesión, fue entonces que con mucho esfuerzo consiguió una “carreta” donde vender algunos productos como especerías, que eso lo podía hacer en casa. Comenzó vendiendo en la calle,  luego se instalo en el mercado alquilando un pequeño espacio desde hace 6 años. Sus ingresos  le ayuda a poder mantener a su familia.
La tesorera Lola  vende comida hace 9 años, comenzó vendiendo en su casa,luego de algún tiempo alquilo un puesto en el mercado, eso la ayudo con el aporte para las necesidades básicas de sus familia; tiene dos hijos de los cuales solo se está haciendo cargo de uno de ellos ya que el otro puede mantenerse con sus propios recursos.
La secretaria Viviana tiene su wawa wuasi (Guardería de niños) desde hace 3 años, funciona en su propio domicilio; la socia nos comenta que el gobierno proporciona los alimentos a los niños además de pagarle un alquiler por su casa, ella tiene 6 hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar y este tipo de trabajo la beneficia mucho ya que puede pagar algunos gastos en casa; considerando que con los seis hijos los gastos son tremendos y nunca es suficiente. 
La alcancía Comunal tiene varios años de fundado y demuestran ser puntuales y responsables en sus respectivos pagos.
texts.en:
United Association Community Bank Carolina was a teacher for many years, and is very determined in all she does. When she became pregnant with her second daughter and was no longer able to practice her profession, with much effort she obtained a cart where she could sell various products like spices that she could make at home. She started by selling in the street, then she established herself in the market renting a small space for the past 6 years. Her income helps her to support her family.

The treasurer Lola has sold food for the past 9 years. She started selling from her home, some time later she rented a stand in the market. This helps her contribute to her family's basic needs. She has two sons of which she is taking care of just one, since the other supports himself by his own means.

The secretary Viviana has conducted her "wawa wuasi" (children's daycare) for three years in her own home. She informs us that the government provides food for the children in addition to paying for the rental of her house. She has 6 school-age children and this type of work provides many benefits since it lets her pay for some of her household expenses, keeping in mind that her expenses with 6 children are significant and there is never enough.

The Community Bank has been in existence for several years and its members have shown themselves to be punctual and responsible with their respective payments.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as goat and sheep skin

loans.name: Joseph Maringi

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old and married to Jane; they have one son aged two years. Joseph has been operating a hotel business for the past five years. 

Joseph was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to purchase more stock and especially food stuffs for the hotel. He also plans to rent more space as his business has grown and he is not able to accommodate all his clients. With the extra profit he intends to purchase a piece of land.  

Joseph’s hopes and dreams are to expand his business and prepare a wider variety of food such as French fries, and even rent out more space for his clients. He describes himself as a hardworking business man and very focused.

loans.use: To purchase more food stock for his hotel.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with two sons. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, where she sells children’s clothing items in the central marketplace. Victoria restocks her inventory regularly and timely and always tries to offer customer-friendly service to her clients. She started this venture four years ago. Currently, she has 15,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her monthly profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas. 

Victoria is seeking a 9,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise. She is hoping to boost her sales and increase her income as a result. Victoria is hoping to eventually expand her trade and diversify her merchandise even more. Victoria has proved to be a solvent borrower as she has repaid all previous loans without any delays.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene 38 años, está feliz con su matrimonio, es madre de 3 hijos: Cristian (17), Noé (9) y Daniela de 1 año y dos meses. Por el momento viven en la casa de su madre.

Todos los días por la noche se dedica a licuar hierbas y especias frescas, pues su negocio es la venta de condimentos en un mercado cerca a su casa. En esta actividad lleva 13 años y durante este tiempo el crecimiento de su negocio ha sido notable y con esas ganancias logra sostener su hogar. Debido a que su esposo no cuenta con un trabajo estable, eventualmente le ayuda en su puesto de venta.
Luz se siente muy feliz por lo que sabe hacer y sobre todo porque es rentable, cuando se siente cansada de preparar los condimentos sus  hijos la ayudan y eso la motiva a seguir trabajando. 
Su deseo es comprar un terreno y construir su casa, pero sola no puede, es por eso que han decido que su esposo se encargará de la venta de condimentos, mientras que ella empezará a vender ropa, y así podrán ahorrar para hacer realidad su deseo de una casa propia.

Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido responsable con sus pagos, además es la secretaria de su grupo y sabe que no debe defraudar la confianza depositada en ella. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de prendas de vestir para incursionar en su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is a very enterprising woman. She is 38 years old and is a happily married mother of three: Cristian (17), Noé (9) and Daniela (1 yr and 2 mos). At the moment they live in her mother’s house. She spends every evening blending herbs and fresh spices, as her business is the sale of condiments in a marketplace near her home. She has been doing this for 13 years and during that time she has had a noticeable increase in business and is able to maintain her home with this income. Because her husband does not have a steady job, he works with her in her market stall. Luz is happy about what she knows, above all because it is profitable. Whenever she is tired from preparing her condiments, her children help her. This motivates her to keep working. One day she would like to buy some land and build a home, but she can’t do it alone, so they decided that her husband would be in charge of selling the condiments while she begins selling clothing. This way they will be able to fulfill their dreams of owning their own home. This is her twelfth loan through MFP and she has always been responsible with her payments. She is also the secretary of her group and knows that she must not lose the trust that she has earned with the other members. She will invest the money that she is requesting in clothing items to start her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand into a new business venture

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Mrs. Estrella D. is from the village of Bigaan, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with five children who are now adults. She owns and operates a business selling gasoline and variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for more than ten years. She earns 5,000 monthly from the business. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús R. L. con este crédito ya será el tercero y agradece por el apoyo brindado ya que en los anteriores créditos fue para apoyar  el estudio de sus 4 hijos. Como Jesús siempre se ha preocupado por la preparación académica de su familia, no le ha dado importancia a su vivienda es por ello que este crédito lo quiere para terminar de construir la cochera para protección de sus autos y también hacer mas grande su sala comedor. Para poder terminar su proyecto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
This will be Jesús R. L.'s third loan; he is grateful for the support he's gotten because he used the previous loans to pay for his four children's schooling. Because Jesús has always been mainly concerned for his family's education, he hasn't paid much attention to his home. He needs funding now to finish building his carport to protect his cars and to enlarge his livinhg room. To finish the project he needs to buy materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction.

loans.name: Hermano Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad El Parque Industrial encontramos en banco Comunal Hermano Miguel formado por mujeres cabeza de hogar que buscan salir adelante junto a sus hijos y familia en general, esta localidad es reconocida por su actividad económica pues aquí se encuentra un gran número de fabricas y es el parque industrial de la  ciudad de Cuenca.

Rosa Ubaldina es socia de este banco hace 3 años,  incentivada por una ex socia del Bankito, ella vive en su casa propia con sus  cinco hijos de  20, 18, 15, 13, 10 años en el sector del Parque Industrial en la ciudad de Cuenca, ya que su esposo migró a otro país hace 10 años para brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.

Nuestra socia tiene 42 años  y desde hace dos años se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en diferentes casas de la localidad  no tiene un horario fijo y solo trabaja tres días a la semana, el resto de días cuida a un bebe en su casa y realiza las actividades de su hogar.

Lleva varios ciclos en su banco comunal y el dinero obtenido ha utilizado para los gastos de su hogar como educación, alimentación entre otros, con el nuevo crédito solicitado  pagará las planillas de los servicios básicos como agua, luz y teléfono. Tiene como meta  viajar para reunirse con su esposo y trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Mónica tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera de  un niño de dos años que si lo reconoció su padre y le ayuda económicamente para la manutención del niño, ella vive en la casa de un familiar con su hijo.

Se encuentra ocho  años trabajando con la fundación y fue su madre quien se enteró de los beneficios que ofrece la institución por la publicidad entregada en su comunidad,  con los créditos obtenidos ha solventado sus estudios, Mónica es profesora de educación primaria, profesión que ejerce hace ya tres años, labora de 07H30 a 12H30 del día  y por la tarde  se dedica a su hijo y en  la noche va a la  universidad para lograr su Licenciatura en educación básica, está concluyendo sus estudios y por ahora el crédito solicitado lo  invertirá en el desarrollo de su tesis.

Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio propio para compartir con sus otras actividades y dedicarle más tiempo a su hijo.
texts.en:
In the city of Cuenca in the community of El Parque Industrial (The Industrial Park), we find the Hermano Miguel (Brother Michael) Communal Bank, composed of women heads of households who hope to advance their children and families in general. This locality is recognized for its economic activity since here one encounters a large number of factories -- it's the industrial park for the city of Cuenca. Rosa Ubaldina has been a member of this bank for 3 years, motivated by an ex-member of the little bank. She has lived in her own house with 5 children, ages 20, 18, 15, 13, 10, in the Parque Industrial sector in the city of Cuenca, since her husband migrated to another country some 10 years ago to offer a better future for his family. Rosa is 42 years old and for the last 2 years, she has dedicated herself to domestic matters in different homes of the locality. She doesn't have a fixed schedule and only works 3 days a week. On the remaining days she cares for a baby in her own house and takes care of activities in her own home. She has benefited from various loan cycles in her communal bank and the money obtained was utilized for expenses such as education, basic food, etc. With her new loan request she will pay the bills for basic services such as water, lights, and telephone. Her goal is to travel in order to reunite with her husband and to work hard to advance her children. Mónica is 25 years old, the single mother of a 2 year old boy whom the father recognizes and helps maintain economically. She lives in a family member's house with her son. She has been working for 8 years with the Foundation and it was her mother who informed her of the benefits offered by the institution from the publicity available in her community. With past loans, she has paid for her studies. Mónica has been a primary school teacher for 3 years, working from 7:30 am until 12:30 pm, then afternoons she cares for her child, and at night goes to the university to obtain her degree in basic education. She is concluding her studies and at present, her requested loan will be invested in the development of her thesis. Her goal is to have her own business to conduct, along with other activities, and to dedicate more time to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING UTILITY BILLS, INCLUDING WATER, LIGHTS, AND TELEPHONE, AND PAYING COSTS OF AN EDUCATION THESIS

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Se S., 28, sells sweets for children, as well as provides a sewing service for extra income. She also relies on the income from her husband, who is a building foreman. This couple is helping each other in order to generate cash to raise and educate their four children. All of them are going to school. Se S. sees that her husband’s business is profitable, which is the important source of family income. 

Recently, her husband received an order from people who need him to build a new house, but he lacks equipment to perform this service. Se S. is therefore looking for a loan to allow her husband to purchase the essential construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase essential construction materials for home building

loans.name: Tharangani

texts.en:
Tharangani is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband and one daughter in Kekanadura, Matara. Her husband makes jewelry, and her daughter is still in school.

Tharangani assists her husband in his business of jewelry making.  She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her husband's business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to improve the jewelry making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and start a poultry project

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney B. is from the town of Banga. He is 25 years old. Rodney is single. To make a living, Rodney owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rodney has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rodney joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodney has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rodney is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Rodney from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby L. is a 33-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store business.  She lives in Brgy. Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She earns an average income of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Ruby is now borrowing PHP 20,000 for home improvement.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Ruby aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Bismar Enrique

texts.es: Bismar Enrique tiene 44 años, hace más de 10 años que tiene el negocio de pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre le ha gustado luchar y sacar adelante a su hijo que está a cargo. El ofrece sus productos a los transeúntes y a los transportistas que circulan cerca de su negocio. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, por lo que trata de mantenerse de la mejor manera posible, ofreciendo un buen trato a sus clientes y dándoles productos de calidad. El desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que sus ventas puedan incrementarse y perciba mayores ganancias. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, detergentes y pan.
texts.en:
Bismar Enrique is 44 years old and has managed a general store for more than ten years. He has always enjoyed striving to succeed on behalf of his dependent child. Bismar sells his products to passersby and travelers who come to his business. This venture is his only source of income, so he tries to maintain it in the best manner possible by offering good service to his customers and giving them quality products.

Bismar wants to expand his business by purchasing more products so that he can increase his sales and generate more revenue. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, detergents, and bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
