loans.use: Purchase candy, soft drinks, detergents, and bread

loans.name: Chreong's Group

texts.en:
Eight members are making a village bank loan which located in Koah Khael village, Kandal province. Mr. Yen Y. is 66 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by its members. While each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purpose.
Mr. Yen Y. and his wife, Mrs. Mork Mao, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate vegetable and rice. With the farm, they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mr. Yen Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and gasoline to cultivate rice and vegetable. This couple has two children, one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and gasoline to cultivate rice and vegetable

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 50 años de edad, pequeña comerciante de prendas de oro y plata que vende hace varios años.
Iniciando con poco dinero, propio que su esposo dio. El trabaja en servicio de vigilancia.
Su familia se conforma de cinco hijos, mayores de edad. Pues han sido el impulso para salir hacia delante.
La vida no es fácil hay que trabajar duro para lograr el desarrollo y educación de los hijos. Gracias al financiamiento que la institución ha dado durante siete periodos ha aumentado en cantidad de productos, pues son joyas que hay que tener capital en efectivo para comprar y luego ubicarlas a sus mejores clientes.
Con este préstamo comprara: 
Varias pulseras, cadenas, anillos, gargantillas, de plata y oro laminado. Esperando vender más.
texts.en:
Maria is a 50-year-old woman and a small-scale vendor of gold and silver jewelry, which she has sold for several years. She started with just a little money which her husband gave her. His work is providing guard services. Her family includes five children who are already grown. They were Maria's inspiration for getting ahead. Life is not easy for Maria; she has had to work hard to raise and educate her children. Thanks to the financing that the institution has granted through seven loan cycles, she has expanded the number of products she offers. Since she is working with jewelry, she has to have capital in cash to buy the items and then later sell them to her best customers. With this loan, she will buy various silver and gold-plated bracelets, chains and necklaces, with the hope of increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in sets of silver and gold-plated jewelry to increase her sales

loans.name: Jambila

texts.en:
Jambila S., age 48, and her husband are cattle breeders in Kadamjai, a town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. They started this activity six years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. With the money received from the loan, Jambila wants to purchase building materials to repair the shed and finish repairing her house. In the future, she plans to increase the number of cattle and to start repairing her shop. The couple has raised three daughters, all of whom are now working in Russia. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: 
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 
MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in central Asia, please join our Lending Team, "Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance," at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for cattleshed repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion A. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 50 years old. Consolacion is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Consolacion owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Consolacion has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Consolacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consolacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Consolacion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer  trabajadora, económicamente muy humilde, trabaja en limpieza en una empresa privada, casada, siendo su esposo vigilante.
Sus recursos económicos son pocos y es atreves del prestamos en Afodenic ha venido mejorando su casa, tiene una parte de la vivienda toda de concreto. Ya que va poco a poco porque no cuenta con la disponibilidad para hacer un préstamo de mas cantidad.
Es por eso con este financiamiento comenzara la construcción de la otra pared de concreto para poder avanzar en las mejoras para esto comprara: materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ángela es una mujer  trabajadora, económicamente muy humilde, trabaja en limpieza en una empresa privada, casada, siendo su esposo vigilante.
Sus recursos económicos son pocos y es atreves del prestamos en Afodenic ha venido mejorando su casa, tiene una parte de la vivienda toda de concreto. Ya que va poco a poco porque no cuenta con la disponibilidad para hacer un préstamo de mas cantidad.
Es por eso con este financiamiento comenzara la construcción de la otra pared de concreto para poder avanzar en las mejoras para esto comprara: materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Ana Felicita

texts.es:
Ana de 49 años, Vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil lugar caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. Elabora y distribuye peluches. 

Siempre le gusto hacer peluche sin tener ninguna remuneración pero al quedar viuda tubo que conseguir dinero y comenzar a vender los peluches y ha fabricar mas. Poco a poco vio que era rentable esta actividad y comenzó a gastar sus ahorros en telas y materiales para elaborar a mayor cantidad los muñecos de peluche. En la actualidad ella trabaja desde muy temprano con dos personas haciendo peluches de caricaturas y repartiéndolos a las diferentes tiendas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, felpa, relleno para elaborar mas peluches. En el futuro quiere que su microempresa crezca económicamente para ser una de las mejores en Ecuador.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old and lives in El Guasmo, a sector of Guayaquil characterized by the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are merchants. She makes and distributes stuffed animals.

She always liked making stuffed animals without pay but when she became a widow, she had to make money and began to sell the stuffed animals and make more. Little by little, she saw that this business was profitable and she began to spend her savings on fabrics and materials to make a larger number of stuffed animals. Starting very early, she currently works with two people making stuffed animal cartoons and distributing them to different stores.

With the loan, she wants to buy fabrics, plush, and stuffing to make more stuffed animals. In the future she wants her small business to grow financially to be one of the best in Ecuador.

loans.use: Fabrics, plush, stuffing

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Alicia Del Carmen  tiene 34 años es casada y con su pareja tiene  2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzado, entre lo que sobresale la venta de zapatos, deportivos, sandalias, zapatillas, chinelas de baño, pantuflas entre otros. La señora ya tiene 7 años de haber empezado con su negocio,  inicio vendiendo en su casa, fue así que la mayoría de sus clientes la conocen. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que si compra en este momento y vende en noviembre o diciembre, sus ganancias se incrementan ya que es ahora cuando los precios están bajos. Además ella desea diversificar sus mercancías e introducirse a vender otros tipos de calzado. El sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa, por lo que también quiere comprar un modulo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Alicia Del Carmen, 34, is married with two young children. She sells footwear, including shoes, sports shoes, sandals, trainers, bath slippers, flip flops and more. She started her business 7 years ago, initially selling from home, and that's how most of her customers know her. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of goods. At the moment prices are low so if she buys now she can sell in November or December at a profit. She would also like to diversify her business and start selling other kinds of footwear. Her dream has always been to improve her home, and to that purpose she would also like to buy a stall at the local market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela C. is a married woman who lives in Purok New Barbacan, Barangay Retac, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a videoke bar business. Her husband Emiliano C., who is 38 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have four children who are between 7 and 15 years old and are currently going to school. 

Fidela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fidela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $100, raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more supplies for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Fidela C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned their respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Aigul

texts.en:
Aigul A. is a 35-year-old single mother of one child. She lives in Jalal-Abad, a town in the southern part of Kyrgyzstan. In 1996, she entered State Pedagogical University and had great plans for her future. But when she was a second-year student, she was given into marriage in accordance with antiquated nomadic tradition, which fortunately quite rarely exists at present times. Her family life was not very happy, so Aigul decided to raise her daughter by herself. It was very hard for her to find a well-paid job without appropriate education, so she started her own business. 

In 2002, with initial capital of 15,000 Kyrgyz Soms, she began to sell children’s clothes. Aigul is very child-loving by her nature, which helped her to choose an assortment of goods with close attention to comfort and style. Such an attentive attitude to all details of her business led Aigul to expand her business. She took three loans from Bai- Tushum and Partners, which helped her to make her business more successful. These loans were used as intended and repaid without any delays. 

Now Aigul is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her assortment of goods. With the revenues, she plans to renovate her daughter’s room. In the future, Aigul wants to open a big children’s shop with high-quality products and service. As for her personal plans, she dreams of having a tightly-knit family.

About Bai-Tushum:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy T. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 42 years old. Mary Joy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Joy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Mary Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany, de 37 años convive con Richard, de 35 años. Ambos tienen una hija Mayeri, de 11 años. En unión familiar los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Está valerosa y dedicada mujer, se dedica al sembrío de café, donde todos los fines de semana, cuida, fertiliza y retira la maleza que crece entre sus cultivos. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder dedicar tiempo y esfuerzo a algo propio. Por ello en cada cosecha comercializa sus granos de café, en la cooperativa Alto Palomar. Dany, no se dedica únicamente a ello, pues hace tres años atrás, comenzó como promotora educativa en el servicio social del estado peruano, que consta de enseñar a leer, escribir y mejorar la psico motricidad de niños mayores de tres años. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y está segura que todos que integran su banco comunal, logran salir adelante entre ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, planea comprar varios sacos de abono, los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Dany 37, lives with Richard, 35.  They both have a daughter, Mayeri, 11.  The three of them live together as a family in their own house located in Unión Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).  This brave and dedicated woman is a coffee farmer.  Every weekend she tends to her crops fertilizing them and removing weeds that grow among her plants.  She has been in this line of work for 4 years and what she enjoys the most about it is being able to dedicate time and effort to something of her own.  She sells each harvest of coffee beans at the Alto Palomar Cooperative.

Dany isn’t just a farmer.  Three years ago she started working as an educational promoter for the Peruvian State’s social services; she teaches reading, writing and ways of improving psychomotor skills of children older than 3 years.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is sure that all the members of the communal bank will be able to get ahead together.

She will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of manure to spread among her coffee plants.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Homero

texts.en:
Homero G. is a business coach for entrepreneurs. He began "G. NT, Inc." because he saw that people within the small business community needed assistance bringing companies to scale. He has always been interested in the difficulties that businesses face, so when he learned about coaching, he knew this was the perfect job for him. Homero says his competencies are in understanding growth and in teaching, which makes him a successful coach. He helps entrepreneurs build infrastructure in their businesses and teaches them about leadership and communication. He works individually with entrepreneurs to develop a program that is based on their specific goals and needs. Homero likes to work with a business for about a year in order to identify problems, talk through the issues, and implement solutions with the entrepreneur. He works with established businesses as well as emerging ones.  

Homero says that the success and growth of the businesses he works with has to do with the commitment of the entrepreneur. As for his business, he is in the process of writing a growth plan. At the moment he is the only coach at the firm, but he is developing a framework to teach others how to coach. Homero wanted a loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana in order to help expand his presence on the web, which is another important way to grow the company.  

He describes his coaching as “not so much listening, but having the hunger to hear what people say in their own contexts.” He was trained as a social scientist, so he has a strong theoretical background in organizational behavior that helps him succeed at his job. Homero deeply believes in what he does because he knows how important these businesses are to the entrepreneurs who run them. Small business owners invest their whole lives into building their businesses, which is why growth is so important for them.

loans.use: To expand his website

loans.name: Sarifa

texts.en:
Sarifa is a 36-year-old mother of eight children. She has a successful traditional pita bread baking business which serves the area. Sarifa has gained a following as a talented cook with skills in baking. With her business Sarifa is able to pay for her children's school supplies and increase her family's monthly income.

Sarifa needs this loan to purchase supplies & equipment for making and baking pita breads, specifically firewood, bottled gas, and an additional 'taboon'  (outdoor pita stove).

For the next few years, Sarifa will expand her business from home and with the extra income she wants to ensure her children's education. Her dream is to open a full pita and bread store in the future and even expand into a bakery.

loans.use: purchase supplies & equipment for pita bread making

loans.name: Oltitiyio Ole

texts.en:
Oltitiyio Ole S. is a 35-year-old farmer. He is married and a father of three children. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last five years.
  
Oltitiyio learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group in his area that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan, and he plans to use it to buy maize seed, fertilizer, and other chemicals required for the farm. He plans to re-invest profits from the proceeds of the loan in the farm and to plant more acres of maize.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and be able to buy his own farm machinery.

loans.use: To buy maize seed, fertilizer, and other farm chemicals

loans.name: Castillitos De Arena Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CASTILLITOS DE ARENA” es un grupo que iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho personas, 1 varón y 7 mujeres.

La asociación comunal “CASTILLITOS DE ARENA” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Fidelia , la tesorera la señora  Elizabeth y como secretaria de actas la señora Vanesa.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.  Entre esos negocios tenemos:  venta de ropa, comerciante de tejidos, carpintería, comerciante de diversos productos de acuerdo a la época, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y cosméticos, promotora de productos de belleza.
En el caso de la señora  Fidelia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que  desde hace cinco años tiene como negocio la venta de ropa, sus familiares le enseñaron a desenvolverse en este negocio.  La señora Fidelia  realiza las ventas en la Zona 16 de Julio, Ex tranca (Av. Juan Pablo II),  Ceja de El Alto,en diferentes días, recibe la colaboración de su pareja para traladar la mercadería y vender. El crédito que ha solicitado será destinado para comprar ropa para niños y surtir los productos a la venta.

La señora Fidelia es una mujer de  26 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Ha trabajado con Pro Mujer desde hace tres años, ingresó al grupo gracias a la invitación de una amiga.   

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación, la atención en salud.  Tuvo la oportunidad de recibir control prenatal en consultorio y opinó que fue buena.
texts.en:
The “CASTILLITOS DE ARENA” (Little Sand Castles) communal bank is starting its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members: 1 man and 7 women.

The “CASTILLITOS DE ARENA” communal bank set up its governing body thus:  Fidelia is President, Elizabeth is Treasurer and Vanesa is Recording Secretary.  The businesses of the members are varied.  They are in commerce, service and production.  Among them are: clothing sales, weavings sales, carpentry, seasonal items sales, cosmetics sales, food and cosmetics sales, beauty products sales.

Fidelia, communal bank President, indicates that she has been selling clothing for the last five years.  Her family taught her how to carry out this kind of business.  Fidelia sells in the 16 de Julio zone, Tranca Extension (John Paul II Avenue), Ceja de El Alto, on different days.  Her spouse helps her transport the merchandise and with sales.  The loan she’s asking for is to buy children’s clothes to stock for sale.

Fidelia is 26 years old living with her spouse and their three children.  She’s collaborated with Pro Mujer for three years having been invited to join by a girl friend.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and health services.  She had to opportunity to get prenatal care in the clinic and her opinion was that it was good.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married with two children, who both attend school. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. James' wife is a lecturer and she contributes to her family's basic needs.

James has operated a retail shop for the past three years, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of establishing a supermarket in the future. James plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of sugar, rice and maize flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Perlitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Justina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tejido de mantas, tejido de chompas, venta de comida, tejido de gorritos, tejido de buzos.

La señora Justina, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es su primer ciclo con  Pro Mujer y que ingreso por la promosión en zona que se desarrolla

En la actualidad la señora Justina tiene un negocio de elaboración de productos en tejido que trabaja hace 20 años, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió ella sola. El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de lana para vender polainas por mayor. Su materia prima la compra de la 16 de Julio de las tiendas grandes, los productos ya concluidos los venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene cinco hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los servicios integrales, salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The rural communal bank "Perlitas" is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, at its central offices in Los Andes.  This group has 8 members, and the president is Justina.  The group members have a variety of different businesses, including: weaving blankets, knitting sweaters, selling food, knitting hats, and knitting jackets.

Justina, president of the communal bank, states that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the organization because of a promotion in her area.

Justina currently has a business making knitted products.  She has done this work for 20 years, and she tells us that she learned this business on her own.  She will use this loan to purchase wool so that she can sell leggings at wholesale.  She purchases her raw materials from the big stores on "16 de Julio" street, and she will sell the finished products in the  markets.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family; she is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the comprehensive services offered, including both health and credit services.

loans.use: to purchase wool to make leggings to sell at wholesale

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 35 year-old married man, living in Saida with his wife and 2 children. Firas has manufactured prefabs since 1995. His business is developing well, but the country's financial situation provides only slow growth or no growth at all.

Firas is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to buy necessary tools for his business. He also needs the loan to pay expenses for his wife's giving birth to his third baby.  Firas is very excited about this baby and believes that everything will go fine after his birth.   Deep inside he feels that this baby will bring happiness, health, and love for his family, in addition to improving his business.
Firas hopes to expand his business through more marketing.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business, and to pay for his wife's giving-birth expenses

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en: Leatitia is 36 years old.  She has one child who is 17 years old and is in school.  Her husband is a farmer.  Leatitia sells tomatoes wholesale at the market. She has been selling tomatoes for the past 8 years.  With the help of her business, she is able to meet both her and her child’s needs.  Leatitia is requesting a loan to purchase large quantities of tomatoes to make more profit.

loans.use: buy large quantities of tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Atossowè

texts.fr: Veuve de 43 ans, Mme Atossowoè a deux enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins des siens elle s’est lancée dans la vente de charbons de bois depuis 1998 : elle s’approvisionne à Anié une ville tropicale située dans la région des plateaux au  nord de la ville de Lomé et revend après à domicile. Ce premier crédit lui servira à augmenter son actif pour satisfaire la demande, assurer un avenir radieux à elle et à ses enfants.
texts.en: A widow of 43, Mrs. Atossowoè has two children. In order to support her little family, she got into the sale of charcoal back in 1998. She buys her supply at Anié, a tropical town situated in the highlands north of the city of Lomé, and she sells the charcoal out of her home. This first loan will serve to add to her stock in trade so as to satisfy demand and ensure a bright future for her and her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a businessman who does welding.  He has been in the business for two years and has employed three people.  He has witnessed a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.   He also bought a welding machine with his previous loan.  He hopes to grow his business and register it as a company.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Mercy Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercy, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  11, 3 y de 1 año, la mayor  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es  marino mercante y trabaja en Galápagos. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la ciudad.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde se dedica a coser todo tipo de ropa y también a realizar arreglos a prendas de vestir. Además de esto también se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos por catalogo  de varias marcas, trabaja a base de pedidos, la venta de los productos las realiza en su taller y algunas veces recorre puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva con las ventas de estos productos desde que empezó en el banco y con las costuras mucho más tiempo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, zapatos, telas, botones, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva seis ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó con su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y ser una gran empresaria
texts.en:
The members of the "Nueva Estrella Solidaria" (New Star Solidarity) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi.   The city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we met Mercy, who is 32 years old, married and has three children, ages 11, 3 and 1 years old.  The eldest is in school. Her husband is a merchant seaman and works in the Galapagos. Several years ago Mercy learned dressmaking at an academy in the city. 

Mercy has a small sewing shop in her house where she sews all types of clothes and also tailors clothing.  In addition, she also sells clothes and shoes through catalogs of various brands.  She works based on orders, selling products made in her workshop and she also sometimes goes door to door. Mercy works every day from 6:00 am to 11:00 pm and sometimes even later when she has orders to deliver. Mercy started selling these products since the communal bank began, and has been sewing even longer.

This new loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, fabrics, buttons, thread and other sewing materials. Mercy has completed six cycles in the communal bank and likes it because her business started with a loan. 
  
Her dreams are to have a bigger workshop and to be a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, fabrics, yarns, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: A 43-year-old resident of  Plaridel, Mercedita is married and the mother of three children. For the past 23 years, Mercedita has worked in the fish industry selling fish for a living. A member of PMPC for 11 years, she has requested a loan for 5000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Trabajadoras es la ciudad de Luque, se inició gracias a la iniciativa de 4 señoras, quienes ya habían formado parte de otro comité, ellas comentaron a sus vecinas y amigas sobre el proyecto y ellas encantadas formaron parte del comité. Actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del Programa y esta conformado por 20 señoras que invierten en distintas actividades.
La señora Juliana, ella esta casada, con el señor Leoncio quien es pintor de obras, juntos tienen tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, tiene ya una cantidad de clientes bien definidos, que cada lapso de tiempo van a comprar de ella sus ropas. Ella esta muy contenta con su trabajo ya que por medio de este ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a su marido con la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de temporada, lo cual le servirá para abastecer su negocio y así poder cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Trabajadoras' committee is based in the city of Luque.  It was formed thanks to the initiative of four ladies who had been members of another committee.  They talked to their neighbors and friends about the project.  They were very keen to join and so they formed a committee.  The group is currently in its second cycle of the program and is made up of 20 ladies who invest in different business activities.

Juliana is married to Leoncio who is a painter and decorator.  The couple have three children.  Juliana sells clothes.  She already has a number of well-defined customers who come to buy clothes from her every so often.  She is very happy with her work since it has enabled her to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses.

Juliana is requesting this loan to buy seasonal clothes.  This will allow her to stock her business and meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes to sell

loans.name: Tatiana Karina

texts.es:
Tatiana es una mujer soltera de 33 años, vive sola con su pequeño hijo de 5 años en el cantón de San miguel de los Bancos. Siempre tuvo una vida tranquila, la que comúnmente se tiene en las poblaciones rurales. Desde la llegada de su hijo se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar y así poder sustentar sus necesidades.

Hace tres años ella puso su criadero de cerdos, los mismos que son faenados para vender su carne. Este trabajo lo realizaba el padre de su hijo y ella aprendió para luego hacer el negocio sola. Ella cría a los cerdos ó los compra listos para faenarlos, y los días en los que acude al camal lo debe hacer a la madrugada, de esta manera la carne que es comprada por los intermediarios puede ser vendida en las ferias temprano en la mañana. El lugar donde tiene a los cerdos es precario y alcanzan pocos. No tiene reja y por ello debe amarrarlos. Por esta razón ella necesita un crédito y así poder arreglar su criadero.

Como toda madre, todos los esfuerzos los hace por dar una mejor vida a su hijo. Tatiana únicamente ha cursado la primaria y desea ver algún día profesional a su hijo.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a 33 year old single mother and lives alone with her 5 year old son in the “San Miguel de los Bancos” settlement.  She’s always had a simple life, as is common in rural areas, but once her son came, she saw the need to begin working to be able to provide for him.

Three years ago she began raising pigs.  Her son’s father used to do this work, but she later learned how to do it on her own.  She either raises the pigs or buys them to butcher them.  When she does this, it must be done by early morning so that the meat can be sold to wholesalers so that they can resell it early in the morning.  Her pigpen is small and only holds a few pigs.  It doesn’t have a gate and she must keep them tied up.  She needs this loan in order to fix up her pigpen.

Like any mother, all of her efforts are so that she can give a better life to her son.  Tatiana only completed elementary school and wants her son to someday have a professional career.

loans.use: to repair her pigpen.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, five of whom are currently in school. For the past four years Teopista has operated a market where she sells a variety of essential commodities like soap and sugar.

Teopista is a member of BRAC Uganda’s small enterprise program. To help expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC. The loan will be used to purchase more of these commodities to sell.

Through the loan Teopista hopes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her children. In the future Teopista hopes to expand her business so as to employ more workers.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities like soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Buenísimos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Buenísimos lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas Rosa Esmeralda quien vende cosechas de frutas y verduras desde hace 30 años. Ella en este negocio invierte alrededor de 11, 000 córdobas mensuales y vende 18,800 córdobas mensuales. 
Ella con el crédito compra mayor cantidad de cosechas de frutas y verduras de temporada.
Las otras integrantes son Julia quien vende enchiladas, platanitos, arroz con leche y torta de leche…etc. y Erick vende ropa (pantalones, blusas, chores)
texts.en:
The "Buenísimos"groups is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is Rosa Esmeralda, who has been selling fresh fruit and vegetables for the last 30 years.  She invests about 11,000 córdobas monthly into her business, and sells about 18,800 córdobas worth monthly.

With the loan, she is going to buy a large amount of seasonal fresh fruit and vegetables.

The other members are Julia who sells enchiladas, plantains, rice pudding, milk pudding, etc., and Erick, who sells clothes (trousers, blouses, shorts).

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: María Roxana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen tres hijos de 10, 7 y 1 año, los mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de lotería.

Nuestra amiga es un ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma  de venta es puerta en puerta y también entrega en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja tres días a la semana unas cuatro horas ya que después tiene que atender su hogar y  a sus hijos en sus tareas de la escuela. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada semana, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva más de seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio y en el negocio de su marido, va a comprar  pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños y billetes de lotería.  Es su tercer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal   y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Su sueño es terminar su casa que aun la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The communal bank August 30th meets in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, known for its commerce, its traditional celebrations for San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its people. 

Señora María, 32, lives here with her common-law husband, and their three children, 1, 7, and 10 years old. The older children are in school. Her husband sells lottery tickets. 

María is a housewife who, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, sells all kinds of clothing. She sells door-to-door, and her best customers also come to her house. She works three days a week for about four hours so that afterwards she can tend the house and help her children with their schoolwork. 

Her customers buy on credit, and she collects every week. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise whenever she needs to. She has done this work for more than six years, and it's going pretty well. 

She is going to invest the money from this loan in her business and that of her husband, purchasing pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, and lottery tickets. This is her third loan cycle in the communal bank, and she likes the benefits the organization offers. Her dream is to finish her house, which is still under construction.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Milcerio

texts.es: Milcerio tiene 47 años, es un hombre muy sensible y responsable. Vive con su esposa Amanda; que es su compañera desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Queta. La siembra y cosecha de papas es la actividad al que se dedica desde hace 30 años. Cuenta que antes de ir a sus terrenos, alimenta a sus burros y caballos que son muy útiles para transportar los sacos durante la cosecha, además de las 25 ovejas que tiene. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, olluco, arveja y habas, que produce las 5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola; el cual vende al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le molesta es ver que sus siembras han quedado en la tierra debido al hielo y otros como la gusanera. Pero eso no lo desanima, al contrario le brinda fuerzas para continuar. Pronto cosechará papa de la variedad “andina” y está seguro que tendrá buenos resultados; además lo motiva la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes son buenos y trabajadores; pues todavía estudian. Él pertenece al banco comunal “San Jerónimo de Queta” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde demostró mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos, y para este ciclo se compromete seguir la misma dinámica de pago. Milcerio, tiene pensado sembrar papa de la variedad “andina” y “amarilis” por ello de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlo en su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Milcerio, 47, is a clear-headed and responsible man.  He lives with his wife, Amanda, his companion for 25 years.  They have 5 children together, 4 of whom still live at home.  They live in a house they own in the small town of Queta.  Milcerio is a farmer, work that he's done for 30 years.  He tells us that before he heads out to his fields, he feeds his donkeys and horses--useful for carrying heavy loads at harvest time--and the 25 head of sheep that he owns.  He grows potatoes, olluco, beans and peas on 5 hectares of land and sells what he harvests at the Tarma wholesale market.  What most bothers him are the plants that he loses to frost and worms.  He doesn't dwell on the problems that he faces, though, choosing instead to fight and overcome them.  He will soon harvest a crop of Andean-variety potatoes and he's sure that he'll be happy with the results.  He's driven to work in part for his children, all of whom are good, hard-working young men and women and still in school.  Milcerio belongs to the San Jeronimo de Queta community bank and this is his eighth MFP loan.  He's paid past loans on time and is committed to repaying this one in the same responsible way.  Milcerio will use the loan to buy fertilizers for his next crop of "Andeans" and "yellows".

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Gloire A Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GLOIRE A DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Rosine Yémadi, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Rosine Yémadi est âgée de 31 ans et n'est pas encore mariée. C'est une célibataire qui vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Rosine Yémadi a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Rosine Yémadi mène comme activité la vente de conserves et parallèlement, la vente de cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son quartier. Rosine Yémadi exerce cette activité depuis huit ans environs. Rosine Yémadi s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Rosine Yémadi désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Rosine Yémadi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GLOIRE A DIEU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The "Gloire A Dieu" group is made up of 3 women who live in the same area of Benin. The group are requesting their third loan from ALIDé in order to be able to increase their level of business activity.

The group's representative, Rosine Yémadi, is the woman in the picture with her hand raised. Rosine Yémadi is 31 years old and single. She lives alone and earns enough to cover her own living expenses. She does not have much formal schooling and has been earning a living selling canned goods and prepaid phone cards to customers in her area for about 8 years. She gets her supplies in Benin.

Rosine Yémadi would like to be able to reinforce and diversify her business activities so that she can better meet customer demand. For this reason, she and the other members of the "Gloire A Dieu" group are requesting their third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and prepaid phone cards for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children. 
Mary has a general store and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store. 
Mary has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en:
Sreang is a 41-year-old farmer who is married with two children. She is also a fisherwoman and she raises cows and horses. Sreang has run her agriculture businesses for 21 years. 

Sreang is requesting her second loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy a water pump for her farm and also to buy cows and horses. Sreang hopes to increase her crop yield and quality to increase her income and improve her ability to provide for her family’s expenses. In the future, she hopes to raise more cows and horses and also to have some savings for future needs.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and livestock

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesus

texts.es:
Guadalupe, vive con su familia, una hija y su esposo, Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de comida, trabaja todos los días de la semana ofreciendo comida a los vecinos y lugares cercanos, ya tiene experiencia en el negocio y lo hace para obtener ingresos que ayuden a solventar gastos en su hogar.
Ella comprara una mesa térmica, para esto solicita un préstamo que le cubra el gasto, y de las ganancias que produzcan las ventas, pagara las cuotas, ya que esta inversión es muy necesaria para mejorar la vistosidad del comedor, mejorando su imagen ante los clientes.
La aspiración de Guadalupe es que a través de los préstamos pueda crecer en el negocio, y comprarse su propia casa.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives with her family, her daughter and her husband.  Guadalupe works selling food.  She works ever day of the week providing meals to her neighbors and people from nearby locations.  She has experience in this business, and works to obtain income to help cover her household expenses.

She will be buying a heated serving table, so she is requesting a loan to cover the cost.  She will make her repayments from the earnings that she will generate with her sales, and this investment is highly necessary to improve the way her diner looks, improving her image with her customers.

Guadalupe's aspiration is that through loans, she will be able to grow her business and purchase her own home.

loans.use: to buy a heated serving table to keep her food hot.

loans.name: Kimwai Sisimuka A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kimwai Sisimuka A Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Gilbert is the facilitator of the Kimwai Sisimuka A Group. He takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Gilbert had an excellent maize yield harvesting 37 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Gilbert was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gilbert and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Gilbert will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Kimwai Sisimuka A group will each plant between half and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: For the last five years, Ekua has earned a living by selling cassava and plantain in the town of Besease. She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. She plans to use this loan to buy more cassava and plantain to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and plantain to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jacqueline Javiera

texts.es: Jaqueline Javiera tiene 34 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general es una emprendedora que ha tenido mucho. Hace mas de 11años que tiene este medio de vida, ella es una mujer responsable y disfruta de tener este negocio. Siempre le ha gustado luchar y mejorar su condición de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra  de calzado, cosméticos, perfumes, ropa en general, reloj y prendas de oro y plata y otra mercadería que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en: Jaqueline Javiera is 34 years old. Her economic activity is selling merchandise. In general, she is an enterprising woman who has had a lot. She has been doing this for more than 11 years. She is a responsible woman and she enjoys having this business. She has always liked to fight for and improve her quality of life. The reason for the loan is to buy shoes, cosmetics, perfume, general clothing, clocks and gold and silver jewelry and other merchandise that her customers ask her for.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, perfumes, general clothing, clocks and gold and silver  jewelry and other merchandise.

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Luz Eliana; La socia continua con su negocio de elaboración de pan, la socia compra los ingredientes como son manteca, harina, levadura entre otros productos y los prepara y alquila el horno y una vez que obtiene los panes los coloca en su canasta familiar para llevarlosa vender desde muy temprano en la misma plaza principal del poblado y aqui paran todos los buses, combis, taxis, carros particulares que van desde Cusco a  la ciudad de Arequipa, Puno, Puerto Maldonado. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de panes.
texts.en: Luz Eliana continues with her bread baking business.  She buys ingredients like shortening, flour and yeast, among other products.  She prepares the bread and leases an oven.   Once she obtains the bread she puts them into a family basket and goes out to sell them very early in her town’s square where buses, taxis, cooperative taxis and private vehicles stop on their trip from Cusco to Arequipa, Puno and Puerto Maldonado.  On this occasion, she wants to buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.use: to buy bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana y su esposo son una pareja de edad adulta y sus  hijos que tuvieron ya son personas que están mayores y ya formaron sus propias familia. Por lo que estas personas ya se encuentran solos, que solo dependen de su misma pensión que reciben cada mes. Juana  quiere terminar la barda de enfrente de su casa que hace años solo puso una maya ciclónica para protegerse de los delincuentes pero no es suficiente por eso quiere ponerla de block para que este mejor resistente. Para esto necesita comprar cemento, varilla, arena y pagar mano de obra de esta manera quedara concluido su proyecto.
texts.en: Mrs. Juana and her husband are an elderly couple and their adult children are older and have already formed their own family. So they are already alone, and only depend on the same pension they receive each month.  Juana wants to finish the fence in front of her house that years ago she only put a chain-link to protect herself against offenders but it is not enough so she wants to put a block for better resistance. For this she needs to buy cement, rod, sand and pay for labor so the project will be completed.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano de 60 años de edad, es viudo pero tiene 6 hijos, de las que solo 2 viven junto a él en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Mariano es agricultor, cultiva productos como el cacao y café desde ya hace 40 años en su parcela agrícola. Luego que su esposa falleciera tuvo que ser fuerte y reponerse, poniendlo toda su dedicación a su trabajo. Actualmente vive feliz, cultivando de la mano de peones que contrata, y le facilitan en la extracción de sus productos. En un futuro desea abrir una tienda para que pueda dejar las labores agrícolas ya que la  edad no le favorece, y así dejarle a sus hijos para que ellos continuen con esta labor. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizara el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Mariano is 60 years old and he is a widower. He has 6 children, of whom only 2 live with him in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Mariano is a farmer. He has grown crops such as cocoa and coffee for the last 40 years in his agricultural plot. After his wife passed away he had to be strong and recover, committing himself to his job. Presently he lives happily, cultivating through hired labourers who aid in the extraction of the products.

In the future he hopes to open a shop so that he can leave his agricultural work as he isn't getting any younger. This way he can leave his children to continue with this work. This will be his second loan with MFP and he is committed to paying his quotas punctually. With the 3,000 PEN he will hire labourers to farm his agricultural land.

loans.use: to hire labourers.

loans.name: Recardina

texts.es:
Recardina es una mujer viuda de 63 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su hija Delia, de 25 años.
La edad de Recardina no le impide que siga laborando en la actividad que durante 10 años lleva realizando. Vende productos naturales, vitamínicos y de nutrición de una marca en particular con la ayuda de un catálogo, es algo que a ella le gusta mucho. Durante las mañanas se encuentra en su casa realizando los quehaceres domésticos, pero en las tardes sale a ofrecer sus productos dentro de su localidad y fuera de ella. Comenta que siempre tiene ingresos, debido a su amabilidad y el ingenio que tiene logra convencer de que le compren sus productos; pero después de tanto caminar llega a su hogar muy cansada. Pero aun así, sigue laborando al día siguiente, como todos los días. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente contenta por apoyo que le brindan. Al igual que se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. También agradece a su banco comunal por ser personas solidarias y responsables.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita comprará más productos (suplementos nutricionales y para el control de peso, en pastillas y en polvo).
texts.en: Recardina is a 63-year-old widow, she lives at home with her daughter Delia, 25.  Recardina's age doesn't stop her from working in the activity that she has been doing for 10 years.  She sells natural products from Omnilife, it's something that she likes very much.  During the morning she is at home doing her housework but in the afternoon she leaves the house to offer the products in and outside her comunity.  She mentions that she always has income, due to her nice personality and ingenuity she convinces clients to buy her product; however after so much walking she gets home really tired. In spite of that she continues to work the next day like every day.  This is her first loan with MFP, she is happy with their support.  She commits to be punctual with the repayments.  She also thanks the community bank for being responsible and helpful people.  With the 1,000 new soles that she requests she will buy more products of the brand she sells.

loans.use: Comprará más productos naturales y suplementos nutricionales

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mrFbe_TSG7U

Daniel is 54 years old, married and has five children. He has been a solar lamp distributor for NOTS Lampes Solaire for the past three years.  Last year Daniel used Kiva funds to purchase solar lamp inventory worth $20,275.  He successfully paid back his Kiva loan and now hopes to increase the loan size to $53,000 in order to purchase 2.500 solar lamps from NOTS Lampes Solaire and sell them to cotton farmers on credit.

Prior to selling solar lamps, Daniel studied agriculture and engineering and worked as a farm manager at a Malian textile company. He started his own company because he believes that solar lamps are very useful for rural families who live in his region. Daniel’s main customers are farmers from Sikasso, the southernmost region in Mali. The majority of his customers do not have access to electricity - they light their homes with kerosene, flashlights and candles instead.  To charge their mobile phones, they walk long distances to a kiosk and pay money.

On top of being dangerous, time-consuming and toxic, these energy sources are expensive. They cost a family about $80 per year or 10% of their annual income!  And during the rainy season it is even worse, as kerosene is often not available or is very expensive.

A d.light solar lamp lasts for about five years and costs $25. Purchasing a solar lamp saves families time and money (about $375 over 5 years!) and is much safer and healthier.  The environment also benefits – no more toxic waste or dirty CO2 emissions. 

Daniel recently signed an agreement with the Union of Cotton Producer Cooperatives to promote solar lamps to the 15.000 cotton farmers in his region.  He conservatively estimates that he can sell 2.500 lamps to these farmers.  When the farmers sell their cotton harvest, they can pay Daniel for the solar lamp.

Your Kiva investment will help bring light to approximately 10,000 lives and help Daniel to provide for his family and expand his business.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy solar lamps that he will sell to cotton farmers.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Mrs. Dieu is 42 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and three children. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry and fishing are  main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity  and  selling fish, which her husband caught.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Catarino

texts.en:
Catarino lives in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon, he has 2 very young boys for which he works very hard every day. He is working in clothes sales and offers them in popular markets, his two boys help him in the business, and for this reason his business has become a way to be close with them. He wants to provide them a good education and he knows to get it, he needs to work every day.

Catarino requires a loan of $1825 USD to purchase merchandise because this Christmas season, he hopes increase his sales and also he can increase his incomes. He just wants to continue paying her boy’s studies and he and his family expect your support and generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Catarino vive en Sabinas Hidalgo Nuevo León, tiene 2 hijos muy jóvenes por los cuales trabaja muy duro todos los días. Se dedica a la venta de ropa en pulgas o mercados populares, sus dos hijos trabajan en el negocio, por lo que este se ha convertido en un medio mas para que Catarino tenga una relación más cercana con ellos. El desea proporcionarles una buena educación y sabe que para conseguirlo necesita trabajar todos los días.

Catarino requiere de un préstamo de $1825 USD para comprar mercancía debido que esta temporada navideña, el espera un aumento en sus ventas y de así incrementar sus ingresos, de esta forma seguirá pagando los estudios de sus hijos. El y su familia esperan tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: I am a widow, a mother of 6. I sell cooked food for a living. I intend to use the loan to venture into a more organised food-selling business, selling varieties of dishes so as to be able to meet my family's needs.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Veronica has 2 years of experience running her own business. She started when she was young helping her mother with her business of selling fruits. She really enjoyed the work and little by little she was able to save money. Using this capital, she decided to start selling chickens. She works every day of the week from 5am until 2pm. Sometimes, she has a lot of demand right into the late afternoon.

Veronica requires credit to buy more chickens since the demand is rising. Additionally, she wants to start raising her own chickens in order to keep her costs low. That will also bring her more earnings.

Veronica is a single mother. She is 30 years old and has 2 children who are studying. Her business is based in her mother's home, which helps a lot. She also has a fruit stand at a local market near her home. When she cannot attend the stand, her father is there. She hopes to be able to locate her fruit stand business in her mothers home one day. There is good demand for her product and she is recognized in the neighborhood for her business acumen.

Verónica tiene una experiencia de 2 años con su negocio propio. Se inicio desde muy pequeña ayudándole a su mama en el negocio de venta de frutas. Gusto mucho el trabajo que ella poco a poco con sus ahorros decide comenzar con un capital pequeño para vender pollos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 5 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. . En algunos casos hasta la noche cuando tiene demasiada demanda.

Verónica desea el crédito para comprar mas pollos ya que su demanda va en aumento. Además desea ella misma comenzar a criar sus propios pollos y de esta manera sus costos van ha ser mas baratos. Lo que le dejaría mayor ganancia.

Verónica es madre soltera. Tiene 30 años. Dos hijos los que estudian. Su negocio lo tiene en casa de su mama la que la apoya bastante. Además tiene un puesto de frutas en un mercado cerca de su domicilio. El que cuando ella no puede atenderlo lo hace su papa. Su deseo es poder adecuar un local en casa de su mama para poner el negocio de las frutas. Tiene una buena demanda su producto y es bien reconocida en el sector.

loans.use: Buy and raise more chickens

loans.name: Delmira

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

La Señora Delmira empezó su negocio hace 4 año, vende ropa para niños en las afueras de la ciudad, tiene como respaldo para su trabajo a sus dos hijos los cuales siempre salen a la entrega de sus productos ya que sus clientes cada día crecen y ella solo no se alcanza

Mrs. Delmira began her business four years ago. She sells childrens’ clothes in the outskirts of the city. She has her children as support for her business as they deliver her products to her growing clientele, which she cannot handle by herself.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

La señora confía en su crédito ya que necesita comprar mercadería de la temporada de frió, pues tiene varios pedidos y su economía no le alcanza para poder realizar una inversión fuerte su preocupación es que sus clientes siempre estén satisfechos

Mrs. Delmira has trust in the loan, which she will use to buy seasonal merchandise for the cold weather, given she has several orders and her income does not meet for a strong investment. Her concern is to be able to meet her clients’ satisfaction.

Información Personal // Personal Information

Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales tres viven con ella, uno de ellos estudia, su vivienda es de caña y su meta es en un tiempo futuro tener su negocio en casa

Mrs. Delmira has six children of which three live with her and one studies. Her home is made out of bamboo and her goal is to be able to have her business at home.

loans.use: Comprar mercaderia de temporada // Purchase  seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes C. is married, she is the mother of five and she has been designing and making textiles from wool of alpaca, vicuña and thread. She sells these clothes in an ambulatory way in the fairs of her city El Alto. Her main market is in the city of Opuro, where she travels twice a week, mainly the days that there are fairs. Mrs. Mercedes needs the loan so she can continue traveling to Oruro. Since she gives her clothes on credit she cannot overlook her clients because she and her family depend from her business activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes C., casada y madre de cinco hijos, se dedica hace mas de veinte años a la confección de textiles de vicuña, alpaca e hilo, mismas que vende de forma ambulante en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Pero su principal mercado se encuentra en la ciudad de Oruro, donde ella viaja en un promedio de dos veces a la semana, principalmente en los días de feria de esa ciudad. Por esta razón Mercedes necesita de dinero para continuar realizando sus viajes a la ciudad de Oruro, puesto que la mercadería que ella produce, la vende a crédito y no puede descuidar a sus clientes, ya que de esta actividad depende ella y toda su familia.

loans.use: Mercedes necesita de dinero para continuar realizando sus viajes a la ciudad de Oruro, puesto que la mercadería que ella produce, la vende a crédito y no puede descuidar a sus clientes, ya que de esta actividad depende ella y toda su familia.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda is 40 years old and lives with her five-year-old daughter, who is her inspiration to keep working and fulfill her dreams. She belongs to the Working Women's Cooperative Bank and lives in San Martin, in the district and province of Lamas, and works at the municipal market in Lamas. Eduarda began humbly, selling small quantities of fruits and vegetables on the street, but through great care and dedication she has arrived at where she is now with a market stall and growing customer base. Eduarda is asking for a loan of 800 soles, or around $275, to buy all kinds of fruit and vegetables: papayas, oranges, mandarin oranges, yuca, cilantro, onions and peppers and bananas. She will repay the loan in 4 months.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eduarda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Lamas. Su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Junín Cdra. 1, Mercado Municipal de Lamas y se dedica a la venta de frutas, y verduras frescas y de calidad. Gracias a su esmero y dedicación ha logrado que su negocio prospere, pues cuando empezó vendía por las calles en formas ambulante pequeñas cantidades de frutas, actualmente posee un puesto en le mercado de Lamas, vende frutas y verduras en mayores cantidades, su clientela ha crecido considerablemente. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 ($267.00), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará frutas en variedad como papaya, naranjas, mandarinas en cientos, además yuca en sacos, culantro, cebolla china en kilos, ajíes de distintas variedades, plátanos en racimos entre otros. La señora Eduarda tiene 40 años, vive con su menor hija de 5 años quien es el motor que le da energía para seguir trabajando y llegar a cumplir con sus sueños.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Muqqadas

texts.en: I am Muqqadas B.. I am married and a mother of seven children, two boys and five girls. Three of my daughters are done with their studies while the other two are in grades five and one, respectively. My sons are small and they also attend school, so my husband is the only one supporting our family. My husband operates a small hotel in one of the nearby, more crowded areas. He wants to expand his business and requires a loan of $200 for this purpose. With this loan he will buy table chairs and a stock of flour for his business. This loan will help him to earn more for us and keep us comfortable.

loans.use: Buy furniture for the resturant

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa Idalia arrived in the city of Reynosa 3 years ago. Her first job was helping her brother work in a taco shop during the afternoon. As time passed, she decided to start her own business. She started in her house, selling school supplies. This generated good earning and with those she began to grow her business. Now she has a store separate from her home.

Nonetheless, she needs to purchase display cases and merchandise in order to complete her remodeling. For this reason, Rosa Idalia is requesting a credit of $550 which she will pay within 6 months and with this money purchase display cases and merchandise needed to offer a greater selection to her customers. With your help, Rosa will be able to succeed and build equity for the moment when she decided to begin a family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Idalia llegó a la ciudad de Reynosa hace ya 3 años, su primer trabajo fue ayudándole a su hermano atendiendo una taqueria por las tardes. Con el paso del tiempo ella decidió poner su propio negocio, inicio en su casa vendiendo artículos para la escuela, esto le generaba buenos ingresos y conforme a ellos se ha ido ampliando, ahora ya tiene un local afuera de su casa.

Sin embargo necesita comprar mostradores y mercancía para poder completar su remodelación. Es por eso que Rosa Idalia está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mostradores y comprar la mercancía necesaria para poder ofrecerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rosa podrá salir adelante y formar un patrimonio para cuando desee formar una familia.

loans.use: Purchase furniture and materials for expansion

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children. The I. family lives in Khachmaz region, and Bayram has 5 years of experience in cattle breeding.  Now this family needs a loan of $725 to buy another cow in order to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Busazi East Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rehema N.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Rehema is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Rehema makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house.

Rehema is joined in her small group by Christine O., Hadija N., Jane M., and Monica K.. Christine O. has a business in charcoal sales and wants to increase inventory. Hadija N. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Jane M. operates a business of selling tomatoes and wants to boost business. Monica K. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase clothes in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables and add stock

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is 25 years old and is a single woman. She is a clothing seller who started in this line of work in 2003. Every day, Felista works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stationary supplies, notebooks, and pens. She has requests for the upcoming school year.

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr:
Marie Jeanne C., aged 50, is married with five children to look after, and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona for seven years. She wants to strengthen her business, which consists of buying lemons, palm oil, dried fish and oysters in Kafountine and selling them on in Dakar with the help of her daughter. Her earnings allow her to help take care of her family. Marie Jeanne is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Marie Jeanne C., 50 ans, mariée 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter du citron, de l’huile de palme, du poisson sec et des huitres à Kafountine et revendre à Dakar avec l’aide de sa fille. Ses revenus lui permettent d’aider à la prise en charge de sa famille. Marie Jeanne sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Food retail

loans.name: June

texts.en: 43 year old June A. is married, with one child. As an experienced shopkeeper, she sells to the public seven days per week , earning a weekly net cash flow of approximately 500 Tala (~208 USD). Along with her shop, June also has a plantation business to diversify her sources of income. SPBD loans are June’s only access to capital because she has not  qualified for a loan with the traditional banks. She has received five previous loans from SPBD.

loans.use: To re-stock and expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of various goods to restock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is single, 33, and a mother of a 14 year old daughter who is a high school student and her reason to advance. For four years, she has worked hard to sell and serve food at her home. She works the entire day, selling breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She depends on her daughter, who helps and supports her very much. What she likes about her work is that she knows many people and they like to eat good food. She doesn't have difficulties, for her business is doing well. Norma works to meet her daily needs and to fund her daughter's education. She would like to buy more tables and chairs for her customers. Later on, she would like to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Norma es soltera, tiene 33 años y es madre de una hija de 14 años que estudia en la secuandaria y es su razón de ser y salir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de comida dentro de su vivienda desde hace 4 años, esta actividad la realiza todo el día, ya que vende desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, quien la ayuda mucho. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente y que las personas degusten de su buena sazón. No tiene dificultades, ya que su negocio marcha bien. Norma trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios y la educación de su hija. Ella quiere comprar más mesas y sillas, porque las que tiene no alcanzan para todos los clientes. Posteriormente quiere poner un restaurante.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for her food business

loans.name: Bibata

texts.fr:
Madame K. Bibata est née en 1979 à Kouloundè dans la préfecture de Tchaoudjo au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Son activité principale est la couture. En 2003, elle a ouvert son atelier qu’elle dénomme « couture lumière » dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle n’arrive pas à bénéficier de l’appui de son mari mais elle ne dispose pas aussi les moyens nécessaires pour acquérir les équipements indispensables pour son métier.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une machine à plinthe pour une valeur de 300.000FCFA
texts.en:
Mrs. Bibata K. was born in 1979 in Kouloundè in the Tchaoudjo prefecture in the north of Togo. She is married and the mother of two children. Her principal business is sewing. In 2003, she opened her workshop that she calls « couture lumière » (Sewing Light) in the Agoè area. She does not have the support of her husband and she also does not have all the necessary equipment for her trade.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy a special embroidery-sewing machine that will cost her 300,000F CFA.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a special embroidery-sewing machine

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida Baji is married to M. A. and lives in a town called Kot Radha Kishan located 40 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan.
