Sajida Baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Sajida Baji’s husband earns income selling milk - it is a business that he has been in for the last 50 years. He makes about US$5 to US$6 per day. Sajida Baji is a housewife and sews clothes for her neighbors to earn extra income for the family. She is now applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort D. is 39 years old. She is a wife and mother of kids together with two of her sisters' kids. Currently three of the kids are in school because the others have completed school. Comfort enjoys selling and has much experience in customer care. She has been selling beans and bags of maize for eight years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of beans and the bags of maize from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. She wants to use the loan to buy beans and maize in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school. Comfort is a member of a community group called ‘The Voice Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy beans and bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Maria Auxiliadora S. B. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta señora tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen de ella su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 23 años de edad y labora como albañil, su otra hija de 20 años trabaja ayudándole a su mama y su otra hija de 16 años que cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de aumentar sus productos para así mantener su negocio, en sus deseos esta proporcionarle mejoras a su casa de habitación ya que necesita realizarle las respectivas mejoras para que sus hijos puedan tener un porvenir para el día de mañana.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa como: pantalones para dama y para caballero, ropa interior para hombres, tobilleras y blusas para damas, la ubicación de su negocio es en honduras, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 24 años, Doña Maria inicia con el negocio de planchado y lavado por encargo y de lo que obtenía de ganancia de este trabajo es lo que invierte para su nuevo negocio y una amiga quien era la que tenia conocimiento de este tipo de negocio empieza con 4 docenas de pantalones y mas tarde consigue obtener mas clientes por lo que necesita satisfacer a sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo razón por la que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos como mochilas, pantalones para damas y caballeros ya que necesita realizar el viaje hasta honduras en donde le resulta mas factible la compra de estos productos.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora S. B. is 44 years old, is single, and has 5 children, 3 of whom depend on her. Her oldest son is 23 years old and is a construction worker. One of her daughters is 20 years old and works helping her mother, and her other daughter of 16 is currently in her 5th year of secondary school. Marias intends to increase her stocks so that she may maintain her business. She wishes to supply improvements to her home, so that her children may have a future. Her economic activity is the sale of clothing like, men’s and women’s pants, underwear for men, ankle supports and blouses for women. Her business is located in Honduras, and she has had it for the 24 years. Maria started with the business of washing and ironing for charge and with the money she made from this business, she invested in her new business. A friend of hers who had known about the clothing business started her off with 4 dozen pairs of pants, and later on she gained more and more clients. It is because she needs to satisfy these clients that the loan she is asking for will be used to buy products like backpacks and women’s and men’s pants, for which she will need to travel to Honduras in which it will be more feasible to acquire such products.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Kéwé

texts.fr: Kéwé S., 40 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Sindian  depuis 6 ans. Son activité est la vente de poisson frais qu’elle achète  par caisse pour revendre au détail. Elle veut renforcer son commerce.  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Kéwé S., age 40, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village loan group of Boucotte Sindian for six years. Her work involves selling fresh fish, which she buys by the case to sell at the retail level. She wants to boost her commerce. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell fresh fish

loans.name: Cecilia Cruz

texts.es: Doña Cecilia Menchú cuenta con 28 años de edad, es casada de oficios tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, llevan 6 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ellos puedan aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Cecilia Menchú is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 2 children. Both she and her husband are tailors and make traditional women's clothing. They have three looms and 2 employees working for their business. They have been making traditional garments for 6 years from their home in the Vásquez Village, located in the Totonicapán district in Guatemala.

Although customer demand has increased, the current economic situation makes it difficult for them to increase their capital. For this reason, Doña Cecilia has turned to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to purchase raw materials so that she and her husband can increase their weekly sales. With this loan, they hope to help their children succeed and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (purchase of raw materials)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther S. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. Standing close to her in the picture is her youngest child. She sells gift items and provisions. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more gift items and provisions to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and gift items

loans.name: Nancy Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Nancy es una mujer trabajadora que desde muy joven a sobresalido en las ventas para apoyar a su hijo de 19 años que esta estudiando, es madre soltera desde hace siete años vende comida inicio su venta ofreciendo sus ricas y variadas comida en lo centro de trabajo. La Sra. Nancy tiene 49 años, reside en memorial sandino. Este es su tercer ciclo el cual va invertir en materia prima en la compra de alimentos para preparar las ricas comidas y seguir ofreciendo a sus cliente. A futuro espera tener mejores ingresos, captar  clientes y mejorar la infraestructura.
texts.en:
Nancy is a working woman who, from a young age, has stood out in her sales abilities as a food vendor. She is a single mother supporting her 19-year old son in his studies. For seven years she has been offering an assortment of delicious meals in the work center. Nancy is 49-years old and lives in the neighborhood of Memorial Sandino. This is her third loan which she will invest in ingredients to prepare delicious food to offer to her customers. In the future she hopes to have more income, attract more customers, and improve her business' infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, vegetables, and meat to prepare meals

loans.name: Matainofo

texts.en: Matainofo P., 27, is married with one child. She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public two days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Matainofo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The entire loan will be used for business needs.

loans.use: Purchase tool for planting taro, bananas and yams; other business needs

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their child. Rana has owned a toy and accessory shop for three years. She requested a loan of 2330 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Rana has requested a loan. 
Rana is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her family members, friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had to face the competition. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Teodora Justina

texts.es:
La señora Teodora  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada sin hijos, vive en el Jr. Vilca Apaza  285, ella posee  estudios hasta 5to de primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace ½ año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de jugos de frutas, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles con el que compró mas fruta para atender su negocio.
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 600.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero comprará mas fruta e insumos, y así poder hacer crecer su negocio.  Además quiere seguir trabajando y aumentar su capital para empezar a vender golosinas.  Con esto obtendría más ingresos.

Le gustaría  comprarse una casa muy bonita para estar tranquila, y poner una jugueria grande.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta la puntualidad de las demás socias y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the “Aswancaris II” cooperative bank, in the province of Azangaro, Puno. She is 43 years old, and is married but has no children. She studied until the 5th grade. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for ½ year, and the activity she dedicates herself to is fruit juice sales. Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles, with which she bought more fruit for her business. Currently, she hopes for an additional loan of 600 soles with which she will buy more fruit and supplies to help her grow the business. In addition, she would like to keep working and augment her capital to start selling sweets/snacks. With this, she would increase her income. She would like to buy herself a lovely house in which to live serenely and start a large juice-making enterprise. Likewise, she notes that she likes how punctual the other members are and being able to save.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit:  oranges, bananas, papaya, pineapple.

loans.name: Maria Angelina

texts.es: María Angelina, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, ella tiene 28 años de edad, su esposo no esta en Guatemala, 2 de sus hijas están estudiando y las otras 2 son pequeñas. Ella se dedica a vender cómales para hacer  las tortillas, ella  vende en el mercado de su localidad, en su casa también tiene venta de cómales, estos los fabrican en el municipio de San Raymundo y se los llevan a ella ya listos para venderlos.  Su negocio lo inicio hace 12 años, su préstamo lo necesita para invertir mas por la época de invierno, ya que  necesita estar preparada para atender la demanda  por la temporada,  ya que en esta época por las lluvias no se fabrican muchos.  Sus sueños son que su negocio sea más grande y que sus hijas terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Angelina is married and has 4 children. She is 28-years-old. Her husband doesn't live in Guatemala. Two of her daughters are studying, and the other two are still small. She sells comales (dishes used for making tortillas) at the market in her community. She also sells comales in her home. They are made in San Raymundo and they are brought to her ready to sell. She started her business 12 years ago. She needs this loan to invest in more merchandise for the rainy season since she needs to be prepared to handle the season's demand. Because of the rain, not many comales are made during this time. Her dreams are to expand her business and to have her daughters finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of comales to sell, to make the most of the rainy season.

loans.name: Eugenio Ramón

texts.en:
Mr. Eugenio O. is 59 years old and is married to Fidencia Ferreira.  They have two adult daughters who are married with children.  One of his daughters works with them in their restaurant in the city of Fernando de la Mora.  In addition to the restaurant, he has a to-go service for chicken, as well as sandwich catering for events. 

All of his employees are relatives who live nearby.  Eugenio starts work very early in the morning, when they go to buy the ingredients they need to make their food. 

His restaurant has been open since 1982 and has a well-established clientele.  He has no problem with sales, as his business is open until late in the evening.  The loan he applied for will be used exclusively for the purchase of supplies for his business.

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials such as meat, chicken, oil, sodas, beer, etc.

loans.name: 01-Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Thuý N. Thị, 39, lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. Thuý is the leader of a 5-member group that is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01-Điện Biên (03.19.01).

Thuý is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Thuý owns and operates a food stall where she sells a variety of food products. Thuý has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Thuý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thuý is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 4.248.000 VND that she will invest in expanding her business. Thuý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. Thị Tâm, 52, is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

2.  Lê Thị Cúc, 49, is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

3.  H. Thị Hường, 38, is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

4.  N. Thị Vân, 36,  requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thuý N. Thị (4) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Thuý là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01-Điện Biên (03.19.01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thuý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thuý kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Thuý đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thuý đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. Thị Tâm (2) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

2.  Lê Thị Cúc (3) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3.  H. Thị Hường (1) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

4.  N. Thị Vân (6) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 47 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are currently in school, one just completed junior high and is waiting to enter senior high school, and the other two are quite independent.

To support her household, Ama has been hawking cosmetics (going door-to-door) in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. Aside from her hawking business she also supplies home appliances like blenders, rice cookers and cooking utensils on credit to workers.

Ama says the selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income for her family’s needs. Her dream is to be able to see her kids through education to the tertiary level as her legacy for her kids to aid them in their future lives.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 33-years-old. She is married to Thomas Rono and they have two children. Her business is located along Iten -Tambach road in Eldoret Town.

She has been in the hair salon business for five years and her major clients are residents of Iten-Tambach. Valentine was introduced to KADET by a registered KADET group member. She has applied for a loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan buy equipment, including a blow-drier, and add to her stock of hair chemicals. 

In the future, she intends to open a beauty salon and hair dressing college, and to build residential houses.

loans.use: To buy hair salon equipment and restock her hair chemicals.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter es un joven de 22 años, muy trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su padre, el cual es viudo y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida, para eso trabaja muy duro. Él se dedica es la venta de repuestos de segunda mano para automóviles, aunque es joven todavía, sabe que tiene que ayudar en los gastos del hogar, es por eso que decidió trabajar muy duro y siente que poco a poco sus esfuerzos van dando los frutos esperados, con los cuales pueda ayudar en su hogar y pagar sus estudios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, tiene 3 años de experiencia y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir lo repuestos, ya que tiene que recorrer las calles de la ciudad en busca de lo solicitado por sus clientes. Walter espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar lo ingresos necesarios para culminar sus estudios. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo en este también. Él es el único varón de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar su negocio y comprar más repuestos para autos y así satisfacer a la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Walter is a hard worker for a young man of 22 years. He lives in his own home with his father, who is a widower. He works very hard because his greatest wish is to excel in life. Walter operates a business selling secondhand automobile parts. Although he is still young, he knows he has to help with the household expenses. Little by little, he is starting to see the fruits of his hard work because he is able to help at home and also pay for his education. Walter enjoys being in sales. With three years of experience, he says the hardest part of his job is finding the exact parts that his customers need. This requires him traveling throughout the streets of the city in search of the correct parts. Walter expects his business to grow and that he will be able to earn enough money to complete his studies.

This will be Walter’s third loan with MFP. His previous loans were paid on time and he expects this loan will be the same. He is the only male member of his Communal Bank, so the other members of the group find him endearing. With his loan of 2000 soles, he will improve his business by purchasing more auto parts so that he can satisfy the demand of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory of auto parts

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: A. Edith est née vers 1961à Gbecon à Porto- Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Edith est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants.  Edith et sa famille vivent à  yèvié un quartier de Porto-Novo. Edith est une vendeuse de bois de chauffage  et de charbon de bois. Son activité qui lui est génératrice de revenus  est en pleine croissance à cause de l’augmentation de sa clientèle. Mais faute de moyens financiers pour plus s’approvisionner à temps et pour répondre efficacement à  cette forte demande, Edith fait donc  recours à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin d’augmenter le volume de ses produits.
texts.en:
Edith A. was born around 1961 in Gbecon, Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of six children. Edith and her family live in Yèvié, a neighbourhood of Porto-Novo. She works selling firewood and coal. This revenue-generating activity is going through a period of growth as her clientele has increased. However, as she lacks the financial means to re-stock quickly and supply this heavy demand efficiently, Edith has turned to Kiva Partner Alidé in order to strengthen her working capital so she can increase her sales volume.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing firewood and sacks of coal for re-sale

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango municipio del departamento D. La Libertad. Blanca vive con su esposo José Luis y sus cuatro hijos D. 12,10,8 y 5 años D. edad, todos los niños se encuentran estudiando. Blanca y su esposo como todos los padres quieren darle lo mejor a su hijos y es por ello que Blanca está en busca D. un  crecimiento en su negocio, que le permita aumentar su ingresos, ella posee su negocio en su domicilio donD. venD. productos D. consumo y su nuevo adquisición en productos D. papelería, el crédito que Blanca solicita es para solidificar su negocio surtiéndolo D. variedad D. productos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old and lives in the town of Ilopango, which is in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband José Luis and her four school-aged children (ages 12, 10, 8, and 5). Like all parents, Blanca and her husband want to proviD. the best for their children. For this reason, she is looking to expand her business and generate more earnings.

Blanca operates a store out of her home where she sells consumer products and newly acquired paper products. She is requesting a loan to solidify her business by restocking it with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store with various products

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is a 40-year-old farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She owns a rice field, which, according to her, needs additional financing. She also owns a general store, which sells very well during harvest time. Juvy has been a member of CEV since 2005 and is thankful she is still a member. Now, Juvy is requesting to borrow Php 7,000, which will be used to finance her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico tiene 33 años, vive en la casa de su madre, con ella, su pareja y madre de su hijo de 5 años, quien ya empezó sus estudios primarios.

Frente a la casa de su madre tiene en un pequeño espacio donde vende productos comestibles de primera necesidad (huevos, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc), además de bebidas heladas.
En esta actividad lleva un periodo de 8 años y atiende todos los días a cualquier hora del día, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y su madre, debido a que durante algunas horas se dedica (desde hace 13 años) también al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro.
Lo que le gusta a Federico de su tienda es que mediante las ganancias apoya con algunos gastos familiares y darles una buena atención a sus clientes es lo principal, menciona.
Además, le favorece que por esa zona es el único que cuenta con este tipo de negocio. Para el futuro quiere constituir un minimarket y así facilitar a sus vecinos con sus compras diarias.

Este es su 10mo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que se apoyan entre todos y son muy unidos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad y así seguir implementando su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Federico is 33 years old. He and his partner live at his mother’s house. They have a 5 year old son who just started elementary school.

Next to his mother’s house, Federico has a small space where he sells basic necessities (eggs, noodles, rice, milk, bread, etc.) and cold beverages. He has been operating his store for 8 years and is open 24 hours a day. His wife and mother help out with the business. In addition, he spends a few hours transporting passengers in his motorcycle taxi, which he has been doing for 13 years.

Federico enjoys the fact that his store has provided income to cover some of their household expenses. However, he says providing good service to his customers is what is important. The competitive environment is favorable because he is the only one in his area with this type of business. In the future, he hopes to build a mini-market where his neighbors can come to make their daily purchases.

This is Federico’s tenth loan with MFP. He enjoys working with his Communal Bank because all the members are close and supportive of one another. The money he requested will be used to buy more consumer staples so that he can continue to manage his business properly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Nathali

texts.es:
Nathali tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia; además está en espera de su segundo bebé. 

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la elaboración de lindos collares, aretes, pulseras, etc. las cuales elabora bajo la técnica de la bisutería. En esta actividad se ocupa largas horas de trabajo, ya que es una buena fuente de ingresos para su familia, además de ser un pasatiempo que le gusta realizar ya que puede poner en práctica toda su creatividad y plasmarla en estas lindas joyas. Posteriormente, Nathali vende esta mercadería a pedido, al por mayor, para luego ser vendida en los mercados y bazares de su localidad. 
Para el futuro, quiere tener otro tipo de negocio, aun no se ha decido por cual, pero sin dejar de lado el que actual hace, pues le gusta mucho.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella es muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que su grupo solidario con el cual se lleva muy bien, pues todas son muy buenas amigas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita quiere comprar mayor cantidad de material para producir más collares.
texts.en:
Nathali, 25, lives with her husband in their own house; she is expecting her second baby. Since two years ago she has been making beautiful necklaces, earrings, bracelets, etc. which she makes using costume jewelry metholodogies. This activity takes up long work hours since it is a good source of family income besides being a passtime that she enjoys doing because she can put all of her creativity into practice and turn it into these beautiful jewels. Nathali then sells these items at wholesale filling orders for subsequent sale at local markets and bazaars. For the future, she wants to have a different kind of business; she hasn't decided yet what kind, but without leaving her current work aside, because she likes it very much. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very punctual with her repayments as well as with her communal group with whom she gets along very well because they are all good friends. With the funds requested now she wants to buy a larger amount of supplies with which to make more necklaces.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make necklaces.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
GLADYS,  ES UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA, TIENE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS, ELL. ES UNA DE LAS  10 INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO “SAN JUAN” QUIENES VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
HACE CINCO AÑOS, INICIÓ  SU NEGOCIO DE L. VENTA DE VINOS EN SU CASA, ESTO CON L. IDEA DE JUNTAR UN CAPITAL E INICIAR UNA EMPRESA FAMILIAR. ES ASI QUE ALQUILARON UN LOCAL PARA INAUGURAR UN RESTAURANTE, DONDE TODA L. FAMILIA PARTICIPA Y TRABAJAN TODOS LOS DÍAS. ES UN RESTAURANT MUY CONCURRIDO DONDE OFRECEN COMIDAS MARINAS Y CRIOLLAS.
GLADYS NOS COMENTA QUE ES UN TRABAJO MUY SACRIFICADO, PERO MUY RENTABLE  Y SATISFACTORIO.
CON SU TRABAJO  PUEDE CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE L. UNIVERSIDAD DE SU HIJA MAYOR QUIEN ESTUDIA CONTABILIDAD. SU PROXIMA META ES AHORRAR PARA COMPRAR SU CASA, YA QUE ELL. Y SU FAMILIA VIVEN EN L. CASA DE SU MAMÁ.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA COMPLEMENTAR Y EQUIPAR EL RESTAURANT E INVERTIR UNA PARTE EN L. COMPRA DE VINOS.
texts.en:
Gladys is an enterprising woman. She is 41, married, and has two children. She is one of the ten members of the San Juan group; they live in the Comas district. Five years ago she started a business of selling wine in her house. She did this with the idea of getting money together to start a family business. That is how they came to rent a place to start a restaurant where all of the family participates and works everyday. It is a popular restaurant, which serves seafood and Peruvian food. Gladys tells us that the work requires a lot of sacrifice, but it is very profitable and satisfactory. With her work she is able to cover the university expenses of her oldest daughter who is studying accounting. Her next goal is to save to buy a house. She and her family live in her mother’s house. The loan she is asking for is to supplement and equip the restaurant. She will use part of the loan to buy wine.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equip her restaurant

loans.name: Asuta

texts.en:
Asuta P. is currently in the business of selling fresh fish in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh and dried fish to sell. Asuta is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Shakirat

texts.en:
Shakirat is 28 years old and is married with two children. Her husband sells generators to make a living.

Shakirat lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells clothes and belts at retail prices to her customers and hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more clothes and belts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Shakirat is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and belts to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra tiene 60 años, vive en su casa con sus 2 hijas, quienes son casadas.
DesD. hace 21 años se dedica al comercio D. manera independiente, D. es manera pudo sostener a su familia. En la actualidad trabaja para así misma vendiendo sándwich D. lechón; todos días por la tarD., incluso los fines D. semana, se instala con una pequeña mesa en una esquina D. una zona bastante comercial D. su localidad cercana a una universidad, siendo los estudiantes sus principales clientes. 
Alejandra está muy animada D. seguir adelante con este negocio, aprovechando las festividades locales para aumentar sus ventas, además este trabajo satisface sus deseos D. seguir siendo una persona activa.

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es un ejemplo D. perseverancia y responsabilidad en el pago D. las cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. un cerdo ahumado y otros productos mas que venderá durante las festividades locales.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 60 years old and lives in her house with her 2 daughters, who are both married. For 21 years she has run her own business; this is how she supported her family. She now works for herself selling pork sandwiches. Every afternoon, including weekends, she sets up a small table on a corner in a commercial zone in her area near a university, whose students are her main customers. Alejandra is very motivated to make this business grow by taking advantage of local festivals to increase her sales. This work also satisfies her desire to continue being an active person. This is her fifth opportunity to borrow from MFP. She is an example of perseverance and responsibility in her payments. The money she requests will be invested in the purchase of smoked pork and other products that she will sell during local festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sandwich ingredients

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Lucia es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Lucia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales y los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia necesita un  préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Lucia son ampliar su negocio y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the communal bank Sonrisa. She is married, 45 years old, and has 4 children. Lucia travels to the different markets in the region where she buys cereals that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Lucia needs a loan of 1,600 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy cereals. Lucia dreams of expanding her business and buying a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen S. is married with two children living at home in the Takeo province. She is a rice farmer, typically making US $2 each day. Her husband raises pigs and works as a village chief. Her husband typically makes about US $2 each day. Yen S. would like a loan of US $800 to purchase a hand tractor motor.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor motor.

loans.name: Super 7 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Super 7 está integrado por  tres mujeres que como muchas nicaragüenses son luchadoras incansables en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida de sus familias y por ello  se enfrentan a jornadas de trabajo arduos.

 Adim es una institución que se dedicada al desarrollo empresarial de las mujeres a quienes propicia su desarrollo integral con la oferta de créditos y capacitación-formación en desarrollo empresarial y autonomía.  Esto les ha beneficiado según comentaron las integrantes de este grupo porque han aprendido a  crecentar sus negocios con inversiones adecuadas y a economizar. 


La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Bertha García G. quien en el 2003 compro dos plantas Telefónicas con lo que empezó su pequeño negocio de alquiler de teléfonos. Este negocio ha ido creciendo y actualmente ella además de alquilar teléfonos, vende recargas y accesorios para celulares y por otro lado comercializa ropa usada.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María del Carmen C. quien tiene una modesta pulpería y Francisca del Pilar O. Alemán vende comida especialmente derivados del chancho como frito, moronga, nacatamales…etc.
texts.en:
The Group “Super 7” is made up of three women who, like many Nicaraguans, are tireless fighters in search of a better quality of life for their families, so they face up to difficult trips to their jobs. Adim is an organization dedicated to the development of women entrepreneurs and assists them by providing loans, training, business development, and autonomy. The ladies tell us that this has helped them because they have learned how to economize and grow their businesses with adequate investments. Bertha is the group’s coordinator, who bought two phone banks in 2003 and started a small business renting phones. This business has been growing and now, besides renting phones, she also sells chargers, cellular accessories, and second-hand clothing. The other members of the group are; Maria, who runs a small grocery shop and; Francisca who sells food derived from pork such as fritters, sausage, nacatamales, etc…

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 57 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos. Vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Pacora, de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la renovación de calzado desde hace mas de 10 años. Posee un taller instalado en la vivienda de su madre y alli atiende a los clientes que recurren a solicitar sus servicios, la experiencia que posee en el rubro ha hecho que su negocio tenga una clientela fija que gusta de la calidad con la que realiza su trabajo. Esta es la unica fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para solventar sus gastos personales, hacerse cargo de sus hijos y de su madre, que es de edad avanzada.

Debido a la constante demanda por sus servicios Eduardo tiene que viajar constantemente a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirir materiales que le permitan seguir realizando su labor. A pesar de que cuenta con un stock permanente, siempre tiene que renovarlo. Precisamente por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en hilos, zuelas y piezas de cuero.

Eduardo es un hombre bastante trabajador y que se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes y de las personas que lo conocen. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de realizar sus pagos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 57-years-old and has 2 children. He lives with his mother in the Pacora district of the Lambayeque province, which is one hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been repairing footwear for more than 10 years. He has a workshop set up in his mother's house and there he receives customers who have need of his services. His experience in this area has led to his business having a regular client base who appreciates the quality of his work. This is the only source of income that he has to cover his personal expenses and to take care of his children and mother, who is elderly. Due to the constant demand for his services, Eduardo has to constantly travel to the city of Chiclayo to obtain materials which allow him to continue doing his work. Despite the fact that he relies on a permanent stock, he always has to refill it. It is for exactly this reason that he feels the need to request a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he plans to invest in thread, soles and pieces of leather. Eduardo is a very hardworking man and he has earned the trust of his customers and of the people who know him. He has previously worked with our institution and demonstrated timeliness and responsibility when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoemaker materials to maintain his business.

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuan T. T. H. is 33 years old. She lives in Cau Ca village, Co Loa, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and two sons. Both of her sons are going to school. She cooks for the workers of the company near her house. Besides that, she breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND), which is about $105 US. 

Since joining the SEDA microfinance program in 2008, she has been a dynamic, energetic and respected leader of an eight-member group.  But, In her group only three members borrow money. Other members are continuing to repay loans. This cycle, Ms Xuan needs 5,450,000 VND to invest in her livestock.

About two other members in her group:

Tho T. N. is 39 years old. She is a worker. She wants to buy pigs to breed. So, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy some pigs.
Tan T. P. is 49 years old. She has a store at home. She wants to borrow 654,000 VND to invest in her store.

loans.use: For livestock

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou T. est une commerçante de produits céréaliers q'elle achéte dans les marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants de Mbour pour être revendu  dans le marché mbourois.Ainsi ce crédit va lui permettre de resoudre ses besoins en habillement et de soutenir son mari sur les frais de scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Madam Fatou T. is a retailer of grain products which she buys in the weekly markets of surrounding villages of Mbour to be retailed in the Mbour market. Thus, this credit is going to enable her resolve her clothing needs and to support her husband with the school fees of his children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trading

loans.name: Gloria Esther

texts.es:
Gloria L. D. Bonifàz  tiene 68 años vive en el barrio Costa hermosa del Municipio D.  Soledad, la tierra D. las mejores butifarras artesanales D. Colombia tal como lo dice Gloria; ella  tiene una negocio D. variedades llamado “ DonD. Julio L.”, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos D. 29 y 34 años D. edad. Empezó en el año 1999 con su negocio y lo registró en la Cámara D. comercio el año 2004, tiene una miscelánea donD. venD. ropa calzado, útiles escolares, ganchos moños, productos D. belleza, servicios D. fotocopiado, papelería, calzado, juguetes, artículos D. ferretería y hasta refrescos y medicinas sin restricciones D. consumo.
Considera a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo como uno D. los pilares para que su  negocio “DonD. Julio”  funcionara; con su primer crédito D. $ 900.000 empezó a surtirlo y asì continúo hasta hacerlo una gran miscelánea como la que ahora tiene;  En la actualidad solicita su noveno financiamiento por valor D. $2.000.000 para comprar mercancía como papelería lencería insumos D. modistería y confitería.
Su gran sueño es ampliar su negocio convertirlo en un gran almacén, haciendo su casa D. dos pisos para que queD. separado el espacio productivo del familiar, D. esta manera estaría ubicado en el primer piso  su almacén y la familia viviría en  la segunda planta.
Los mayores desafíos están relacionados cuando llegan  problemas D. salud D. sus  familiares y debe hacer gastos extras,  pero todos los días tiene un gran desafío y es el que su negocio siga en pie, para sostener su familia y aumentar su nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Gloria L. D. Bonifàz is 68 years old and lives in the Costa Hermosa neighborhood of the municipality of Soledad. Gloria says that this is the area with the best Colombian artisanal sausages. She has a business selling all sorts of things called “DonD. Julio L.” and lives with her husband. They have two children ages 29 and 34. She started her business in 1999 and registered it with the Chamber of Commerce in 2004. Gloria sells a variety of products like: clothing, shoes, school supplies hair clips, beauty products, photocopies, paper products, toys, hardware and even drinks and medicines that don’t require a prescription. See thinks of “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo” as one of the foundations of her business, that help her business, “DonD. Julio,” function. With her first loan of $ 900.000, she began to stock it and continued in this way until she had the great variety of wares she has now. She is taking out her 9th loan, for $2,000,000, to buy merchandise like paper products, sewing,craft supplies, and sweets. Her greatest dream is to grow her business into a big warehouse making her house two floors so she can separate her business from her home. This way she would have her business on the first floor and the family would live upstairs on the second floor. Her greatest challenges are related. When family members get sick and she has more bills to pay and her everyday challenge of keeping her business going to maintain her family and better improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like paper products, craft,sewing supplies, and sweets.

loans.name: Souk

texts.en: Souk S., 28, is married with three young children living at home in Takeo province. She makes and sells incense, typically making US$ 1 each day, and her husband operates a moto-taxi. He typically makes about US$ 3 each day. Souk S. would like a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to operate a moto-taxi.

loans.use: buying a motorcycle to use as a moto-taxi

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with six children and all of them are at school.  Edith also takes care of additional family members. She owns a retail shop in Kawempe selling all types of merchandise. Edith buys this merchandise from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala city.  She has been in this business for eighteen years. She wants to use this the loan to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.  

Edith pays monthly rent of 50,000 for her retail shop and residence. She sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week.   Edith joined MCDT to get additional capital for her retail shop. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  Edith's monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito G. is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Lakawon, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her fishing and food vending business.

Charito’s husband, Henry, work as a fisherman, and they have 2 children who are 7 and 11 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Charito joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her fishing and food vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities.

Charito is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund operations of her fishing and food vending business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 9th cycle loan, in the amount of 23,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her fishing and food vending business. Charito is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Thirteen members are making a village bank loan which located in Kor village, Kandal province. Mrs. Ly L. 42 years old and she is the village bank president having selected by its thirteen members. While each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.
Mrs. Ly L. is a farmer who owns 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice and she is also farmer who work very hard to hold up her two children. For this farm,Mrs. Ly L. will use the loan that asked from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborer. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to improve his family living. This couple has two children, one is attending in the local school while another one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborer.

loans.name: Estalin Walther

texts.es:
Estalin Walther G. G. tiene 28 anos. Vive soltero en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar.

Estalin es un socio de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, arroz, soya, plátano, papaya, y otros.

Estalin se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao y en Babahoyo 3 veces al mes.  

Solicita el credito para crecer mas maiz. El prestamo lo permitiria ahorrar en cada temporada, últimamente llegando a crecer mas. La cooperativa lo ayuda bastante. 

Le gusta jugar futbol y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Estalin Walter G. G. is 28 years old. He is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar province. Estalin is a member of the “Genesis” communal bank, which is located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, and the majority of them grow corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya, and other crops. Estalin works in agriculture. He grows corn. He makes purchases and sells his products in Mata de Cacao and in Babahoyo three times per month. He is requesting the loan to grow more corn. The loan will allow him to save each season, which will ultimately allow him to grow more. The communal bank is very helpful for him. He likes to play soccer and listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant corn

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Lydia has a beauty salon, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more braids (hair extensions) and oil for the hair.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lydia hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Lydia hopes to own a house and to see her child attend university.  Lydia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by not letting her sit at home but have something to do (become self reliant).

Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and  hair oil

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Pelegrin M., who is in his early sixties, is married with 5 children. Pelegrin is a music performer and a manager of a band.  He has managed the band since 2005.  He works daily from 7am until 12pm and he is able to earn a monthly profit of around $132.

This will be Pelegrin’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use the loan to repair and improve on the band's music system. He is hard working and very busy especiA. the nights when he performs.  

Pelegrin will share this loan with his loan group, Royal, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other responsible for paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Pelegrin is in front in a green shirt.

loans.use: To repair and improve on the band's music system.

loans.name: Sitina

texts.en: Sitina R. is a 48-year-old mother of four children; one is 12 years old and three are older than 18. Sitina is a businesswoman who owns a food kiosk in Shanzu, Mombasa and also owns rental houses in Mombasa. She has been in the rental business for 29 years and her business is doing well. This marks her second loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to add into her savings, to buy materials for building and to purchase more foodstuffs for her food kiosk. She intends to build another rental house. Sitina's dream is to own many rental houses in Mombasa.

loans.use: to add into her savings, to buy materials for building and to purchase more foodstuffs for her food kiosk

loans.name: Mayra Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Mayra Rafaela tiene 51 años. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio con pocos productos pero ha sido con el paso del tiempo  que ha logrado mejorar su negocio, se levanta temprano desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que regresa a su hogar pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy luchadora.  Este es su sexto crédito con Fundación que ha obtenido con mucho sacrificio, con este crédito comprar mercadería variada para sus clientes. Por lo que sueña con seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Mayra Rafaela is 51 years old. Her activity is the sale of general merchandising. She started with a few products but has improved her business with the passage of time. She wakes up early at 8 am until 9 pm when she comes back home since she has shown to be a hard working person. This is her 6th loan with Fundacion, and she has obtained it with a lot of sacrifice. With this loan she will purchase a variety of merchandise for her customers. She dreams of investing in her business to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn and fresh fruit.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
MARIO JOSE V. J., Trabaja Como Vigilante en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua, es padre de famillia de un hijo y este actualmente se encuentran en la universidad.
elprestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion como , cemento y arena para repllar algunas paredes de su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Mario Jose V. J. works as a security guard at the Managua Wholesale Market. He is the father of a child who is currently attending university.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, so that he can repair some of the walls in his house.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair some of the walls in his house

loans.name: Amanat's Group

texts.en:
Amanat is 40 years old. She married A. M. and moved to Kot Radha Kishan some years ago. Kot Radha Kishan is a small city in Pakistan located in Punjab province and famous for its dairy industry. She lives there in an area called Jajwala in a three-room brick house with her family. She herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She is a very supportive lady and tries her best to give comfort to her family with her work. She has given birth to 5 sons and a daughter. She couldn’t educate them due to poor financial conditions. 

Her husband works in a factory. Her 2 elder sons also work in the factory with their father and the others stay at home. Amanat’s husband wants to start a bangle-selling business because the Eid is on the way and ladies and young babies love to wear bangles to celebrate the Eid holiday. That’s why Amanat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan amount, her husband will buy bangles in large quantity to sell after his day job. 

Amanat is hopeful that starting a new business will be profitable for her husband and the loan  will become a great resource for him to start up that business. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Amanat.

loans.use: To buy bangles to start up a bangle-selling business

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Multan which famous for its sweetmeat and shrines in Pakistan. She lives in the area called Qaisarabad with her family in a two room brick house. 

She is 32 year old, married to M. K. and has three children: two boys and a girl. Her sons are in 5th and 1st grade while her daughter is in kindergarten. 

Perveen is a supportive lady, she helps her husband in his business of selling clothes. Her husband purchase clothes from Faisalabad (which is famous for its textile industry) and sells it to the markets while Perveen sells clothes to her local area clients. In this way, they both earn a profit and manage the household expenses. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband. With the loan, her husband will buy clothes in bulk quantity that will help him minimize his cost of purchasing and add more variety to his clothes to attract more customers. 

Perveen is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her husband’s business. She is very confident about her family’s bright future. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business

loans.name: Sudi

texts.en:
Sudi is a married man with two children who are still too young for school.  He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has operated a vegetable selling business, for over three years.  His potential customers are his neighbours.  Sudi faces a major challenge of price fluctuation due to seasonality of the products.  He hopes to expand and establish a cereal business in the future. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.  With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.use: To  purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita C. is a widow who lives in the municipality of Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a butcher shop.  Emerita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emerita has been incrementally improving her family's quality of life by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000, which she intends to use to buy more meat to sell in the market so she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Emerita C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her butcher shop

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
Jimmy es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el sector es una de las localidades más pobladas de la región y se caracteriza por su abundante movimiento comercial y de transporte.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio en las principales calles de su distrito y depende de los ingresos que esta actividad de brinde para sustentar los gastos económicos de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su mototaxi y el estado accidentado de los caminos de las zonas que recorre diariamente han hecho que su unidad móvil empiece a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 31-years old and he lives with his wife and children in a marginal part of the city in a district called Jose Leonardo Ortiz. It is a heavily populated area, and it is known for high traffic in personal and commerical transport.

He drives a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a small cabin in the back to carry passengers or cargo) on the heavily trafficked streets in his district, and he depends on this job to provide for his family's economic needs.

The continued use of his mototaxi and the state of the roads in the area he drives along daily have resulted in his vehicle sustaining some damages that require immediate repairs. In order to make these repairs he has applied for a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Repairs for mototaxi

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a leso business for the past one year, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby.  A leso, also known as kikoi, is a piece of colored cloth used as clothing and wrapped around the waist and legs or shoulders. Asia faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation while moving from door to door. She hopes to establish a boutique business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling loan she wants to purchase 40 lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: buying 40 lesos for resale

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en:
33-year-old Jemelyn C. lives in the town of Banga with her family. She is married and has two children aged 14 and 9. Jemelyn grows pigs and plants rice crops. She maintains a small backyard piggery and tills a rice farm with her husband. Jemelyn also spends time running a sari-sari store. She sells biscuits, sugar and other products. Jemelyn works hard to provide for her family.

Jemelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jemelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jemelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase electronics to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a married mother of three school-going children, one boy and two girls, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam has operated a clothing business for the past four years, selling at the market and from home to neighbours and passersby. She decided to join Yehu to access loans easily, and with a loan of Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of Khangas - Kenyan women's attire. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, and during rainy season transportation becomes a challenge. She dreams of expanding her business and supplying in large quantities in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Khangas for resale.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco de 43 años, hombre trabajador que inspira en sacar adelante a su familia. Se inicio desde niño con su padre en su negocio que quedaba en suburbio aprendió ese oficio y le gusto. Desde allí abrió un taller propio en los Vergeles.

En la actualidad el empieza su trabajo desde las 8:00 am  a 17:00pm. No tiene dificultades en su trabajo su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos. Con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de reparación para así mejorar su negocio. En un futuro lo que más quiere es ampliar su negocio y así mejorar su condición económica y darle lo mejor a familia en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Marco, 43, is a hard working man who aspires to move his family ahead.  He started working while still a little boy with his father in his business located in Suburbio; he learned the occupation and liked it.  Since then, he opened his own shop in Los Vergeles.

He starts work at 8am and goes until 5pm.  He doesn’t have any difficulties at work and his wife is a housewife.  He will use the loan to buy repair supplies in order to improve his business.  In the future what he’d like the most is to expand the business to improve his economic situation and provide the best for his family in everything they need.

loans.use: to buy repair supplies.

loans.name: Namutamala Women's Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
41-year-old Emmanuel K. is a retail businessman who operates in Mpigi Town. He is married with five cheerful kids who are all in schools in Mpigi district. 

Emmanuel has been in this business for the past 12 years and he says the credit goes to his wife who has supported him financially and morally since he began. Weekly he says this business generates 80,000 shillings as profit. He says he is requesting this loan to purchase more retail goods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more general merchandise goods to resell.

loans.name: Elijah Barno

texts.en:
Elijah Barno K. K. is a young man of twenty-two years. He is married and has no children, but lives in Eldoret town with two relatives for whom he provides basic needs. He has been in this motorcycle business for two years and gets a monthly income of about $293.


This will be Elijah's 2nd loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his first loan successfully. With this loan he plans to buy a brand new motorcycle which will cost him 80,000 KES. 


With the income he is going to get he plans to repay the loan. In future he wants to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 23 años de edad;  la socia es solter; la socia  alterna en los ratos libres con la atención de su propio negocio de fotocopiadoras, la socia invierte en su negocio poco a poco y esta vez ella requiere el crédito para poder comprar papel en millares, tinta para la máquina, tóner y aceite para el mantenimiento de la misma. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fotocopiadora. 


La socia esta agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is named “Virgen de Guadalupe – Cusco.”  This bank is located in the district of Huanchac which belongs to Cusco province and the department of Cusco.

The member is 23-years-old, and single.  She also works in her free time attending to her own photocopy business.  She invests in her business little by little and this time she needs the loan to be able to buy reams of paper, ink for the machine, toner, and oil for maintenance.  She is requesting the loan to invest in materials for the photocopier.

The member is very thankful and would like to express that she will follow through in a disciplined manner with her payments.

loans.use: to invest in photocopying materials.

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en: Emmah is a 50 year-old widowed lady with two children.  She sells chicken and beef to earn a living.  She started her business four years ago and she employs two people.  She says that she has witnessed a lot of growth in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  Her dream is to own rental houses.   She has requested for 20,000 Kes to buy more chicken and beef.

loans.use: To buy more meat and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old married woman living with her husband and one young child. She is from Lebanon. She works producing handicrafts and she's a very artistically talented young woman. She works upon requests of her customers. She works hard in cooperation with her husband who works in the Lebanese general security to provide her family with extra financial support. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy textiles and tailoring supplies needed in order to increase her business productivity. In the future, she is planning to open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy textiles and tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "Las Violetas", se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tepalcingo, está integrado por:
*la señora M Isabel va a comprar con su crédito productos por kit perfumes, maquillajes, joyería, etc.
*la señora María Teresa va a comprar cloro en fórmula, aromatizantes, fabuloso y jabón liquido todo por galón
*la señora Emilia va a comprar botín para caballero de diferentes colores
*la señorita Viridiana va a comprar Zapato para dama, caballero, niño y compra de ropa interior para dama
*la señorita Yazbeth va a comprar Topperware por paquete para su pedido y por mayoreo
*la señorita Isindy Anahi va a comprar ropa para dama, pantalones de mezclilla, blusas de diferentes modelo
*la señora Oralia va comprar servilletas y mandiles por docena 
La señora Oralia tiene 35 años de edad ella estudio hasta la secundaria, ella es casada tiene 1 hijo que se llama Roberto tiene 6 años de edad está en Preescolar, ella vende servilletas para las tortillas o para tapar la comida, ella solicito su crédito para comprar servilletas y surtir su negocio, ella inicio su negocio hace tres años, su mamá le enseño a vende servilletas.
En la feria de Tepalcingo vienen muchos comerciantes de diferentes comunidades a vender sus productos, ahí vio las servilletas que las vendían por docena y con unos ahorros que tenía compró varias docenas de servilletas para iniciar su negocio, así empezó a vender el tianguis de Tepalcingo está ubicado en el centro, como a 15 minutos de su casa. 
Este negocio es muy importante porque se ayuda toda la familia económicamente, ella se siente orgullosa de poder trabajar en su propio negocio, poder cuidar a su pequeño hijo  y atender a sus clientas amable y cordialmente. Ella está feliz con este crédito que lograron obtener de Kiva porque va a surtir su negocio para crecer y tener variedad en modelos de servilleta para ofrecerle a sus clientas que son las señoras ama de casa,  ella utiliza las ganancias una parte para volver a surtir su negocio y otra parte para los gastos de la casa. Sus sueños y esperanzas son sobresalir, que su hijo estudie y que tenga un buen trabajo. 
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por apoyar a la gente que lo necesita, es una ayuda para nuestros negocio y nuestras familias”.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Las Violetas' and it is located in the community of Tepalcingo.  The group's members are:

*María Isabel, who will use her loan to buy perfumes, make-up, jewelry, etc.
*María Teresa, who will buy bleach, air fresheners, Fabuloso (a household clearner) and liquid soap, by the gallon
*Emilia, who will buy men's boots in different colors
*Viridiana, who will buy ladies', men's and children's shoes and ladies' underwear
*Yazbeth, who will buy individual items of Tupperware to fill orders and also buy some wholesale
*Isindy Anahi, who will buy ladies' clothes, denim pants and different styles of blouse
*Oralia, who will buy napkins and aprons by the dozen

Oralia is 35 years old and studied up to high school level.  She is married and has one son called Roberto who is 6 years old and currently in pre-school.  Oralia sells napkins for tortillas and for covering food.  She requested her loan to buy napkins and stock her business.  Oralia started her business three years ago.  It was her mom who taught her how to sell napkins.

Many salespeople from different communities come to the Tepalcingo street market to sell their products.  It was there that Oralia saw napkins being sold by the dozen.  She used some savings that she had to buy several dozen napkins with which to start her business.  She started to sell her products in the Tepalcingo street market which is located in the town center, 15 minutes from her home.

This business is very important because it helps Oralia's family financially.  She feels proud to be able to work in her own business, take care of her young son and serve her customers in a kind and friendly manner.  She is happy to be receiving this loan from Kiva because she will use it to stock her business so that she can grow and have a range of different types of napkin to offer her customers, who are housewives.  Oralia uses some of her profits to re-stock her business and also uses some to cover her household expenses.  Her dreams and hopes are to get ahead in life, and for her son to study and get a good job.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Many thanks for supporting people who need it.  You are helping our businesses and our families".

loans.use: to buy napkins for tortillas

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en:
Elfa is 43 years old and married. She has one child. Elfa works very hard to provide for her family.

Elfa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, chips, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Elfa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
