Candelaria, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo de 30 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de atoles de distintas clases (maní, ajonjolí, arroz, piña, semilla de marañón y arroz en leche),  tiene más de 5 años de estar en este negocio, lo cual distribuye de forma ambulante en el mercado municipal y sus alrededores, su horario es de 6:00am a 2:00pm, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de ingresos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz, arroz, maní, ajonjolí, azúcar y demás productos que son necesarios para su producción de atoles, la compra le ayudara muchísimo para mejorar la producción ya que aprovechara para comprar los productos por cantidades grandes, lo que le permite un mayor margen de ganancia.
Su aspiración es mantener la clientela satisfecha y fiel, ya que de ella dependen las ventas que realiza, su sueño es que a través del negocio pueda mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 49 years old and she is a single mother. She lives with her 30-year old son. She sells porridge of different kinds (peanuts, sesame seeds, rice, pineapples, cashew nuts, and rice pudding). She has been in business for more than 5 years. She distributes her products itinerantly in the municipal market and the surrounding areas. Her hours are from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. and she started out this business under her own initiative when she saw a need for an income.

She requests a loan to purchase corn, rice, peanuts, sesame seeds, sugar, and other products that she needs to make porridges. This purchase will help her tremendously in improving production. She will purchase products in large quantities and she will be able to increase her profit margin.

Her aspiration is to keep her loyal clients satisfied. She depends on the sales that she makes and her dream is to improve her house with the help of her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, peanuts, sesame seeds, and sugar to make porridges.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells various items such as palm oil, "gari" (cassava couscous) and maize at Dabir near Elmina. In the photograph she is touching one of the bags of maize. She is married and lives together with her six children. Her husband is a farmer. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize so she can meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize.

loans.name: Sayniso

texts.ru: Сайнисо проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 41 год. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Сайнисо занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает детскую и подростковую одежду. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды.
texts.en: Sayniso lives close to Shahrituz. She is 41 years old, divorced, with one child. She has a stall in the market and sells mainly children and teenage clothing. She has been selling for four years and needs a loan to purchase more children's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 42 años, es una mujer responsable junto a su esposo, Gregorio. Trabajan con perseverancia, para sacar adelante a sus 3 pequeños hijos, a los que cuidan y educan con mucho amor en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas del día, Gregorio, realizar trasporte público, en la ruta Tarma – Huaricolca; mientras que Lida, atiende a su clientes que constantemente visitan su tienda de comestibles, donde no solo vende productos de primera necesidad; también “leña” (que utilizan, para cocinar los alimentos), producto que tienen buena demanda en la zona. Y ambos, todos los fines de semana, como hace 11 años, se dedican todo el día al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembran papa y avena; los que después de cosecharlos los comercializan en el mercado central de la ciudad. Para más adelante tienen planeado comprar una casa en el centro de la ciudad, ahí desean expandir su negocio de comestibles, como también abrir su granja de cuyes más implementada, pues le está generando buenas ganancias y desea invertir más en ello. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde sus integrantes son personas muy responsables. Razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Lida de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío de avena y papa de la variedad “yungay” y “canchan”.
texts.en:
Lida is 42 years old and a responsible woman. She and her husband Gregorio have worked with perseverance to get ahead on behalf of their three young children, for whom they provide an education and take care of with much love. Lida and her family live in their own home in the rural district of Huaricolca. Every morning during the first few hours of the day, her husband Gregoria begins providing transportation services along the route from Tarma to Huaricolca. Meanwhile, Lida attends to her customers who constantly visit her grocery store. Not only does she sell basic necessity products, but also firewood for cooking since this product is high demand in the area. Every weekend for the past 11 years, both Lida and her husband have spent the entire day looking after their farmland on which they grow potatoes and oats. After these crops are harvested, they sell them at the central market in the city. Going forward, they plan to buy a house in the central part of the city so that they can expand their grocery business. They also want to start a well-managed guinea pig farm to generate more income, so they plan to invest more.

Lida is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) and this is her third loan with MFP. She is very pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because all of its members are responsible individuals. For this reason, she promises to submit her payments on time. With the support she will receive, Lida plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers for her next planting of oats and potatoes of the “Yungay” and “Canchan” varieties.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 56 years old and married with 3 children. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 14 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with grown-up children. She sells women’s clothing at the central market in Kahovka town. Her main clients are plus-size women. Svetlana has been in this business for eighteen years. She enjoys working in sales very much.

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 7,000 Ukrainian grivnas to purchase seasonal merchandise. She hopes to earn additional profit and improve her living conditions. This business is the only source of income for Svetlana.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Nawinyi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nawinyi Group in Western Kenya! This group is in Chwele district, where One Acre Fund will serve more than 10,000 farmers in 2012.  Like the majority of farmers from Western Kenya, the members of Nawinyi group rely on maize as their primary staple crop.  
Judith is the facilitator of the Nawinyi group. She takes care of four children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had an excellent maize yield harvesting ten bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest five bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Judith plans on paying school fees for her children, and buying chickens or goats as a form of savings and asset development. 
In 2012, the members of Nawinyi group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.
In the picture the field officer is featured standing on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a cobbler. He makes shoes and sells them to different factories and shoe selling shops. He has a good number of business contacts and he receives regular orders every month. With the loan, he will buy raw materials like leather, shoe polish, nails etc in larger quantity.

Lubna is a seamstress who works for her neighborhood clients and earns a reasonably good income, which allows her to pay the utilities. She is the mother of three daughters and two sons. All of them are studying except the youngest one who is only three years of age. She is a very caring mother and raising her children very well. She wants them to become successful in life by getting a quality education.
 
Her husband has been operating his business for the past nine years and Lubna is very hopeful that after the loan investment his business will be improved further.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making shoes

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a married woman with six children. She is 55 years old and lives in Lapasan Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Remedios operates a vulcanizing shop to earn a living and she's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 from this activity. She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 in addition to her working capital to buy vehicle spare parts. Remedios has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, she wants to build a big house.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Vicki Janeth

texts.es:
Vicki, es comerciante, se dedica a vender antojitos y comida, ella vive con sus tres hijos, todos son menores y dependen de ella, Vicki por ser madre soltera, tuvo que iniciar el negocio para proveerles a sus hijos la alimentación necesaria, ella inicia su trabaja desde las 3:00pm hasta las 7:00pm, el negocio está ubicado en la plaza del lugar, por lo que sus ventas son buenas, ya que por las tardes y las noches los habitantes salen a caminar y consumen de sus alimentos. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de sodas, carnes, verduras, condimentos, además de reparar el chalet, esta será una gran ayuda para Vicki, ya que abastecerá el negocio y podrá mejorar la atención y servicio a los clientes.
La aspiración de ella es que sus hijos se sientan apoyados, que terminen sus estudios y algún día construir su propia casa, teniendo estabilidad y una mejor condición de vida con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vicki is a merchant; she sells fast food and food.  She lives with her three children who are all minors and dependent on her.  Because Vicki’s a single mother, she had to start the business to provide nourishment for her children.  She starts work at 3pm and goes until 7pm.  The business is located in the local square so her sales are good because in the evening and night residents come out to walk around and they buy her meals.

She is asking for a loan to buy soft-drinks, meat, vegetables and condiments as well as to repair the stand.  This will be a great help for Vicki because she’ll stock the business and will be able to give better service and attention to her customers.

Her goal is that her children feel supported, that they complete their schooling and someday build her own house having stability and better living conditions with her children.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, meat, vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en: Yadigar, 55, is a married man who has two sons and one daughter. He manages a milk production business. He has been involved in this business for 9 years. Yadigar is thinking about expanding his business because the income from this business is the only source of income for the family. The monthly profit is about 350 AZN and it is too low to cover all the needs of the family. That is why Yadigar requested a loan of 900 AZN to buy fodder in order to provide for the diet of his animals so that they will increase milk production. He hopes that you will support him and thanks you for understanding.

loans.use: to buy fodder.

loans.name: Ndeye Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye est une mère de 3 enfants qui vit sur le territoire  sénégalais. L’âge  de ses  enfants varie entre 7 et 10 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément  dans  la vente de légumes ou elle capitalise une expérience de 4 ans. Auparavant elle vendait du poisson. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion. Mais elle est surtout intéressée  par les revenus qu’elle y gagne. Elle  est membre d’un  guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis  septembre 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de légumes  a revendre dans le but d’élargir , de diversifier d’avantage et de renforcer son activité de commerce. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permet d’améliorer ses conditions de vie sociales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye lives in Senegal and is the mother of three children, whose ages range from 7 to 10. She's a merchant, selling vegetables, a business in which she has four years of experience. Previously, she used to sell fish.

She chose this business out of passion, but she's especially interested in the income she earns from it. She's been a member of the local branch of Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, since September 2011.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 intended to buy vegetables to resell, in order to expand, bolster and diversify her business. Increasing her profits enables her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Olinda Nora

texts.es:
Olinda es una mujer soltera de 28 años que vive en casa de su padre y que también ayuda económicamente a su familia. Olinda  vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.		
			
Ella es una mujer perseverante, luchadora y empeñosa que desea progresar cada día más, es por eso que con el dinero que pudo ahorrar, cuando trabajaba como obrera en un fundo, logró alquilar una pequeña tienda y compró ropa para vender en la misma, con el tiempo está adquiriendo mayor cantidad de compradores pero con el cambio climático (Invierno a Verano) la gente ha empezado a buscar ropa más fresca debido a la intensa oleada de calor que se siente en Ica, es por esto que gracias al préstamo Kiva Olida podrá comprar ropa de temporada y logrará satisfacer a sus clientes lo que la llevará a poder ahorra y con el tiempo tener un local propio y poder comprarse una casa propia.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 28 year old single woman who lives in her father's house and also financially helps her family.  Olinda lives and works in Ica, Perú.  Ica is located in the Sechura desert nearly four hours south of Lima, the country's capital and is hailed by the Peruvians as "La Tierra del Sol" (The Land of the Sun). It is known in Perú for its frequent earthquakes (one of 8.0 in 2007 and one of 6.9 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps above all, as the origin of the traditional national beverage of Perú, the Pisco. In this hot and dry climate, we find the home and business of this client.		
			
She is a persistant, determined, hard-working, and diligent woman who desires to progress more each day.  It is for this reason that with the money she could save, when she was working as a laborer on a farm, she was able to rent a small store and purchse clothes to sell there.  With time, she is acquiring a greater number of customers, but with the changing seasons (winter to summer), the people have started to look for cooler clothing due to the heat wave felt in Ica.  It is thanks to this Kiva loan that Olinda will be able to purchase seasonal clothing and gain the satisfaction of her customers which will enable her to save and with time, have her own shop and be able to purchase her own home.

loans.use: to buy and sell summer clothes.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells smoked fish at Brase near Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Her desire is to increase the quantity of fish smoked. The loan will aid her to increase her business by buying more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akosua plans to provide a meaningful education for children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 48 años de edad, es viuda y tiene seis hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. Graciela alquila carros a otras personas que brindan servicios de transporte urbano, ella alquila los carros a S/. 25.00 nuevos soles por todo el día. En esta oportunidad Graciela requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros.  
 
El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Graciela is 48 years old. She is a widow and has six children. She was born in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco and she now lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. Graciela hires out cars to third parties who offer urban transport services. She rents out the cars for 25 PEN per day. On this occasion Graciela needs this loan in order to carry out repairs on her cars.

The communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" consists of responsible, hard-working people who help their families get ahead. The majority of its members live in the city of Cusco, where they carry out their business activities. Cusco is renowned for being a tourist and commercial area, for its traditional celebration of Inti Raymi and because it is located near to one of the seven wonders of the world "Machupicchu".

loans.use: to carry out car repairs.

loans.name: Sando

texts.en: Sando is 22 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She’s married to a businessman and the couple has two children, 1 and 5 years old. The children live at home and one attends school. For the past two years, Sando has been selling charcoal.  She was taught how to run the business by her oldest sister. Sando is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos Ernesto de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a sus hijos, el posee un taller de carpintería elabora bancos, mesas, sillas, entre otros,  ya tiene varios años de trabajar en este negocio, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor, su negocio está ubicado en su residencia, es muy visitado por las personas, por lo que se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y un servicio inigualable; Carlos es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante y triunfar en un futuro cercano, desde hace mucho tiempo quiere hacer crecer su negocio pero no posee del suficiente capital  por eso se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera, pegamento, pulidora, martillo, clavos, etc. Carlos Ernesto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una vida mejor.

loans.use: madera, pegamento, pulidora, martillo, clavos

loans.name: Sarjono

texts.en:
Sarjono never gives up! He’s been a farmer for as long as he can remember. He is 34 years old and is married with a nine year old son. They own a small corn farm in Lampung, Indonesia. 

Sarjono has suffered losses in the past because of drought, but that only makes him more determined to succeed and give his son a brighter future. His motto is “loss is just a flick from God to remind you to always be grateful for what you have!”

In the effort to earn more money to support his family, Sarjono also raises cattle, dividing his time between his cows and his crops. He is a busy man! With your help, Sarjono will be able to purchase better quality seeds and fertilisers for next season. With agricultural training provided by Kiva field partner Vasham, Sarjono will be able to continue to send his young son to school!

loans.use: A loan of $400 will help Sarjono to purchase seeds and fertilisers for his corn farm and pay the school fees for his son’s education

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a 56 years old, active and hard-working woman. She is married with Victor who works as electrician, and they have 4 children that love them so much. With the goal to have better incomes, three years ago approximately, she began her small clothes sales business. At the beginning she only sold her used clothes and with the incomes that she was reinvesting. She bought used clothes packages, which has given her very good results.

She is requesting a loan for of $375 USD to purchase merchandise because she wants to proviD. her clients all the articles that they need. She will repay in a term of 4-8 months. Yolanda needs your help and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Yolanda es una mujer D. 56 años, muy activa y trabajadora, ella esta casada con Don Víctor quien trabaja como electricista por su cuenta y tienen 4 hijos. Con el objetivo D. tener mayores ingresos hace aproximadamente tres años que inició su pequeño negocio D. venta D. ropa semi-nueva, al principio vendía solo ropa D. sus familiares y con las ganancias fue reinvirtiendo, comprando pacas D. ropa semi-nueva, lo cual le ha dado muy buenos resultados.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad D. $375 USD para poder comprar más mercancía y poder surtir a sus clientes, el plazo para pagar será D. 4-8 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tjian

texts.en: Tjian N. has lived with her children ever since she got divorced. She makes cookies and sponge cakes to order. Sometimes she even gets an order to cater for parties, such as birthday parties.  She really wants to use the loan to start regular production of her cookies and then sell them near her house to make more income. She sells each box of cookies for $1.50 to $3. She also expects to have more money for her children’s education from her business' profit.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Shakria

texts.en: Shakria lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan with all members of her family. She is uneducated and her husband is a shopkeeper who has a retail shop. His wife took her 4th cycle group loan and her husband bought inventory items like rice, oil, plums, baskets, bags of nuts, pears and limes to make a good business to support his family well. Now his wife wants to take anther loan so that her husband can complete the necessary things he needs to attract more customers. He wants to be a good business dealer in the future.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Hernando is 30 years old, married, and father of 2 children. One is 10 years old and the other is 7. Both go to a private primary school in town. His wife helps generating income to pay for the family expenses; she runs a convenience store from home.

Hernando is a carpenter, he makes furniture on order for companies as well as for furniture stores in the city. He started this profession as a helper for his father, who also was a carpenter, and he learned his woodworking skills from him. He does excellent work and creates well-finished products.

Because of the high quality of his work, he is well-known in the city, and he was able to get two new customers: two schools who ordered tables and chairs for the classrooms. In order to be able to fulfill these orders, he needs a loan of $775 to buy wood, which will help him to start the job.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original loan description in Spanish:

Hernando tiene 30 años, está casado y es padre de dos niños, uno de 10 años y otro de ,7 ambos están cursando la etapa primaria en una escuela de privada de la ciudad. Su esposa lo ayuda con los ingresos y los gastos familiares, ella tiene una despensa que atiende en su casa.

Hernando se dedica a la carpintería, el fabrica muebles bajo pedido para empresas y otros los elabora para proveer a las mueblerías de la ciudad; él empezó en el rubro como ayudante de su padre que también fue carpintero y heredo sus habilidades con la madera, pues sus trabajos son muy buenos y de excelente terminación.

Como la calidad de sus productos es muy bueno y reconocido en la ciudad, el ha conseguido dos clientes nuevos más, son dos colegios que solicitaron mesas y sillas para aulas, para poder cumplir con su demanda necesita un crédito de $ 775 para poder comprar madera que lo ayudara a empezar su trabajo.

loans.use: To buy wholesale wood

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 32 years old, married, and in spite of being so young already has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 14. Her two eldest children attend high school, another is in 5th grade of elementary school, and the youngest has yet to begin school.

Edith recounted with much sadness how she had to work very hard for 10 years in the neighboring country of Argentina, where she managed to start a small dressmaking business after a lot of sacrifices.

With a strong desire to return to Paraguay, Edith sold all of her sewing machines to make enough money to move back. With what she could earn from the sale of her machines, she managed to return to Paraguay, build a house, and start a small convenience store business out of her house.

She started out buying a few goods to sell in her store. With time the business improved, and she began expanding her inventory. Today she is building an additional room to start a small hamburger restaurant. To do this, Edith needs a loan of $800US in order to buy the building materials she needs to finish the room.

Her dream for the future is that her children will be professionals; and, above all, that they will be able to work in their own country without having to immigrate to find work.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lay out security and construct a fence

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.en: I am a mother of six. I have four girls and two boys. My oldest son is done with his studies, and currently he is working. I sew clothes for my neighborhood clients to supplement my husband’s income. My husband is an electrician and he manufactures copper wires. Earlier, we took a loan and my husband invested it in his business.  The returns from this investment enabled us to repay the loan successfully and enroll two of our younger children in school.  Now, he is in the process of expanding his business and wants to buy copper in bulk. For this purpose, he needs a loan of $350.

loans.use: Buy copper in bulk

loans.name: Maria Rocio's Group

texts.en:
Maria Rocio, Maria Victoria, and Edilberta have been part of the community bank “Solución” for five, five, and three years respectively.  They commented that in the community bank they have learned discipline, to be responsible, punctual, and to save.
Maria Rocio is 33 years old and has one son who is still in school.  She sells juices from a stand in the central market.  She also collects a local fruit called a “tuna” which comes from a cactus and travels to Lima on the weekends to sell it.
Maria Victoria is 40 years old and has four children who are all students.  She sells clothing in an open-air market in the town of Huamanga.
Edilberta is 75 years old and has a business selling candies from a cart.  
Their loans are for 2000, 400, and 200 respectively.  Their loans will be invested in expanding their businesses by buying new fruits, vegetables, clothing, and different types of candies.
Maria Rocio, Maria Victoria, and Edilberta think that they will use their savings to improve their houses, to educate their children, to buy medicines which they need, and to improve the quality of life for their families.  Their dreams are to own their own car to help transport merchandise, and to help their children receive an education in order to work as professionals.

loans.use:
Edilberta is 75 years old and has a business selling candies from a cart.  
Their loans are for 2000, 400, and 200 respectively.  Their loans will be invested in expanding their businesses by buying new fruits, vegetables, clothing, and different types of candies.

loans.name: Kanyansheko Group

texts.en: T. Margaret, 39, is married and has 4 children. In addition, she also looks after her cousin. Margaret is the chairperson of Kanyansheko Group and, for the past 8 years, has successfully run a Handcraft business, weaving and selling baskets, mats, and handbags. Her customers are mainly from Mbarara and Ibanda districts. With the help of previous loans and the income from her business, Margaret has bought land, a banana plantation, a coffee shamba, and has paid school fees. With the current loan, she intends to buy another piece of land for a banana plantation to be able to earn more income to support her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of a piece of land for a banana plantation

loans.name: Munnawer's Group

texts.en:
I am Munnawer, a married mother of four. I live with my family in the small town of Arifwala, Pakistan. My husband used to operate a butcher shop but now cannot work anymore. I sell feminine products door to door. Your loan can help me to buy these products in a large quantity and hence increase my income. I would like to borrow in a group of few other women. Nasira B. will use her share of loan to buy sewing machines for her husband, who is a tailor. Ameera M.’s son sells fruits, and Mumtaz requires this loan to expand her grocery store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and we are mutually responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: Buy feminine products in bulk

loans.name: Janeth's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Janeth is 24 years old and is a married woman with one child of 2 years old. Janeth sells soap and clothing, a business she started in 2005. Every day, she works till 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $185 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Yusta, who has a business dealing in food.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria began selling tostadas because making and selling tostadas has been a family tradition for more than 30 years. Her in-laws launched the business and have run it for more than 5 years. Maria began working there in order to support her family while working in a family business.

Today, Maria is asking for a loan of $250, which she will pay back in 6 months, to buy ingredients to make tostadas. With your help, Maria will get ahead.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Maria inició el negocio por ser un negocio familiar y seguir con la tradicion de mas de 30 años en la elaboracion y venta de tostadas,comenzaron el negocio sus suegros y desde hace 5 años es atendido por ellos. Esto lo incio con la finalidad de mantener a su familia y tener un trabajo en un negocio familiar.

Ahora solicita un prestamo poor US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de materia prima para elaborar las tostadas. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante .

loans.use: Purchase tostada ingredients

loans.name: Tauiaupolu

texts.en:
Tauiaiupolu F., 42, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the elei and material printing business. Tauiaiupolu sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Tauiaiupolu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is working and her two sons are very helpful in running the business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, painting materials, brushes and elei woods for the business.

loans.name: Thi Hoa

texts.vi:
Minh Phu is a partially mountainous area. The portion of soil suitable for farming is very small, thus, the people in this village is the poorest as compared to other villages in Soc Son. Before joining the TYM Fund, Mrs. N. Thi Hoa's family was one of the poorest, as their income came from just a small area of farm land and a few chickens. She wanted to purchase a cow to facilitate farming but did not have enough money. It was even more difficult to improve her family's economy. In 1998, she discussed with her husband and joined the TYM Fund to start borrowing money. Her first loan of 1,000,000VND (about 64USD) was used to breed ducks and pigs. After a while, her family's economy slowly improved, and the more important thing is that she was able to accumulate an amount of capital. Since 2003, she has always been borrowing the maximum amounts allowed to expand her model of breeding ducks and pigs, so her family's economy has continued to improve further. Currently, she has 10 pigs waiting to be sold to butchers and about 500 pigs giving eggs everyday so it is convenient for her to repay the loan. Her monthly income from raising livestock is about 5,500,000VND (about 354USD), part of it is used for her family's spending, so she has purchased enough basic household equipments. She could also afford to construct a concrete house and is now preparing to build a second storey. This time, she would like to borrow 19,000,000VND (1,150.00USD) to invest in raising livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Minh Phú là vùng đất bán sơn địa, ruộng đất trồng lúa ít chủ yếu là đất gò đồi nên cuộc sống của người dân nơi đây khá vất vả và nghèo nhất huyện. Khi chưa tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Hoa là một hộ khó khăn của xã, cả gia đình chỉ dựa vào mấy xào ruộng và chăn nuôi mấy con gà. Muốn mua con bò để cày bừa cũng không có vốn, muốn phát triển kinh tế lại càng khó khăn. Năm 1998 gia đình chị bàn bạc và xin tham gia Quỹ để được vay vốn, với số vốn vay vòng 1 là 1.000.000 đồng chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và nuôi lợn, sau một thời gian sử dụng vốn vay của Quỹ, kinh tế gia đình chị đã khá hơn, và quan trọng hơn là chị đã tích lũy được một số vốn. Từ năm 2003 đến nay anh chị luôn vay vốn với mức cao nhất để mở rộng chăn nuôi vịt đẻ, lợn thịt và lợn nái đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển. Hiện nay trong chuồng còn 10 con lợn thịt chuẩn bị xuất chuồng và gần 500 con vịt đẻ trứng nên việc hoàn trả tiền tuần rất thuận lợi. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi mỗi tháng khoảng 5.500.000đ, một phần chị dành cho việc chi tiêu và hiện tại gia đình chị đã sắm sửa đầy đủ tiện nghi sinh hoạt. Quan trọng hơn chị đã xây được nhà mái bằng và chuẩn bị vật liệu xây thêm tầng 2. Vòng vốn nay gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 50 años, es soltera y vive con su hijo Rider de 16 años.  
Se dedica a tiempo completo a su restaurante, llamado, “Flor de Amancaes” que instaló en su casa para mantenerse económicamente, usualmente trabaja desde las mañanas, ofreciendo el desayuno; al medio día, almuerzos variados y por las noches la cena, el trabajo es duro, casi todo el tiempo está cocinando y atiende durante todo el día. Una jornada diaria empieza a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 9 de la noche, felizmente cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo.La sazón de Angélica es muy apreciada por los clientes de su zona, desde muy pequeña le ha gustado cocinar, la dificultad está en abastecerse para atender a todos los clientes que frecuentan su restaurante.
Angélica quiere que su único hijo sea un gran profesional, para que en el futuro forme una familia provechosa a la sociedad.
Con el dinero del préstamo arreglará su local, para que sea más cómodo, comprar más mesas,  ampliar su negocio y si es posible contratar a un ayudante, para que en un futuro cercano su restaurante sea mucho más grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Angelica is 50 years old, single, and lives with her 16 year old son Rider. She works full time in her restaurant called "Flor de Amancaes" (Lily Flower) that she put in her house in order to support herself economically. She usually starts work serving breakfast in the morning, various lunches at midday, and dinner in the evening. The work is hard, she is cooking almost all the time and serving all day long. On a typical day she starts at 6 in the morning and ends at 9 at night. Happily she can rely on the help of her son. Angelica's recipes are much appreciated by the clients in her area, although she has just recently begun to enjoy cooking. The hard part is stocking up in order to serve all the clients who frequent her restaurant.

Angelica wants her only son to be a professional, so that in the future he can build a family beneficial to society.

With the money from the loan, she will remodel her premises, making them more comfortable. She will buy more tables, increase the size of her business, and if possible, hire a helper, so that in the near future her restaurant will be much larger and more productive.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge and remodel her restaurant to make it cozier, as well as to hire a helper to help with serving.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es:
Geronimo C.  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
 
Vive. en la comunidad Pomamaya de la Provincia  Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa, y su hijo menor. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Geronimo C. raises cattle (dairy cows) for a living. He sells his cows’ milk to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche—industrial milk processing plant). He lives in the community of Pomamaya in the Murillo Province, department of La Paz, which is located 3 hours away from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and their young son. This loan will be used to purchase better breeds of cow so that he can increase milk production and in so doing increase his income. This is his second loan with Impro. His credit evaluation qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Gulnor

texts.ru:
Полвонова Гулнор, 1970 года рождения, замужем и у них 4 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. У нее 8 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Она торгует на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района. У нее в ассортименте детская одежда, начиная с младенца до школьного возраста. Это комплект детской одежды, джемпера, джинсовые брюки и костюмы,  носки, нижнее белье и т.д.. У Гульнор есть постоянных клиенты, которые приходя к ней хотят видеть новые товары. Гульнора постоянно обновляет свой товар чтоб не потерять постоянных клиентов. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Гульнор хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 3500 сомони чтоб закупить сезонный товар, детские джинсовые брюки и костьюмы.
texts.en:
Gulnor P. was born in 1970, married and has four children. She started her business selling children's clothes. She has eight years of experience in this field. She sells on the Muboriz market in the Gissar region. In her assortment there is children's clothing for todlers and school age kids. There are items such as sweaters, jeans and suits, socks, underwear and more. Gulnor has regular customers who come to her for new merchandise. Gulnor always updates her inventory so that she does not lose her returning clients. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon. Gulnor wants to receive a loan with the help of Kiva for the amount of 3500 somoni (USD$1,050) to buy seasonal merchandise, children's jean pants and jackets.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's jean pants and jackets

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. is 48 years old and a married mother of four children. Her children are currently in school. Beatrice sells frozen food in the local market to support her family.  She says demand is high, but she does not have the capital required to meet the demand. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen food, so she can earn enough income to support her children's education. She is a member of the group called Angels. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: The purchase of cartons of frozen food like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Maritess lives in Brgy. Cabisera 18 Ilagan, Isabela, is married to a rice and corn farmer named Patricio. They are blessed with four children aged 23, 21, 14 and 2. They have not sent any of their children to college because they do not have the money to support their education, but they dream to send their third child in college soon through the help of their business.

Maritess' small store has been a great help not only to her family, but to her fellow villagers since they can get their daily needs without going into town. She also offers reasonable prices and even provides credit to those with good paying capacity.  

She wants to add more products in her store to maximize her income but she does not have the needed money so she is asking for a loan of PHP7,000 to fulfill her plan. A portion of the loan proceeds will be also used to finance their farm.

She also dreams to eventually have a grocery store since she believes that her 18 years of experience in managing a store is enough to run a bigger store. They firmly believe they will be able to send their two youngest children to college and provide a better life for their family by helping each other.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Bané

texts.fr: Bané S. est une femme mariée, mère d’un enfant. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour subvenir aux besoins familiaux et ainsi améliorer leurs conditions de vie. Elle projette d’acheter en gros des produits d’entretien qu’elle va revendre en détail
texts.en:
Bané S. is married and has one child. She is asking for this loan to pay for her family's needs and to improve their living conditions. She plans to buy household cleaning products in bulk which she will then sell retail.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household cleaning products in bulk to retail.

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng C. is a villager in Lvea village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Prum Soeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  He has a problem with this plantation because his field is infertile which is badly affecting to his crop. Thus, Mrs. Seng C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Funmilola

texts.en: Funmilola is 35 years old and married with two children. She sells spare motor parts. She needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more spare motor parts to sell. She hopes to expand this business. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Vladimir Ramon

texts.es: El señor Vladimir reside en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo, tiene 49 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y sus hijos están casados. Don Vladimir tiene una venta de ricas fritanga que desde hace quince años inicio, lo cual lo hizo con fondos propios, vendiendo carne asada esto lo hizo con el objetivo  de obtener ingresos para su familia y cubrir sus necesidades. Con este crédito desea comprar un exhibidor de comida, a si como frutas y verduras para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas lo cual con esto espera captar clientes y vender más fritanga para obtener mejores utilidades. A corto plazo va comprar sillas y mesas de plástico.
texts.en:
Vladimir resides in the neighbourhood of Casimiro Sotelog. He is 49 years old, his wife is a housewife and his children are married. Don Vladimir has a business selling delicious fritanga. He began this 15 years ago, which he did with his own funds, selling barbecued meat. He began this with the objective of obtaining earnings for his family and to cover their necessities. With this loan he wishes to buy a display cabinet for food and fruit and vegetables, to give a better service to his clients and expand his sales. With this he hopes to capture the attention of his clients and sell more fritanga to obtain more usefulness. In the short term he is going to buy plastic tables and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a food display cabinet and fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Bahtigul

texts.ru: Бахтигул одна из активнейших клиентов МикроИнвест. Она была одной из тех кто первыми получил займ МикроИнвест и сейчас она продолжает кредитоваться. Займы сыграли в ее бизнесе решающую роль. Кроме расширения бизнеса она смогла устроить быт своей семьи: купила телевизор, двд-проигрыватель, провела мелкий ремонт квартиры. Бахтигул 37 лет, у нее 3 детей. Продает детскую одежду и разные мелкие товары. Сейчас она собирается немного обновить свой ассортимент и поэтому решила получить новый займ.
texts.en:
Bahtigul is one Microinvest's most active clients. She was one of the first people to receive a loan from Microinvest, and she continues to use credit. Loans played a decisive role in development of her business. And in addition to expanding the business, she has been able to provide for her household; buying a television, DVD player, and making some repairs to the apartment. Bahtigul is 37 years old and has three children. She sells children's clothing and various other small products. She is planning to refresh her inventory a bit, and so decided to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To upgrade inventory

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 21 year old woman who lives with her husband in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Fatima has owned a mobile phone shop since 2007.

She requested a loan of 1000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop and to start selling mobile phone recharge cards. This is the first time that Fatima has requested a loan.

Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty. Fatima decided on starting her business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop and to start selling mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Phương Nguyễn Thị, 55 years old, is a woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four adult-aged children. Phương earns a living by owning and operating a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The primary source of income for the business comes primarily from raising water buffalo for sale. Phương has been engaged in this business for over seven years, and she earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Phương joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Phương has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and, eventually, to sell.

Phương is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Phương plans to use the additional revenue that she expects her business to generate from this loan to improve and expand her business ventures.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Santos Zenaida

texts.es: La Señora Santos Zenaida X. T. cuenta con 24 años de edad, Casada con un hijo “Graduada de la carrera de Maestra de Enseñanza” Actualmente está Prestando servicios en la comunidad de Nimasac Municipios y departamento de Totonicapán Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que vive  son muy complicadas por lo que solicito  un préstamo  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y así poder comprar una estufa para poder cocinar sus alimentos  ya que son ingresos son muy bajos y adquiriendo esta necesidad facitará la preparación de sus alimentos y así poder aprovechar el tiempo para seguir trabajando en su segunda jornada laborar, como también ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Zenaida X. is 24 years old and is married. She has a son. She is a graduate of the course of Teacher of Education. Currently she is using her services in the community of Nimasac, in the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. The conditions in which she lives are very difficult, and so she is asking for a loan from ASDIR. This would enable her to buy a stove to be able to cook her food because their income is very low. Acquiring this necessity would enable the preparation of their food and so she would be able to make the most of the time in order to continue working in her second job, and also to help increase their income and to give a better life to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land that is near town and has a good supply of water

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Mrs. Morm C., 44 years old, lives with her family in the rural area of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been local crop farmers for over nine years, selling their mature produce every two months to earn profit. Morm C. will be using this Kiva loan to grow a rice crop during the approaching farming season. They have six children who are still young and under their care.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop during this approaching farming season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 45-year-old mother of five operating her food kiosk business in the Mukuru slum of Nairobi, where she lives. She is asking for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to expand her business. She hopes that one day she will own a big restaurant and provide catering services, so as to educate her children to the highest level possible. She describes herself as faithful and friendly.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking microfinance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To expand a food business

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa E. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 62 years old. Josefa is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be Josefa's fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital
